loans.name: Chhon

texts.en: Mrs. S., 40, sells a variety of vegetables in Psa Takhmao Market,  earning approximately $5 profit a day.  The vegetables that she sells are either bought in bulk from suppliers or grown on her own farmland next to her house. S. and her husband Moeun Pov, 41, who shares responsibility for his family by working as a local farmer, help each other  to earn money so they can meet the needs of their three young children, all of whom attend school.  Due to insufficient capital, S.'s income is relatively low, so she is requesting a Kiva loan to accrue the capital necessary to expand her vegetable trade.

loans.use: To accrue the capital necessary to expand her vegetable trade.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase sodas, juices, sandwich ingredients, and snack foods

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Naseem akhtar has applied for a loan for her husband, who will buy a welding machine for his welding business.
 
Naseem akhtar operates a business selling spools of thread. She gets the thread from used warm-weather clothes. Her two daughters also help her in this work. She has six years of experience in this business. Her income helps her to share the financial responsibilities of her family.
 
They belong to a mid-sized city called Vehari in Pakistan. They own a small two-room house in the area named "People's Colony." She thinks that an investment in her husband’s business will enable him to weld more equipment for his customers and generate more profit. She also has a desire to marry her oldest daughter in the coming year with the help of profits generated by the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a welding machine

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married with one daughter who is attending college. Oksana is in the grocery sales business selling a variety of food products in the busy central market. She has two kiosks and hires a lady to help her with sales.

Oksana started her business thirteen years ago selling tea and coffee at one of the local markets. She saved her money and was able to expand, setting up a second kiosk in the central city market. She is an entrepreneur of integrity – very punctual and communicative. She manages a very brisk trade at her vending kiosks and many loyal customers keep coming back because of her friendly attitude, cheerful nature and willingness to serve them well.

Oksana would like a loan of 12,200 UAH to expand the range of food products she has available such as coffee, tea, candy, chocolates, mayonnaise, and vegetable oil. She is planning to purchase these groceries wholesale so that she can get a good price.

Income generated from Oksana’s business will allow her to invest more in her daughter’s education as well as provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: To expand the range of food products she has available

loans.name: Phai

texts.en:
Mrs. Phai Y., age 51, makes a living by selling vegetables. She became a vegetable trader in 2000 and sells the vegetables both retail and wholesale. She goes to buy them in bulk at a reasonable price from the rural farmers. She currently earns an average of US$4 a day, and has been running her business for several years. Her husband is 51 years old and is a construction employee who works around the community.

Phai Y. is the mother of four teenage kids, who are no longer in school. All of her children are working at various occupations, and they each contribute some of their incomes to help the family meet its daily expenses.

Phai Y. faces a big obstacle: her house is cracking since the heavy rainy season started, and the family’s living conditions are often bad. She hopes to resolve this problem by asking for a loan to use towards repairing her old house.

loans.use: To use towards repairing her old house

loans.name: Thoun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoun K., 66 years old, was selected as the leader of a group loan by its six members located in Chi Khmol village, Takeo province. Each member of the group loan will use it to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Thoun K. is a farmer who owns 3-hectares of land to cultivate rice. She works very hard to support her two children. With this loan, she was able to buy fertilizer to grow rice. She wants to use the rest of the loan to buy one piglet for breeding. Mrs. Thoun K. is a widow with two children, who are seamstresses in the garment factory. Mr. Tim Mark is the group guarantor and he is presented in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow rice

loans.name: Taj Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Taj bibi lives in the city of Vehari with her husband and three children. Her husband is a daily-wage laborer. He works for a meager income which led Taj bibi to operate her own business to support the financial needs of the family.

Taj bibi is a working woman: she sells clothes, purchasing them from the cities of Faisalabad (famous for its textiles) and Multan and selling them in her city, in her local market and in her community to earn a profit.

Taj bibi has applied for a loan from Asasah for her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she will buy a variety of clothes to minimize her cost of purchasing and to fulfill larger orders.

All of Taj bibi’s children are getting their education. She wants her children to become successful in life and she thinks that by increasing her profits she can give them a better education so that they become successful.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Mrs. R., 35, sells various kinds of vegetables in a local market to earn a living. She buys the vegetables in bulk from farmers or wholesale suppliers and sells them retail to people who come to buy something for their cooking. She is able to generate $4 a day to cover the family expenses.

R. is married to Sochea, age 38, who shares the responsibility for his family by working as a construction worker. They are good parents to their four children who are young and attending the public school.

R. is concerned that her business has come to a low capacity due to insufficient capital. She wishes to obtain more money by requesting a loan to use towards increasing her capital which will allow her to improve her profits. She will use any remaining money from the loan to mend her old house.

loans.use: To increase her business capital and to mend her old house

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, a mother of four, is 47 years old. She is a hardworking entrepreneur and wants to be able to help her children. She makes and sells ice cream products and closely works with her husband as ice cream vendor. She started the business ten years ago to help her family meet education, water, electricity and food expenses as everything is very expensive.

Teresita will use the loan to buy more ingredients of her ice cream products, so she needs more capital to meet the demand of her customers in the local area where she sells her ice cream. She is pleased because, in the past, she has managed to utilize the loans to invest in her business.

With working principal Teresita’s business will keep on growing and she will be able to give pleasing service to her regular customers. Through the support of KIVA lenders, Teresita hopes to see herself and her family soon improve their quality of living and move away from under the twist of being poor.
 
Teresita’s long-term goal is to have an ice cream booth a few years from now so that she can give an opportunity of employment to others, specially her extended relatives in their barangay (village). Teresita hopes to maintain a long-term, sustainable ice cream business.

During the course of her membership in ASHI, Teresita has been a model member, dedicated to managing her family’s operations.

loans.use: To buy more ice cream products to sell

loans.name: Suriya Begam's Group

texts.en:
Suriya Begam’s husband is a carpenter and she does embroidery work to help support her family. She has applied for a loan from Asasah to assist her brother-in-law who wants to establish a clothes-selling business. 

Suriya is very helpful and tries to do her best for people in her family or even outside of her family. She thinks that if her brother-in-law becomes successful with the help of loan money then it will give her great mental satisfaction that she has helped someone in need. 

She is also a very hard-working lady. She operates her domestic-sewing business and helps her family with her earnings.

loans.use: Purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Nasreen Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen bibi lives in a mid-sized city called Vehari in Pakistan with her seven children and her husband. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by trade.  Three of her sons work to financially support the family while others are getting their education. One drives a rickshaw, another has a transport business, and the last one works in a vegetables and fruit market. 

Nasreen bibi is also a big helping hand for her family financially as she does embroidery work for her neighborhood clients. She has applied for a loan to buy a new auto-rickshaw for her husband as his old rickshaw is not in condition to work well.

Note: In this group there are two ladies named Yasmeen who also have the same last  name (husband's name).

loans.use: Purchase a new rickshaw

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal S., 32 years old, is the village bank president selected by its thirteen members located in Kanhchum village, Takeo province. The members of this village group will use this loan to support their different purposes and hope to increase their incomes to improve their families' standard of living.

Mrs. Sophal S. and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Ken, are farmers who own 1.20-hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living. They work very hard with the farm to support their family. In order to increase income, Mrs. Sophal S. decided to ask for a loan to buy chickens and chicken food for breeding. This couple has three children, who are students in the local school.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken food for breeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase CDs, DVDs, and Play Station 2 games

loans.name: Mean's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of 12 people located in Kanlaeng Khla village in Takeo province. Mrs. Mean T. is the village bank president. She was selected by the members. With the loan, they hope to increase their income to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Mean T. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Tonh K., is a construction worker and he also helps his wife on the farm. In order to increase their income, Mrs. Mean T. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to breed. She will use the rest of the loan to pay for farm labor. This couple has two children who are construction workers. 

One of the group members is blocked in the picture.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pay for farm labor

loans.name: Toun

texts.en:
Mr. N. is a hard-working man who has been earning a living as a fish raiser. He owns a pond in the village where he raises a hundred kg of fish. He catches and sells the fish to middlemen after raising them for four months.

 Additionally, N. plants a few crops around the pond for extra income. He has a life partner in his wife who works sewing clothes in the garment industry (she also appears in the photo). They married some years ago but don’t have any children yet. 

N. has been feeding his fish for two months but they are not growing well due to the lack of food. Because of that, N. is applying for a loan to be used to purchase many sacks of fish food to fatten his fish and improve his yield.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of fish food to improve fish yield.

loans.name: Phon's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. P. T. is 38 years old and has been selected as the village bank president by this ten member group, located in Kanlaeng Khla village in Takeo province. Each member of this group loan will use their portion of the loan for their own different purposes.  
Mrs. P. T. is a silk weaver who is able to earn a small income to support her family, while her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Tes, is a construction worker. This couple has one child, who is attending the local school.
Mrs. P. T. decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk to expand her business activities.

loans.use: To buy more silk to expand silk weaving business

loans.name: Lidiya

texts.en:
Lidiya is married with two children. She sells clothing at one of small markets in Kherson town. Lidiya has been in this business for 10 years. Her profit is about 5,000 UAH per month.

Lidiya is a disciplined and honest person. She has used micro-loans before and has always paid them back on time. Her polite attitude attracts many customers. Many of them come back to her again. Lidiya has a good family where all the members respect one another. Lidiya is also respected by her colleagues at the market. She encourages them with her enthusiasm when the sales drop.

Lidiya is requesting a loan of 9,800 UAH to purchase more inventory. She hopes to increase sales and make additional income.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Eusebio Julio

texts.pt:
Eusébio Júlio M. vive no Distrito de Boane, província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique. No passado empréstimo conseguiu comprar todo o material que esteve previsto no seu pedido e também foi suficiente para o que pretendia. Conseguiu pagar a sua letra segundo o calendário estabelecido e houve muita melhoria na sua vida e conseguiu avançar bastante a sua obra.
O projecto de construção da sua casa está na sua ultima fase. Na sua vida o que melhorou é de ver a sua obra na sua fase conclusiva. O presente empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00mt pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, tinta e outros) para concluir a sua residência.
Esta muito satisfeito com o empréstimo, esta conseguindo alcançar o seu sonho. No futuro pretende solicitar mais crédito para mobilar a sua casa e confortar a sua família.
texts.en:
Eusébio Júlio M. lives in Boane District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. With his previous loan he bought all the material that was listed in his application, and the loan was also enough for what he wanted to do. He managed to pay off his loan on time, and there was much improvement in his life, and he managed to advance his construction project greatly. His home construction project is in its final phase. What has improved in his life is seeing the project in its final phase. With the current loan of 12,000 meticais, he intends to buy construction materials (sand, cement, paint and other items) to finish his home. Eusébio is very satisfied with the loan; he is achieving his dream. In the future, he intends to request more loans to furnish his house and make his family comfortable.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (sand, cement, paint, etc.)

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheap O. is 33 years old and has been selected as the village bank president by this ten member group, located in Kanlaeng Khla village in Takeo province. With the loans, the group members are able to increase their incomes to improve the living standards of their families.

Mrs. Pheap O. and her husband, Mr. Khloeng Khann, are farmers who own 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice. They also sell groceries in the local village and are able to earn a small income to support their family. The couple have five children; four are attending the local school while the youngest is three years old.

Mrs. Pheap O. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate rice. The remainder of the loan will be used to purchase more groceries to resell.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a variety of fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 47 years old; she lives with her husband and her only son, Ranjit, in a house she owns. She has been dedicating herself to bamboo set (furniture) making since she joined ASHI in 1994, but approximately 5 years ago, she also started a fishing business & fish selling, bordering her community. This is how she earns a weekly gross, and she can also count on the help of her husband and her son. 

As this business has proved to be profitable, she will keep on working in this field; her aim is to increase her working capital. She will be very responsible with her payments and she is thankful to all Kiva lenders who support the loan she is requesting, which will be very useful to make her business grow. The loan will be used to buy another "bangka" (fishing boat); remaining funds will be used to purchase raw materials for her bamboo set business and increase her working capital.

The capital will fund further expansion of the family ventures to support her dreams for her family to have a decent way of life. 

Yolanda is a hard-working entrepreneur, always looking for opportunities to grow. Through her daily work, she is building a better future for her family.

loans.use: To buy another fishing boat and purchase raw materials for her bamboo set making business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann O. is from the village of Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Mary Ann is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Ann operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as biscuits, candies, cooking oil, soy sauce, vinegar, shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Mary Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Mary Ann from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Zita A. is a widow who lives in Brgy. 8, Tanjay City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by buying and selling dried fish.

Zita joined Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF)-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of two previous loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and through her hard work, Zita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP enabled her to earn a monthly profit of 8,000 PHP, which helped to improve her family's standard of living.

This time, for her 3rd cycle loan, she is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 13,000 PHP ($300), which she intends to use to buy an additional stock of dried fish. In turn, she hopes to continue to save up to expand her business. Zita A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, NWTF is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 per day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, which is a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional fish

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rodolfa

texts.en:
Rodolfa C. is a 58-year-old, married woman who supports her family by operating a tailoring business. She lives in Proper, Brgy. Azagra, Tanjay City, Negros Oriental.

She has been a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF)-Project Dungganon since 2001, and she has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her tailoring business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of 4,000 PHP.

Rodolfa is now seeking to borrow 20,000 PHP ($450) so that she can purchase additional fabric. Notably, this would be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her last loan, which was in the amount of 18,000 PHP and which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Rodolfa aspires to improve her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, NWTF is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 per day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, which is a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional fabric

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mr. Sok P. is a hard-working man who has spent his life cultivating crops. He is an older man. His wife appears in the photo. He owns a few ponds in which he grows lotus flowers. Three months after planting, he harvests them to sell. His wife sells the lotus to people who need it for ceremonies to bless the god. This couple has six children, two of whom are now married and have started new homes. The remaining four are single. Sok P. has had great success growing lotus flowers, which is an annual process. He is able to plant the crops at least twice a year. Dry weather is expected in the beginning of this year, and it may affect Sok P.’s business. He faces a difficult season if he is not able to irrigate his crop. Sok P. is taking out his first loan to purchase a machine that he uses to pump water for his crops.

loans.use: To purchase a machine to pump water for crops

loans.name: Batbold

texts.en:
Batbold G. is a 41-year-old who lives with his wife and daughter in Uvurhangai province, in central Mongolia. He and his family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His daughter attends a local secondary school while his wife helps with the business. 

Batbold operates a small cafeteria in his town. His cafeteria specializes in a variety of meals. Batbold started his business in 2007 by cooking meals at a small rented place in the center of his town. After years of successful operation, his earnings enabled him to build a house for his family. 

Batbold is now thinking about expanding further and hopes to soon open his own small cafeteria. He is a modest, open-minded and productive person who is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more supplies, food ingredients for his business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory to prepare dishes

loans.name: Burentsog

texts.en:
Burentsog J. is 21 years old and lives with his mother in Hovd province in western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a house. Burentsog operates a retail meat business with the help of his mother in his town. He began his business in 1999 and after several years of operation, he has managed to establish himself in the business community. He has individual customers who buy his meat on a regular basis. 

Because of his business success, he has managed to increase his business working capital and is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a large amount of meat which he will use for his business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena A. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Pansil, Brgy. Azagra, Tanjay City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by buying and selling rice. Her husband, Rico, who is 52 years old, works as a laborer to earn a living. They have five children, who are between the ages of 18 and 30 years old.

Lucena joined Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF)-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of 16 previous loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and through her own hard work, Lucena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her last loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP enabled her to earn a monthly profit of 6,000 PHP, which helped to improve her family's standard of living.

This time, for her 17th cycle loan, she is seeking to borrow 10,000 PHP ($225), which she intends to use to purchase additional fertilizer and rice. In turn, she hopes to continue to save up so that she can purchase a tricycle and perform home repairs. Lucena A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, NWTF is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 per day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, which is a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional fertilizer and rice

loans.name: Hajidmaa

texts.en:
Hajidmaa T. is a 36-year-old single mother who lives with her three children and her mother in Uvurhangai province, central Mongolia, in a 2-storey- house. Hajidmaa currently operates a clothing business in her town to support her family. She started her business in 1997 and since then she has been operating it in a stable fashion out of a rented stall at the local market. She has found success in her new trade and attributes this to her good business knowledge and selling skills. 

Hajidmaa has purchased a new container where she will sell her products and work separately and independently from her friends. Hajidmaa is very hard-working, optimistic and is persistent in achieving her goal. She has been considered as a reliable borrower of Xacbank. She says, "My business is continuing quite well. I began running it with my friends, but now I am able to employ a salesperson. I am trying  my best to own my own store with the help of my children,  and I wish them to grow up to be highly educated people in the future." Hajidmaa is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan to purchase and import more clothes from Erlian city in China for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Bernarditha

texts.en:
Bernarditha M. is a 51-year-old woman who supports her family by selling “POSO” (rice wrapped in young coconut leaves), fish vending and tailoring. She lives in Brgy. Tangki, Naga, Cebu City with her husband and their five children who are between 21-25 years old, already with their own families.

A member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007, Bernarditha has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. Bernarditha now earns an average monthly income of Php 15,000.

Bernarditha is now borrowing Php 10,500, her sixth loan from NWTF-Projectto Dungganon, to use as additional working capital. Her previous loan of Php 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Bernarditha aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Orolmaa

texts.en:
Orolmaa D. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and one son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband currently works as a driver in a private company in Ulaanbaatar. Her son attends a district middle school. 

Orolmaa lives in a 'ger', which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent  with her family. She operates a meat sales business in Bayanzurh, one of the biggest and most crowded markets located in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, and provides a variety of meats for her customers. She started her meat sales business in 2000 and has gained much business experience over the years. 

Today she has a very loyal customer base, and her working capital exceeds 3,000,000 MNT with the daily revenues of 150,000 to 300,000 MNT. For the future, Orolmaa is planning to expand her business, and hopes to one day own her own workspace. She is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan in order to increase her working capital so as to purchase more meat.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Laneta

texts.en:
Laneta O., a married woman living in Sitio Bonbon, Brgy. Azagra, Tanjay City, Negros Oriental, earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Godofredo, who is 51 years old, works as a farmer and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children ranging in age from 14 to 29 years old.

Laneta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Laneta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 2,500, thereby raising the family's standard of living.

This time, for her 10th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 16,000 to buy stock for her general store so that she can continue to save up for her children's future education and do home repairs. Laneta O. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a community member who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her store

loans.name: Purevdorj

texts.en:
Purevdorj is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Hovd province, western Mongolia. His elder son attends a local middle school, and his younger son goes to a kindergarten, while his wife works as a cook in their town. 

Purevdorj owns a successful taxi service. In 2004, he began his business and his daily revenues reach 10,000 to 15,000 MNT. Purevdorj is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase construction and building materials in order to complete his house.

loans.use: To purchase construction and building materials in order to complete his house

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 58 years old and she sells dried fish and operates a fish cage business. She started her businesses since joining ASHI in 1995, as an additional source of income but they already are bringing in profit as a main source. Nenita`s weekly profit is 3,000 Php and she is going to increase it. For this reason she applied for a loan in the amount of 45,000 PHP. She says that selling dried fish and fresh fish in an open-air stall is not easy as it is very hot, therefore Nenita wishes to save enough money to construct her own booth.

As a loving mother, Nenita’s biggest dreams are always for her children and family. She wants to bring her family to a decent life. In 1995, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and a Kiva partner in the Philippines. She hoped to have access to capital to establish her businesses. Her previous loans from ASHI were carefully utilized as additional and rolling working capital for her fish cage and for selling dried fish products. The businesses are a big help for the family in covering their expenses and to set aside savings for the future.

To save for her family’s future and for supplementary income, Nenita wants to build new businesses: RTW (ready-to-wear clothes) and food preparation. Nenita wants to thank Kiva lenders who are sponsoring this loan. That is one of the greatest opportunities for her to start reaching for her dreams.

loans.use: To support her fish cage business and dried fish sales

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe B. is from the village of Santa Felomena, Iligan City. She is 56 years old. Fe is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Fe owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies like 'puto' (a variety of rice cake), hotcakes, and 'siopao' (steamed bun with a variety of fillings) in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Chrislene

texts.en:
Chrislene D. is a 30 year-old woman who supports her family by breeding and selling balot (fertilized duck eggs). She lives with her with common-law husband and a child who is a year and four months old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her balot business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 6,000.

Chrislene is borrowing Php 12,000 to use as additional working capital. This will be her fifth cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Chrislene aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure its future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a community member who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Togtbayar

texts.en:
Togtbayar M. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and child in Hovd province, western Mongolia. Her daughter goes to a local kindergarten while her husband drives a taxi in the city. 

Togtbayar operates a women's clothing and lingerie retail business from a stall at a local clothing market. She sells a variety of different clothing items and accessories and her wide product selection attracts many customers. She started her clothing business in 2001, selling only women's lingerie items. But due to the increase of the number of businesspeople who were engaged in the same operation, she managed to enlarge the range of products and after finding success and achieving stable business operations, she expanded her product line to include lingerie and clothing. 

Togtbayar is a very open-minded and sociable woman and is well known by her customers. She is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothing items for her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Arcanjo Bartolomeu

texts.pt:
Arcanjo Bartolomeu M. vive no Distrito de Boane, província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique. No empréstimo passado conseguiu comprar todo o material que esteve previsto e também o credito foi suficiente. Não conseguiu pagar a sua letra segundo o calendário estabelecido devido a doença que afectou a sua família, mas no fim conseguiu regularizar a situação.
O projecto de construção da sua casa esta indo de forma satisfatoria, prevendo ainda dar continuidade com o que falta. Na sua vida o que melhorou muito é o seu negocio e também obteve mais um filho. O presente empréstimo no valor de 11.000.00mt pretende comprar roupa usada diversa  para aumentar o seu stock.
Esta muito satisfeito com o empréstimo, esta conseguindo reformar a sua residência e pretende solicitar mais crédito para concluir a sua casa.
texts.en:
Arcanjo Bartolomeu M. lives in Boane District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. With the previous loan he bought all the material that was listed on his application, and he had enough credit. He did not manage to pay off his loan on schedule because of an illness that affected his family, but in the end he managed to rectify the situation. His home construction project is going satisfactorily, and he is predicting he will finish what is left. What has improved greatly in Arcanjo's life is his business, and he also had a son. With the current loan of 11,000 meticais, he intends to buy assorted used clothing to increase his stock. Arcanjo is very satisfied with the loan. He is managing to renovate his home and intends to request more loans to finish his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of assorted used clothing

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. S., 41, owns and operates a rice commerce where the main activity is buying and selling rice. Also, she goes to purchase rice in bulk from the rural farmers and stocks it for a while before selling it to increase her profit. She has another financial earner in her husband who currently is engaged in a recycled goods business. The family takes care of two kids who are attending school. 

Recently, S. purchased a hundred kg of rice from the regular middlemen but she can’t satisfy the needs of her customers due to the lack of funds. Therefore, S. decided to request a loan as capital to order buy more rice and resell it to gain income.

loans.use: to buy more rice so as to make more profit

loans.name: Ma. Clarence

texts.en:
Ma. Clarence B. is from the village of P-Jasmin, Iligan City. She is 37 years old. Ma. Clarence is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Clarence owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling eggs and also making home-made peanut butter  products to sell in the local community. Ma. Clarence has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ma. Clarence joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Clarence has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ma. Clarence is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: P-Jasmin, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 28 years old and married.  He has two children, who are 2 and 3 years old. 

Joseph is a blacksmith by profession.  He also farms to get more income.  He has been a blacksmith for three years and hopes to be the major supplier of cooking pots and jars in his area of residence, so he works hard to grow his business.  Joseph has requested a loan of Kes. 50,000 to buy raw materials such as plain iron sheets, old energy-saving stoves known as jikos, and old cutlery to make cooking pots and jars.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as plain iron sheets

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. M. C. is 43 years old and has been selected as the village bank president by this nine member group, located in Kanlaeng Khla village in Takeo province. With the loans, the group members hope to increase their incomes to improve the living standards of their families. 

Mrs. M. C. is a farmer who works very hard to support her eight children while her husband is a basket seller who is able to earn a small income to add to his wife's earnings to support their family. The couple has eight children; three are seamstresses in the garment factory, two are students in the local school while the youngest child is two years old. 

In order to increase their income, Mrs. M. C. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food for breeding and to buy more baskets to support her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Fatima Joao

texts.pt:
Fátima João Boene vive em B., província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique. No passado empréstimo conseguiu comprar todo o material que esteve previsto e também foi suficiente para o que pretendia. Conseguiu ainda pagar a sua letra segundo o calendário estabelecido.
A sua obra está bastante avançada, prevendo ainda dar continuidade com o que falta e ainda houve melhoria na sua vida porque subiu de categoria no seu emprego de professorado e também obteve o segundo filho. O presente empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, areia, blocos e outros) para dar continuidade com a obra da sua casa. 
Esta muito satisfeito com o empréstimo, esta conseguindo reformar a sua residência e pretende solicitar mais crédito para concluir a sua casa e continuar com os estudos.
texts.en:
Fátima João Boene lives in B., province of Maputo, in the south of Mozambique. With her previous loan she managed to buy all the material and complete the work she planned. She was also able to pay back according to the schedule. The construction is now well advanced and the expectation is to keep working on it. There was also an improvement in her personal life, as she got promoted in her teaching career and she also had a second child. With this loan of 10.000.00mt she would like to buy construction material (cement, stone, sand, bricks and other items) to keep working on the construction of her house. She is very pleased with this loan, because it is allowing her to reform her home and she plans to request an additional loan in the future, to complete the construction of her house and to continue with her studies.

Translated from Portuguese by Monica Urban, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction material (cement, stone, sand, bricks and other items)

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorn U. is 45 years old and the village bank president. She was selected by the nine members who are located in Kanlaeng Khla village in Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use it for a different purpose. 
 
Mrs. Thorn U. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She also sells rice in the local market. She is able to earn a small income to support her family. For her rice business, Mrs. Thorn U. decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to sell. Her husband, Mr. Nget Ngy, is a soldier who receives a small salary to support his family. This couple has seven children. One of the children is a laborer, one is a soldier and one is a seamstress in a garment factory. The other four children attend the local school and help their parents with their business.

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis Y. is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. He is 39 years old and married, with 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Dennis owns and operates a store, where he sells fruit and sausages such as longanisa and chorizo. Dennis has been engaged in his business for more than 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Dennis joined HSPFI this year to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting his first loan, for 5000 PHP, to purchase additional products to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Tsend-Ayush

texts.en: Tsend-Ayush L. lives with his wife in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Hovd province, western Mongolia. He started his welding business in 1995. With his profits from the business, he has purchased a plot of land for his family and has built a house for his son as well. He has gained much experience over the years in this business. In the future, he hopes one day to start his own factory where he can produce a variety of welding items. Tsend-Ayush is a hard-working, neat and open-hearted man who is requesting a 1,700,000 MNT loan to create his own workplace.

loans.use: To create his own workplace

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorn P. is 55 years old and the village bank president. She was selected by the eight members who are located in Kanlaeng Khla village in Takeo province. Each member will use this loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Thorn P. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Lorn Neang, is a basket maker who earns a small income to support their family. In order to increase their income, Mrs. Thorn P. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to breed. She will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer to cultivate rice. This couple has a child who is a student in a local school.

loans.use: To buy piglets and fertilizer

loans.name: Rotchie

texts.en:
Rotchie A. is from the village of  Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old and married, with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rotchie owns and operates a store where she sells fish and shrimp. Rotchie has been engaged in her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rotchie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rotchie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rotchie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rotchie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 39-year old married woman from Talim Island in the province of Rizal, living with her husband and two children. In 1998, she opened her own welding shop business and embarked on selling of Avon products. Her avid customers come from the surrounding areas and nearby town.

Lilia is now requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP in order to purchase additional needed equipment for her welding shop.  The remaining loan funds will be used to support her Avon retailing business. She believes that having new equipment in her welding shop and a larger variety of Avon inventory will help her retain her current customers as well as attract new clients in the neighborhood.

Lilia has been a proud member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 1998.  She has been a dedicated member, regularly attending the weekly center meetings and maintaining solid repayment records on previous loans.

Lilia’s dreams are for her two children to complete college, to have winning businesses and to build a comfortable home to live in.  Additionally, she hopes that her businesses can continue to provide a sustainable livelihood to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional needed equipment for her welding shop.

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en: Ricky Q. is from the village of Poblacion, Port Area, Iligan City. He is 42 years old. Ricky is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ricky operates a service-based business, providing computer services and Internet services to local community members. Ricky has been engaged in his business for more than eight years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Ricky joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ricky is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services he provides. This will be the first loan taken out by Ricky from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Sok Eng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok Eng C. is 56 years old and is the leader of a village bank loan group, having been selected by the members, located in Roka village in Takeo province. With the loan, the members of this village loan will further their different purposes and they hope to increase their income to support their families. 

Mrs. Sok Eng C. is a pig breeder and also a rice wine maker at home, able to earn a small income to help support her family. For both their businesses, Mrs. Sok Eng C. decided to ask for a loan to buy pig feed for pig breeding and to buy rice for rice wine making. Her husband, Mr. Chhum Sou, is a farmer and also helps his wife with her businesses. This couple has five children; two are seamstresses in a garment factory while the other three are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for pig breeding

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 30 yrs old. He's married and has one child. He finished primary school. 

He sells women's clothing in his shop. He was able to buy garments in bulk. He has lots of customers because the clothing that he sells is inexpensive and of good quality. He has a good reputation in the market. He intends to enlarge his shop in the coming days and display more clothes in different styles and fashions.

loans.use: To buy ready-made garments to sell

loans.name: Paulo

texts.pt:
Paulo Sembanhe vive em Boane, província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique. No empréstimo passado conseguiu canalizar para o que esteve previsto e também foi suficiente. Conseguiu pagar a sua letra segundo o calendário estabelecido.
A sua obra esta decorrendo bem e com o presente empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas de zinco, barrotes e outros) para concluir a sua obra. 
O empréstimo foi satisfatório, esta conseguindo alcançar o objectivo que preconizou. Pretende solicitar mais crédito para iniciar com actividade de criação de aves para venda.
texts.en:
Paulo Sembanhe lives in Boane, Maputo Province, southern Mozambique. With the past loan he managed to achieve the planned results and to make sure that it was enough. He also managed to pay back according to the schedule. His construction work is proceeding well and with this loan of 20.000.00mt he wants to buy more construction material (cement, zinc plates, beams and other) to complete the work. He is very pleased with the loan, that is allowing him to achieve his goals as planned. He intends to request an additional loan to start a new business and breed birds for sale.

Translated from Portuguese by Monica Urban, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction material (cement, zinc plates, beams and other)

loans.name: Srey Ros Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey R. is 40 years old and and is the leader of this village bank loan having been selected by the members located in Roka village in Takeo province.  Each member of this village loan will use their share to support their different purposes. 

 Mrs. Srey R. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice on, and aside from farming, she is also a grocery seller and pig breeder who is able to earn a small income to help support her family. For pig breeding and farming, Mrs. Srey R. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm to grow rice. She plans to use the rest of the loan funds to buy pig feed for pig breeding. Her husband, Mr. R. Peng, is a construction worker and also helps his wife with her businesses. This couple has two children, who are both attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en: Emerita O. is from the village of Port Area, Iligan City. She is 51 years old. Emerita is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Emerita runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for her business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Emerita has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2009, Emerita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emerita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Emerita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Emerita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Chantho's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantho C. is a 30-year-old married woman and is the village bank president, having been selected by the sixteen members located in Roka village in Takeo province.   Each member of this group loan will use it to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Chantho C. is a farmer who owns 3-hectare of land to cultivate rice on and she is also a glove weaver and pig breeder at home, who is able to earn a small income to help support her family. To support pig breeding and glove weaving, Mrs. Chantho C. decided to ask for a loan to bU. fabrics for glove weaving. With the rest of the loan she wants to bU. pig feed for pig breeding. Her husband, Mr. Khem Doung, is a fisherman and also helps his wife. This couple has three children; one is attending the local school while the other two are too young to study or work. 

Mrs. Thoeung M. and Mrs. Mom S. are group guarantees present in the picture, while another one of the group is not clearly visible.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for glove weaving

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 38 years old. He is married and has one child. 

He is a tailor. He will use this loan to develop his tailoring shop and to purchase a new sewing machine and cloth. He has been working in this field for ten years and has acquired a great deal of experience. Many clients pay a visit to his shop. He has a modern style and a good reputation in the market, so he has a good income.

loans.use: Purchasing sewing machine and clothes

loans.name: Meng

texts.en:
Mrs. Meng H. is 34 years old and is a villager who lives in Kou Chen Leaeng village, Takeo province. She is farmer who works very hard to support her children and she is also a Khmer cake seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Chhim Chhoun, is a recycler middleman who is able to earn a small income to support his family. 

For her husband's business, Mrs. Meng H. decided to ask for a loan to buy more recyclable goods. This couple has three children; two are attending the local school while the last one is 6 years old and is not enrolled in school yet. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy more recyclables

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 26 years old and a mother of one.  She has been operating a salon for two years. She was previously employed. Grace went into business because her income was not enough to raise her child, who is 3 years old.  She has managed to grow her business and has employed one person.  

She was introduced to a group in Faulu Kenya, where she saves her money on weekly basis.  In this group, she can be guaranteed a loan from Faulu Kenya, a Kiva partner. She has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy hair chemicals and a hair dryer.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals and a hair dryer

loans.name: John Paul

texts.en:
John Paul O., from the village of Port Area, Poblacion Iligan City, is 26 years old, single and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, John Paul owns and operates a service-based business providing computer and internet services to local community members. Engaged in his business for over two years, he earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, John Paul joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid his previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPF that was used to purchase materials needed to expand services, he is requesting a new loan, his third, of 11000 PHP for the same purpose. John Paul plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mr. Vanny B. is 38 years old and is a villager who lives in Thkov village in the Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Team Kong, are farmers who own 1.5 hectares of land in which to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, Mr. Vanny B. is also a construction worker and can receive a small salary to support his family.

In order to increase income to improve the family's living conditions, Mr. Vanny B. decided to ask for a loan to buy seven piglets and pig food for his wife’s new business. This couple has four children, all of whom are attending in the local school.

loans.use: To buy seven piglets and pig food

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 59 years old. He is married and has four children. He owns a grocery store. He has been working in this field for long time. 

He has taken this loan to develop his shop. With the loan funds, he will buy food and a vertical refrigerator. He has many customers due to the freshness and the good quality of his food. He has a good reputation in the market and that attracts many customers. He treats his customers so nicely that they always come to buy things from him.

In order to support her pig breeding and rice wine making, Mrs. Sitha M. decided to ask for a loan to buy eight piglets and pig food, and to buy more rice for rice-wine making. Her husband, Mr. Sophai Mom, is a construction worker and also helps his wife's businesses. Mrs. Phorch L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine, fertilizer and rice seed to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Paolo Sen, is a construction worker who earns a small income to support his family and also helps his wife farm. The couple has three children; one is construction worker, one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and one attends the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

Mrs. They C. is a widow with two children; one is a laborer and one is seamstress in a garment factory.

In 2009, Mae Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPF that was used to to purchase materials needed to expand services provided, she is now  requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP for the same purpose. This will be Mae Jean's third loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

loans.name: Alberto Afonso

texts.pt:
Alberto Afonso M. vive em Boane, província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique. No empréstimo passado conseguiu canalizar para o que esteve previsto e também foi suficiente. Conseguiu pagar a sua letra segundo o calendário estabelecido.
A sua obra está neste momento na sua fase conclusiva, faltando apenas concluir o seu muro de vedação. Na sua vida social algo mudou para melhor e ainda teve mais 2 netos no seio da família. O presente empréstimo no valor de 17.000.00mt pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, blocos e outros) para concluir o murro de vedação da sua casa. 
Esta muito satisfeito com o empréstimo, esta conseguindo alcançar o objectivo que preconizou. Pretende solicitar mais crédito para outros projectos no futuro.
texts.en:
Alberto Afonso lives in Boane, in the Maputo Province, South of Mozambique. He has been able to channel his last loan to its goal and it has been enough to fulfill it. He was able to pay his loan according to the established timeline. His construction is now in its final stage, only the bordering wall is missing for its conclusion. In his social life something has changed for the best and he has also welcomed 2 grandchildren to his family. The current loan, in the amount of 17.000.00mt, is intended to be used to buy construction materials (cement, sand, bricks and others) to complete the bordering wall of his house. He is very pleased with the loan, he is managing to achieve his intended goal. In the future, he intends to request more loans for other projects.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, bricks and others)

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita B. is a 32-year-old married woman who lives in Sitio Toledo, Manapla, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a sari sari (general) store. Estelita’s husband, Amador, is a carpenter and they have two children aged three and 13.  The children go to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Estelita  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income with her general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 6,000.

Estelita  is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php16,000 was used to fund operations of her store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php16,000, (her sixteenth loan) which she intends to use on her general store. Estelita  is working hard to achieve her dream, which is to provide her family with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additonal Working Capital

loans.name: Groupe 1

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe 1 (de l’association Yiriwaton de Cinzana Village) sont des femmes mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 42 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes à Cinzana village chef lieu de commune rurale dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. 
Dans le but d’avoir des intrants agricoles à leur disposition en début d’hivernage, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ier  cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver l’arachide, le mil et le sésame.
Madame Oulématou  B. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter un sac de complexe céréale et recruter la main d’œuvre pour les activités de labour et de désherbage pour son champ de mil. 
Elle se ravitaille en intrants à la foire de Cinzana Gare et en main d’œuvre avec l’association des jeunes du village. 
Avec une superficie de 1,50 hectares, elle espère produire 4 sacs de mil et 6 sacs de sésame. 
La production du mil est auto consommée tandis que celle du sésame est entièrement vendue pour gérer les petites dépenses du foyer au quotidien.  
Madame Oulématou  B. à l’instar des autres femmes du groupe 1 a pour objectif d’assurer l’auto suffisance alimentaire dans leurs foyers.
texts.en:
The ten members of Group 1 of the Yiriwaton Association of Cinzana village are marrired women, mostly living in traditional families. On average, they are 42 and have three children. They all live in Cinzana village, the main settlement of a rural commune in Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), and know each other through ties of kinship, marriage and neighborhood. Looking to have fertilizer available for the rainy season, they went to Soro Yiriwaso and are now in their first seasonal loan cycle. They raise peanuts, millet and sesame. Mme Oulématou B. plans on using her loan to buy a sack of cereal fertilizer and hire people for plowing and weeding. She will buy her fertilizer at the market in Cinzana Gare. and hire her help from young village people. On her 1.5 hectare farm she hopes to produce four sacks of millet and six of sesame. The millet is for home use, while the sesame will be sold to cover small day-to-day household expenses. Along with the other group members, her goal is to achieve self-sufficiency in household food supply.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and pay hired help

loans.name: Groupe 1

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe 1 (de l’association Badenya de Zambougou Fouta) sont des femmes mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes à Zambougou Fouta dans la commune rurale de Tesserela, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. 
Dans le but de mieux  rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt de campagne. 
Les membres du groupe vont cultiver l’arachide, le mil et le sésame.
Madame Mayama Traoré compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, deux sacs de complexe céréales, 50kg de grains d’arachide et recruter la main d’œuvre pour les activités de labour et de désherbage pour son champ d’arachide. 
Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Gouassola et en main d’œuvre avec l’association des jeunes du village. 
Avec une superficie de 3 hectares, elle espère produire 20 sacs d’arachide, 4 sacs de mil et 8 sacs de sésame. 
La production du sésame et une partie de l’arachide sont entièrement vendues pour gérer les petites dépenses du foyer au quotidien tandis qu’une partie d’arachide et le mil sont auto consommés en famille. 
Madame Mayama Traoré à l’instar des autres femmes du groupe 1 a pour objectif d’assurer l’auto suffisance alimentaire dans leur village.
texts.en:
The seven members of Group 1 (of the Badenya association of Zambougou Fouta) are all married women living mostly in traditional extended families; on the average, they are 44 years old and have four children. They all live in Zambougou Fouta, in the rural community of Tesserela in the Ségou Region (the fourth administrative region of Mali) and know each other as relatives and neighbors. In order to make their agricultural work more profitable, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso, and this would be their first agricultural loan. The group members will grow peanuts, millet and sesame. Mrs. Mayama Traoré plans to use her loan to purchase two sacks of complex cereals, 50 kg [110 lbs] of peanut seed and to recruit labors to work in the fields and do the weeding. She purchases agricultural inputs at the Gouassola market and hires laborers through the young people's association in her village. On a plot of 3 hectares [about 7.5 acres], she hopes to produce 20 sacks of peanuts, four sacks of millet and eight sacks of sesame. The sesame harvest and a portion of the peanut harvest are sold in order to meet some ongoing family expenses while the other portion of the peanut harvest is consumed by the family. Mrs. Mayama Traoré, just as the other women in Group 1, has set her goal at ensuring food self-sufficiency in her village.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizers, peanut seed and paying for farm labor

loans.name: Benvinida

texts.en:
Benvinida A. is a 52 year-old married woman who supports her family by running a general store and selling fish. She lives in Seaside North, Brgy Poblacion, Naga, Cebu City with her husband and their three adult children.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 24,000.
 
Benvinida is borrowing Php 10,000 so that she can expand her store and fish vending business. This will be her 10th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Benvinida aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon  —a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Damira

texts.en:
Damira T. was born in Chaldovar (Panfilov region, Kyrgyz Republic), where she still lives. She is 57 years old. She was the third child in a large, low-income family. Because she had to help her mother in the household from early childhood, she left secondary school after the 7th grade. Damira got married at the age of 22. Soon she gave a birth to a son and two daughters. At that time Damira’s husband started breeding sheep. It was not a very profitable activity and additional earnings were required in order to support their family. That’s why, without education and practical knowledge, Damira decided get into sales.

Damira started, as do many people in her situation, selling at a local market. Her start as an entrepreneur was successful due to strong efforts. Starting with a capital of only 2,000 Kyrgyz Som, she managed to multiply her investments within one year. After five years of selling groceries in the market, Damira managed to purchase a sales stall and open up a small grocery store near her house. From this moment the shop became a family business. Her grown up children started to help their mother in the shop. 

In 2009, Damira obtained her first loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz Som from Bai Tushum and Partners. She used it to construct a shop on her own land. Her activity started to bring in permanent profit and her clientele increased.

Then a tragic accident happened: her only son had a car accident. He needed expensive medical treatment. At the same time, Damira’s granddaughter was born, which further increased the family’s expenditures.

Damira wants to take a loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz Som to expand the range of products in her shop. She hopes that this will help her increase her revenue. In the future, Damira plans to buy an apartment for her son in Karabalta and marry her daughters off well. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Kiva borrowers benefit from a 5% discount on the interest rate if they pay back without delay.

loans.use: to purchase flour, vegetables, and household articles

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia A. is a 43-year-old married woman who supports her family by running a general store. She lives in San Roque, Brgy. Baod, Bantayan, Cebu City with her husband, Roger, who is 44 years old and a fisherman, together with their three children who are between 9 and 13 years old, all currently going to school. Delia has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and by her own efforts. By working hard in her store, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Delia is borrowing 28,000 PHP to use as additional working capital for her general store. This will be her tenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.
