Su plan a futuro es ampliar su establecimiento con la finalidad de acoger más clientes. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con su cronograma de pagos, además se siente satisfecho con su grupo comunal, debido a que existe un buen clima cordial. Con el crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir en la compra de bebidas, carnes, aceites y algunos ingredientes que requerirá para la preparación de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Susan is 29 years old and lives with her partner. Together they reside in their own home in the town of Quimbiri, which is located in the beautiful Cusco jungle. Susan is the type of person who likes working as part of a team. For this reason, she and her partner decided to open a business selling beverages. At first they encountered financial difficulties, but over time they were able to recover. They currently supplement this business by selling food, specifically traditional jungle cuisine, so that they can increase their earnings. Their vending stall is located near the police station and is open for business from 7am until 10pm. Her future plans include expanding their establishment so that they can accommodate more customers.

This is her second loan with MFP. Susan promises to complete her payments on time. She feels happy to be working with her Communal Bank because there is a cordial atmosphere that exists within the group. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of beverages, meats, oil, and other ingredients needed for preparing her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages, meats, oil, and other ingredients for preparing her dishes

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen C. is a widow who lives in Vista Alegre, Barangay Enclaro, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: selling glassware and selling Ready-to-Wear (RTW) clothes. Carmen joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th loan, Carmen is borrowing PHP 13,000 which she intends to use to buy stock for her businesses so that she can continue to save for the future renovation of her house. Carmen is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy stock for her businesses

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia D. is a 57-year-old married woman who lives in Barangay Bunakan, Madredijos, Bantayan Island in the Province of Cebu. She earns her living by engaging in a business selling  fresh fish and dried fish.

Her husband, Florencio, is a 58-year-old fisherman and they have seven children. Some of the children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Florencia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon (NWTF-PD) in 2000 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in fish-vending and selling dried fish. 

Florencia is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 15,000 was used to fund operations of her fish-vending and dried fish business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and on the family’s living conditions.

Now, Florencia is borrowing Php 20,000 for her 19th loan which she intends to use on her fish-vending and dried fish business. She is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.


 About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Ernesto Everaldo

texts.es:
Ernesto de 56 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son  comerciantes informales), el tiene una vulcanizadora “lugar donde reparan llantas de carros. Para comenzar con esta actividad el observo que por su casa pasaban muchos buses para pedirles reparación. 

Poco a poco el comenzó a repararles las llantas, hasta que este fue su trabajo principal. Ahora el trabaja desde las 08:30am hasta las 16:00pm todos los días.  Por la gran demanda de reparación, el tuvo que contratar a una persona para que le ayude. Pero para tener otro ingreso adicional el quiere comprar con el préstamo un asadero de pollos para tener otro negocio y asegurar su vejez.  

En el futuro quiere permanecer con su vulcanizadora y tener su propio asadero de pollos para asegurar su vejez con esos ingresos de dinero.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 56 years old and lives in Suburbio in Guayaquil (an urban area where most of the residents engage in informal businesses). He manages a vulcanization shop where he repairs automobile tires. When he started this business, Ernesto noticed that several buses pass by his house that are in need of repairs.

He gradually began fixing tires until it became his primary job. Now he works from 8:30am until 4pm every day. Since there is great demand for repair services, he had to hire an employee to work as his assistant. In order to generate additional income, Ernesto is requesting a loan to buy a chicken roaster so that he can start another business and secure his retirement.

In the future, he wants to solidify his vulcanization shop and have his own chicken rotisserie so that he can have a secure retirement using the income from both businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a chicken roaster so that he can start a new food business

loans.name: Ali

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ali Sangaré est une homme marié de 36 et père d’un enfant. Il réside avec sa femme et son enfant dans le quartier Dialanicoro de Bougouni(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant vite abandonné l’école, il commença  tôt les activités génératrices de revenus, notamment l’achat et la vente de céréales qu’il  a appris auprès d’un de ses ami. Il mène cette activité dans les différents marchés de Bougouni. 
Avec une expérience de 5 ans, il maîtrise son activité et est très sollicité.
Afin d’agrandir son entreprise, il décide de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier, pour acheter de  une grande quantité de céréales.
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les villages environnants.
Avec ce prêt il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 55 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour agrandir davantage  son entreprise.
texts.en:
M. Ali Sangaré is 36, married, and the father of one child. He lives with his wife and child in the Dialanicoro neighborhood of Bougouni (the third administrative region of Mali). After dropping out of school, he started in business to earn money (buying and selling cereals, which a friend taught him how to do). He does it in various marketplaces in Bougouni. After five years, he is an expert at what he does and is highly sought after. Looking to grow his business, he joined Soro Yiriwaso. He is asking for his first loan, to buy a large amount of cereals which he will get in Bougouni and neighboring villages. With this loan he hopes to make a monthly profit of 55,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested to grow his business even more.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cereals

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol L. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Nasug-ong, Barangay Caradio-an, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband, Romeo, who is 49 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.

Mirasol joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past sixteen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, thus uplifting her family's standard of living.

This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500, which she intends to use to buy stock for her general store so that she can continue to save for the future renovation of her house.

Mirasol L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.


 About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Cheick Oumar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Cheick Oumar O. est un homme marié de39 ans et père de 3 enfants qui vit dans une famille nucléaire, avec sa femme et ses enfants à Bougouni dans le quartier Torakabougou.
Après des études secondaires il a obtenu un diplôme en comptabilité, mais est resté très longtemps sans avoir un emploi. Alors Cheick Oumar s’oriente vers les activités génératrices de revenus et cela depuis maintenant 15 ans. Il mène des activités d’achats et de ventes d’articles divers  tels les tissus pour chemises, pantalons, des  parfums etc.
Monsieur Cheick Oumar O. maîtrise son activité et est très sollicité.
Vu la faiblesse de son fond de roulement, il décide rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso afin d’acheter des articles de fête, des tissus pour ‘pantalons et chemises’  et des parfums.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali), à Lomé et au Burkina Faso. Sa  clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Les fêtes religieuses et les grandes cérémonies (baptême, mariages) sont les périodes où les ventes de ses articles sont intenses.
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000 FCFA.
texts.en:
Mr. Cheick Oumar O. is 39 years old and a father of 3. He lives with his wife and children in the Torakabougou neighbourhood.
After high school he received a diploma in accounting, but he remained unemployed for some time. So Cheick Oumar turned his efforts to income-generating activities and has done so for 15 years now. He buys and sells various items, including cloth to make shirts and pants, perfumes, etc. He stocks up in Bamako (the capital of Mali), Lomé and Burkina Faso. He has both male and female customers. During religious festivals and ceremonies (baptism, marriage) his sales are at their highest.
With this loan, he hopes to make a monthly profit of 65,000 XOF.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cloth, perfume and other items

loans.name: Melva

texts.en: Melva T. is a widow who lives in Pader, Barangay Aguisan, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: dried fish vending and food vending. Melva joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past eighteen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 19th loan, Melva is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use to buy more fish to sell so that she can continue to save for future home repairs. Melva is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila tiene 32  años, convive con su pareja y fruto de ellos tienen dos hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. Desde muy joven incursionó en la venta de ropa y calzado, por el cual era un trabajo en donde se sentía cómoda y feliz. Ella es consciente de los tropiezos que pueden darse en el camino, pero gracias a los consejos de sus padres, sabrá prevenir a tiempo las complicaciones que se presenten. A pesar de que cuenta con clientes, no se siente satisfecha, ya que su anhelo es establecer su propia tienda de ropa, en la avenida principal de su misma localidad. Por el momento está vendiendo en puesto alquilado, y ahorrando lo suficiente para concretar sus objetivos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago, además agradece a su grupo comunal por el respaldo que le otorgan sus compañeros. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de ropa para bebe y calzados, con la finalidad de atender la demanda de sus clientes de manera oportuna y rápida.
texts.en:
Teofila is 32 years old and lives with her partner and their two school age children. They live together in their own wooden house in the town of Quimbiri, which is located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle. As a young woman, Teofila began selling clothes and shoes since it was a job in which she felt comfortable and happy. She is aware of the all the pitfalls associated with running a business, and thanks to the advice from her parents, she was able to avoid any complications. Even though she has customers, Teofila will not be satisfied until she is able to establish her own clothing store along the main street of her town. She currently sells from a rented stand and is saving in order to accomplish her goals.

This is her first loan with MFP. Teofila promises to complete her payment obligations. In addition, she is grateful for the endorsement given by her fellow Communal Bank members. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of baby clothes and shoes so that she can satisfy the demand of her customers quickly and conveniently.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baby clothes & shoes

loans.name: Mamou

texts.fr:
Madame Mamou Samaké est une femme mariée de 39 ans et mère de 2 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille monogame avec son mari et ses enfants  dans le quartier Nanierila de Bougouni. 
Elle a vite abandonné l’école au profits des activités génératrices de revenus notamment la vente de crème de mil apprise auprès de sa tante.  Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans et elle  la maitrise bien. Son point de  vente est situé eu plein cœur du marché de Bougouni.
Elle s’approvisionne en matière première au marché de Bougouni.
Elle a intégré le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier prêt, pour  pouvoir acheter et stocker une grande quantité de matières premières pour la préparation du crème de mil. 
Elle  espère réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 28 000 FCFA.
texts.en:
39-year-old Mamou Samaké is married and a mother of 2. She lives in a monogamous family with her husband and children in the Nanierila neighbourhood of Bougouni. She left school early to pursue income-generating activities, specifically to sell millet cream just as her aunt had taught her. She has run this business for 10 years and she runs it well. She sets up shop right in the heart of the market in Bougouni. She also gets her ingredients from the market in Bougouni. She is on her first loan with Soro Yiriwaso’s credit program in order to buy and stock a large quantity of ingredients to prepare millet cream. With this loan, she hopes to make a monthly profit of 28,000 XOF.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make millet cream

loans.name: Lyna

texts.en: Lyna C. is a married woman who lives in Pader, Barangay Aguisan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: dried fish vending, fish vending, and selling Ready-to-Wear (RTW) clothes. Her husband, Zalde, who is 35 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 3 and 7 years old. Lyna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, thus uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 7th loan, Lyna is borrowing PHP 18,000 which she intends to use to expand her fish and dried fish businesses so that she can continue to save for the future education of her children. Lyna is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To expand her fish and dried fish businesses

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella J. is a 58-year old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: egg production, food vending and ready-to-wear (RTW) clothing sales. She lives in Prk. Takas, Brgy. Enclaro, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental.

A member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998, Estrella has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her three businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP15,000.

Estrella is now borrowing PHP 29,500, her 23rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, to buy feeds for laying mash. Her previous loan of PHP29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Estrella aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a community member who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Cheickna

texts.fr:
Monsieur Cheickna Samaké est une homme marié de 34 et père de 3 enfants. Il réside avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni.
Monsieur Cheickna Samaké est enseignant de profession, et parallèlement à cette profession il excelle dans les activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente des œufs. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son ami.
Avec une expérience de 3 ans, il maîtrise son activité et est très apprécié.
Afin de renforcer son capital, il décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter  une grandes quantité  d’alvéoles œufs. Il est à sa première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso
Il s’approvisionne chez les fermiers à Sanankoroba, Dialakoroba et des fois à Bamako (Capitale de la  République du Mali).
Les œufs sont vendus  à Bougouni, aux boutiquiers et aux restauratrices .
Avec ce prêt il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 27 000 FCFA.
texts.en:
Mister Cheickna Samaké is 34 years old and the father of 3 children. He lives with his wife and children in the Massablacoura district of Bougouni. Mister Cheickna Samaké is a teacher by profession. At the same time, he excels in income-generating activities such as buying and selling eggs. He learned this activity from his friend. With 3 years of experience, he masters his business and is highly thought of. In order to strengthen his capital, he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso to buy a large amount of egg flats. This is his first experience with Soro Yiriwaso. He gets his supplies from farmers in Sanankoroba, Dialakoroba and sometimes in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). The eggs are sold in Bougouni to shopkeepers and restaurant owners. With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 27,000 CFA francs.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy eggs

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza S. is a 33-year-old married woman who supports her family with a pig fattening business. She lives in Brgy. Atop-atop, Bantayan, Cebu City with her husband and their eight children, who are currently going to school. Analiza has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her pig fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Analiza is borrowing 29,000 PHP for additional working capital. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 29,000 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey towards economic freedom. Analiza hopes to improve her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Djemory

texts.fr:
Monsieur Djemory D. est un homme marié de 34 ans et père de 3 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le  quartier Dialanicoro de Bougouni (troisième région du Mali)
Suite à la pauvreté de ses parents, il décida d’abandonner l’école et commença les activités génératrices de revenus tels faire l’apprenti chauffeur, la vente d’articles divers dans une boutique auprès de  son oncle et le meunier. C’est cette dernière activité qu’il finira par embrasser. Avec une expérience plus de 7 ans, il maîtrise son activité.
Afin  d’améliorer son atelier, il décida de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter un  moulin. Il est à sa première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso.
 Il compte s’approvisionner à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale.
 Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 49 500 FCFA  qu’il envisage utiliser pour agrandir son entreprise et payer les intérêts du prêt.
texts.en:
Mister Djemory D. is 34 years old, married and the father of 3 children. He lives with his wife and children in the Dialanicoro district of Bougouni (third region of Mali). Due to his parents’ poverty, he decided to abandon school and started income-generating activities such as being an apprentice driver, selling various goods in a shop with his uncle and being a miller. It is this last activity that he finally decided to take up. With more than 7 years of experience, he masters his business. In order to upgrade his workshop, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso to buy a mill. This is his first experience with Soro Yiriwaso. He plans to get his supplies in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). His customer base is composed of locals. With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 49,500 CFA francs that he plans to use to expand his business and pay the interest on his loan.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a mill

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en: Azucena M. is a 56-year-old married woman who supports her family with a hog-fattening business. She lives in Sitio Daan Banwa, Brgy. Su-ay, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. Azucena has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1989 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her hog fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Azucena is borrowing 29,500 PHP so that she can buy an additional hog for future income. This will be her 22nd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 29,500 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey towards economic freedom. Azucena hopes to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additonal working capital

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz G., 43 years old, is a married woman who supports her family with her machine shop business. She lives in Barangay Tangke, Medellin, Cebu Province with her 49-year-old husband, Teopisto, and their eight children who are from 6 to 23 years old with six of them currently going to school.

Paz has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her machine shop business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000.

Paz is now borrowing Php 19,500 so that she can use it as additional working capital for her machine shop. This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan which also amounted to Php 19,500, was paid off well within its term, helped her sustain her machine shop's operations. It was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Paz aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.

Paz is shown in the accompanying picture amidst the many metal parts that are used in the normal course of operations of her machine shop.

 About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her machine shop

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy C. is a married woman who lives in Darigold 1, Brgy. San Vicente, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Ariel, who is 43 years old, works as a Cane Truck Driver to earn his living and also helps with his wife's business. They have 2 children who are 10 and 12 years old.

Christy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Christy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, helping to raise the family's standard of living.

For her 18th cycle loan Christy is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to buy stocks for her general store so that she can continue to save for future home repairs and the educaton of her children. Christy C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional Working Capital.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, de 51 años edad, es viuda y tiene cinco hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos viven en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva cusqueña, donde tienen su propio techo. Victoria se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, actualmente se dedica a vender ropa. En un inicio su negocio le iba muy bien, por ser la única que se dedicaba a este rubro, con el tiempo llegó la competencia y bajó las ventas. Sin embargo continua vendiendo sin cesar, ahora cuenta con gran número de clientes y sus ventas se incrementaron paulatinamente; de todas maneras aprendió mucho de la competencia, ya que así ha logrado mejorar en muchos aspectos de su negocio, como el vender ropa de todos los gustos y preferencias para sus clientes y a un precio razonable. Su punto de venta lo realiza en el mismo mercado de su localidad, a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 8:00 de la noche, no obstante Victoria aspira a ganador, ya que para mas adelante está pensando ampliar su establecimiento en otras zonas con la finalidad de poder posicionarse  en el mercado. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar durante las fechas estipuladas, además agradece a su grupo comunal, por la solidaridad que existe entre cada uno de sus compañeros. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la de compra al por mayor de ropa, con el propósito de aumentar sus ingresos económicos, y así también mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Victoria is a 51 year old widow with five school age children. They live together in their own home in the town of Quimbiri, which is located in the beautiful jungle of Cusco. Victoria is known for being an enterprising and hardworking woman who sells clothing at the moment. Her business did very well at first since she was the only merchant of her kind, but eventually competition arrived and her sales fell. Nonetheless, she is able to maintain a steady level of business and now has more customers and her sales have been gradually increasing. Victoria has learned many lessons from her competition and has already improved several aspects of her business. She now stocks clothes for all tastes and preferences and sells them to her customers at a reasonable price. Her vending post is situated in the local market, where she works from 7am until 8pm. Victoria is determined to succeed and later plans to expand her business to other areas in order to position herself in the marketplace.

This is her second loan with MFP. Victoria promises to submit her payments by the established deadlines. She is grateful to each of the other Communal Bank members for cooperating with one another. The loan she is requesting will be invested in a bulk purchase of clothing so that she can increase her financial earnings and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk

loans.name: Jose Jonathan

texts.es:
José de 21 años, vive en la perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y el estero que conecta al río, a unas cuantas cuadras). El y su mama tienen una papelería “bazar”, le ha ayudado para poder mantener su casa. 

Poco a poco José y su mama con esfuerzo han podido agrandar su papelería, trabajan desde las 08:00am hasta las 21:00pm todos los días, venden papelería, CD, cuadernos etc. En ocasiones su padrastro le ayuda cuando el sale a estudiar. Pero para tener mas artículos de bazar y mas ingresos el quiere comprar con el préstamo una vitrina y papelería. 

En el futuro quiere agrandar su negocio, y acaparar mas mercado para su negocio.
texts.en:
José is 21 years old and lives along the Perimetral Highway of Guayaquil (a periurban area with dirt roads and a stream that connects to the river and runs several blocks). He and his mother manage a stationery bazaar, which helps them maintain their household.

Little by little, José and his mother have strived to expand their stationery shop. They work from 8am until 10pm every day selling stationery, CDs, notebooks, and other products. Occasionally his stepfather will help out whenever he has to leave to go study. In order to restock their bazaar and generate more income, José is requesting a loan to buy a display cabinet and stationery.

In the future, he wants to expand his business and capture a larger share of the market.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stationery & a display cabinet

loans.name: Videlmina

texts.es: Videlmina,  de 41 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene dos hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de San Francisco, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tienen su casa propia a base de madera. Cuando Videlmina abrió su pequeña tienda, le costó mucho establecerse en el mercado y ganar clientes, con el pasar del tiempo y con el esfuerzo y voluntad que le puso a su trabajo, logró fortalecerse y poco a poco empezó a recuperarse económicamente, y con las ganancias que obtenía, lo ahorraba para cualquier eventualidad. En el presente su tienda aumentó de tamaño, en donde exhibe una variedad de productos, con diferentes precios según la calidad del producto que necesita sus clientes. Su éxito fue la perseverancia que tuvo ante las adversidades que se le presentaba, es por ello que desea ampliar su negocio, con la finalidad de poder atraer mayor cantidad de clientes. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, pero a veces recibe la ayuda de sus hijas, trabajando desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando con sus obligaciones, además no se arrepiente por nada del mundo por pertenecer a su grupo comunal, ya que lo viene trayendo beneficios económicos. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de más mercadería, con el propósito de cumplir con la demanda del cliente.
texts.en:
Videlmina is 41 years old, divorced, and has two children in school. They live together in their own wooden house in the town of San Francisco, which is located in the beautiful Ayacuchan jungle. When Videlmina opened her small store, she went through great expense to establish herself in the marketplace and attract customers. After some time, and with effort and determination, she was able to recover financially and earn enough money to save for emergencies. Her store has increased in size, which allows her to display a variety of products at different prices based on the quality of products that her customers need. Videlmina’s success is attributed to her perseverance in the face of adversity. Therefore she wants to expand her business in hopes of attracting more customers. She usually works alone, but sometimes she receives assistance from her daughters. Videlmina works from 6am until 9pm.

This is her third loan with MFP. Videlmina promises to continue paying her obligations. In addition, she does not regret being part of her Communal Bank since it has brought her many financial benefits. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise so that she can satisfy the demand of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Nyame Mmere Group

texts.en:
Agnes is a very resourceful woman. She is married to a farmer with nine children from age 6-30 years. She is now 55 years old. She loves selling cereals like maize, a business through which she makes a living for her family. Agnes has sold maize for the past year. She plans to invest the loan to purchase ten bags of maize. Agnes hopes to grow her stocks of maize from 10 bags to 40 bags to meet her growing demands. She anticipates an increased profit to take care of her children in school.

Agnes is currently the leader of a trust bank group called “Nyame Mmere” (translated as 'God’s Time') made up of 12 members. As the leader of the group, she ensures regular meeting attendance and repayment of loan installments.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia, de 51 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tienen dos hijos. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa. Virginia se dedica en la venta de comida típica y criolla, actividad que lo aprendió de sus padres, y ahora la sazón con la que prepara su comida es del deleite de sus clientes. Recuerda que para posicionar su negocio, tuvo que repartir volantes, entonces fue cuando la gente comenzó a ir al rinconcito desconocido, y desde ahí sus clientes más exigentes asisten todos los días a saborear la variedad de platos que prepara. Cada día que pasa trata de mejorar, con el fin de satisfacer y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Generalmente trabaja en compañía de una ayudante, desde 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 8:00 de la noche. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su negocio, insertando una fuente de soda, para así darle un nuevo estilo a su restaurante. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus pagos, además agradece a su grupo comunal, por la solidaridad que existe en cada uno de sus socios. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de un juego de sillas y mesas, para recibir  mayor capacidad de clientela.
texts.en:
Virginia, who is 51 years old, lives with her partner, and they have two children. They live together in the town of Quimbiri, located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle, where they have their own house. Virginia sells typical food and Creole food, a business that she learned from her parents, and now the seasoning with which she prepares her food delights her customers. She remembers that to set up her business, she had to put out flyers, and that was when people began to go to her little, unknown corner, and since then, her most demanding customers come every day to taste the variety of dishes that she prepares. Every day she tries to improve, with the goal of satisfying and giving better service to her customers. She generally works with an assistant from 7 in the morning until 8 at night. Her plan for the future is to increase her business, adding a soda fountain, in order to give her restaurant a new style. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments faithfully. Furthermore, she is grateful to her community bank group for the solidarity that exists in each one of its members. With the loan that she is applying for, she will invest in a set of chairs and tables, to serve more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs to make her customers more comfortable.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction supplies for her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Zinc, cement.

loans.name: Kimberly

texts.es: Kimberly, de 18 años, es una joven madre de familia muy emprendedora, tienen un hijo de 4 meses y vive en casa de su abuela. La  actividad a la que se dedica, es la venta de cuadernos, laminas, cartulinas y demás accesorios de librería. Desde su niñez apoyó en forjar el negocio de su abuela, en gratitud a ello, le propuso hacerla su socia, desde entonces invierte su capital en este negocio. Anhela   convertirla en un puesto  muy proveída de juguetes, lanas y loza en general.  El puesto de la abuela, se ubica  a 5 cuadras de su casa, siendo sus clientes, los alumnos de la escuela aledaña al mercado de su distrito. Hace dos años que trabaja en esta actividad y se siente muy feliz con el trabajo que realiza. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y sabe que esté aporte le será muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por lo que se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente. Con éste crédito que solicita, desea comprar lencería, para abastecer su establecimiento, además cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Kimberly is 18 years old, she is a young and very hard-working mother: she has a 4 months old son and lives in her grandmother’s house. She sells notebooks, plates, cards and other bookshop items. She helped her grandmother building up this activity since she was a child; in exchange, and to thank her, her grandmother has offered her to be her business partner, and since then she has been investing her money in this activity. She wishes to transform it into a well-furnished shop selling toys, clamps and pottery in general. Her grandmother’s stand is 5 blocks from her house, and her customers are students of the school located close to the her district’s market. She has been working in this field for 2 years and she is very happy with the job she is doing. This is her first loan with MFP, and she knows she will greatly benefit from this service as it will help her increase her working capital. This is why she committs to correctly repaying all her dues. The loans she is requesting will be used to buy linen to furnish her shop and also to fulfill her customers’ requests.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy linen to fulfill her customer's request.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy trousers and children's clothes

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El solicitante es casado, tiene 2 hijos menores los cuales estan estudiando en primaria; su esposa le ayuda en en negocio que tienen en su casa una pequeña tienda. El destino del credito es para incrementar su capital e invertir en com´pra de mercaderia.
texts.en:
This borrower is married and has two young children attending primary school. His wife helps him in the small shop they have installed in their house. The loan he is requesting will be used to increase his working capital and to buy core products.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his working capital and to buy core products.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel tiene 23 años, es una madre de familia joven y muy trabajadora, vive con su esposo y su hijo Julio de 2 meses en una casa alquilada. El negocio a la que se dedica es la venta de juguetes y artículos del hogar. Su puesto es alquilado, situado en el  mercado más concurrido de su distrito, a solo 10 cuadras de su casa. Tiene clientes muy solventes que le dan dinamismo económico a su negocio, es por ello que su trabajo se basa con mucha cordialidad y la mejor atención. Lleva 2 años trabajando en esta actividad y considera que le gusta su trabajo, ya que le permite cuidar de su hijo y dar la rentabilidad que necesita, sin embargo el no contar con suficiente presupuesto, le impide abastecer su puesto. Su mayor anhelo es comprarse su terreno, para construir su casa y ampliar su negocio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar oportunamente sus cuotas, ya que sabe que éste aporte le será de mucha utilidad para el progreso de su negocio. Con éste crédito que solicita, piensa incrementar su negocio, y de ese modo su puesto luzca renovado y abastecido de variedad de mercadería.
texts.en:
Raquel is 23 years old and is a young and very hard-working mother. She lives with her husband and 2 month old son, Julio, in a rented house. She sells toys and household items for a living. She rents a stand in the busiest market in her district, only 10 blocks from her house. Her business is vigorous because she has customers that are able to pay their debts. For this reason she is able to focus on customer service and give her customers the best attention. She has been working in this business for 2 years and she likes it. It allows her to care for her son and is profitable, however she does not have enough money to stock her stand. Her greatest desire is to buy some land so that she can build a house and expand her business. This is her first loan with MFP. She is committed to repaying it on time because she knows that this loan will be very useful for the growth of her business. With this loan she plans to increase her business by giving her stand a new look and stocking a variety of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to stock her market stand

loans.name: Walter Macadeo

texts.es: El solicitante es soltero, viene trabajando como chofer de mototaxi desde hace mas de 3 años teniendo como ingreso semanal de S/. 300.00. El destino del credito es para mantenimiento de su vehiculo y para invertir en un negocio de abarrotes. Tiene como meta comprarse su propia mototaxi
texts.en:
The applicant is single. He has been working as a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) driver for over three years. His weekly income is 300 soles. The loan is to perform maintenance on his vehicle. He will also use it to invest in a grocery business. His goal is to buy his own mototaxi.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mainenance on his "mototaxi"

loans.name: Raymundo Ernesto

texts.es: El solicitante es casado tiene una pequeña hija, maneja mototaxi su esposa se dedica al cuidado de su menor hija; tiene un ingreso semanal de S/. 250.00 . El destino del credito es para arreglos en su casa y comprar repuestos de su movilidad
texts.en:
The loan applicant is married with a young daughter. He drives a motorcycle taxi while his wife takes care of their daughter. He has a weekly income of S/. 250.00 [Nuevos Soles]. The loan is to fix up the house and to purchase spare parts.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal Needs

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
La señora Rufina E. C. es casada tiene 44 años de edad, apenas estudio hasta el nivel de primario, tiene 3 hijos. Rufina vive con su esposo, tienen su vivienda en la zona de Caico de la provincia Quillacollo del departamento de Cochabamba.

La señora Rufina y su esposo se dedican a la producción de leche cruda, toda su producción lechera entrega a un modulo lechero de la zona, para su posterior recojo por parte de PIL ANDINA. 

Las condiciones en las que viven son modestas, su vivienda cuenta con los servicios básicos, su ganado se cría en la misma propiedad. La señora Rufina es una señora muy dedicada a su trabajo, pues ella su esposo y sus hijos se levantan muy temprano todos los días para ordeñar las vacas y durante todo el día se dedican al cuidado de las mismas, actividad en la que participa toda la familia.   

La señora Rufina solicita el crédito para la adquisición de un lote de terreno que le servirá para el posterior sembradío de forraje en general, con lo cual pueda mantener la producción de leche de manera que no bajen sus ingresos y estos se mantengan estables. El ideal que tiene la señora Rufina es que por lo menos todos sus hijos terminen la colegiatura y posteriormente alcanzar alguna profesión.
texts.en:
Rufina E. C. is 44, married with three children and only has a grade school education. Rufina lives with her husband in the Caico area of Quillacollo province in the department of Cochabamba. Rufina and her husband make a living by producing raw milk. They deliver their all their product to a dairy cooperative which is then gathered by PIL ANDINA. Their living conditions are modest, with just basic services. They raise their cattle on this same property. Rufina is very hard working, and her husband and children get up early every day to milk the cows and then they all spend the rest of the day caring for the cattle. Rufina is requesting the loan to purchase a plot of land that could be planted for grazing. This will help keep up the milk production as well as maintaining their income stable. Rufina's dream is to see at least two of her children finish high school and go on to a career.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of land for planting

loans.name: David Romer

texts.es:
El Señor David Romer C. A. es un joven mecánico que trabaja para mantener a su familia en la localidad de Ivirgarzama en Cochabamba.

David Romer C. A. es un joven muy dedicado a su trabajo, el vive en una casa en alquiler en Ivirgarzama la cual también le sirve como taller de reparación de motocicletas el cuenta con los ambientes apropiados para la venta de repuestos, el tiene dos hijos a los cuales educa y apoya en su educación a lado de su  pareja, el trabaja día tras día para el bienestar de su familia y que en un futuro cercano el pueda contar con una casa propia y así darle mejores comodidades a su familia.

El señor David Romer C. A. se apersono a las oficinas en busca de un crédito para compra de mercadería y así poder ampliar un poco los accesorios de motocicletas así poder tener más ingresos para el bienestar de su hijo y su pareja y un futuro mejor para su familia.
texts.en:
David is a young mechanic who works hard to maintain his family in the locality of Ivergarzama in Cochabamba. He is dedicated to his work and lives in a rental house in Ivergarzama which also serves as his repair shop for motorcycles, and he also counts on a favorable atmosphere for selling replacement parts. David has 2 children that he educates and helps with their education, along side his wife. He works day after day for the wellbeing of his family, so that in the near future, he can count on having his own house and thus, offer his family greater comfort. David has come to our offices in search of a loan to buy merchandise, to be able to expand his inventory of motorcycle accessories a little and earn more income for the wellbeing of his wife and children and for a better future for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING GENERAL MOTORCYCLE SPARE PARTS TO SELL

loans.name: Jacinta Cleopatra

texts.es:
Jacinta de 37 años, vive en la perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y el estero que conecta al río, a unas cuantas cuadras). Ella tiene una papelería “bazar”, le ha ayudado para poder mantener su casa.

Comenzó vendiendo ropa pero como no tenia suficientes ingresos decidió invertir en papelería para un nuevo negocio, poco a poco con esfuerzo y la ayuda de su esposo pudo readecuar su casa y convertir la parte delantera en una papelería. Trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta el anochecer.    

Para seguir ganando dinero y mantener a sus dos hijos ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cuadernos y papelería para su negocio. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Jacinta, 37, lives along Guayaquil’s Perimetral highway (the outlying area of the city, with dirt roads and a stream that connects to the river a few minutes away). She has a stationary store which has helped her maintain her home. She began selling clothes but since she didn’t earn enough income she decided to invest in stationary for a new business. Little by little, with effort and help from her husband, she was able to readjust her home, turning the front of it into a stationary store. She works from 8:00 AM until dusk. In order to continue earning money and taking care of her two children, Jacinta wants to buy notebooks and stationery with the loan for her business. In the future she wants to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, Stationery

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
La Señora Emiliana G. A. tiene 63 años y está casada con el Señor Carmelo Fernández Corrales por más de 40 años, tiene 1 hijo dependiente que estudia en nivel secundaria, el esposo es agricultor produce papa, haba, maíz en su terreno de 1 hectáreas en la comunidad de Rodeo Melga, la esposa ayuda en la actividad agrícola, en cuidado de ganados vacunos y de la casa. 

Doña Emiliana y su familia viven en una comunidad rural Rodeo Melga a 33 km muy alejado de la ciudad por lo tanto para ellos es muy difícil acudir a los banco para un préstamo de dinero. El CIDRE tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona rural, y descubre que la  Doña Emiliana necesitaba capital para ampliar y aumentar la producción de papa, haba, maíz ya que él tiene terrenos que no están cultivados. Doña Emiliana  nos comenta quiere ampliar la producción de papa y haba así tener ingresos suficiente para ahorrar dinero para que su hijo estudie en la universidad de la ciudad, el sueño de Doña Emiliana es ver a sus hijo profesional.
texts.en:
Emiliana G. A. is 63 years old and has been married to Carmelo Fernández Corrales for more than 40 years. They have 1 son, who studies at secondary school. Carmelo grows potatoes, broad beans, and corn on his 1-hectare plot of land in the rural community of Rodeo Melga. Emiliana helps Carmelo on the plot, looks after cattle, and takes care of their house. Emiliana and her family live in Rodeo Melga, which is 33 km away from the city. This makes it very difficult for them to get to a bank to request a loan. The field partner, EL CIDRE, took the initiative to go to this rural area and discovered that Emiliana needed capital to increase their potato, broad bean and corn yields. Since the field partner has land that is not being used, it was able to help. Emiliana tells us that she wants to increase their potato and broad bean harvests, so as to have sufficient funds to save money and enable their son to go to university in the city. Emiliana's dream is for her son to secure a professional job.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow potatoes and broad beans

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es:
Doña Octavia y Paulina V. O., son hermanas que viven en un solo hogar en su  comunidad Hualyallapujru en el municipio de Tiraque en el departamento de Cochabamba a 68 kilómetros sobre la carretera antigua a santa cruz.
 
La actividad principal de la señora Octavia y Paulina es la agricultura, este trabajo lo realizan solas, algunas veces con ayuda de los vecinos de su comunidad, mayormente trabajan solas tienen dos hijos que mantener en la familia. 

El crédito que está solicitando es para los insumos agrícolas para poder mejorar su producción de este año, de esa manera incrementar sus ingresos. Su mayor sueño es poder salir adelante y darles a sus hijos todo lo que puedan para que algún día sean lo mejor que puedan.
texts.en:
Octavia and Paulina V. O. are sisters who live together in Hualyallapujru in the municipality of Tiraque in the department of Cochabamba, 68 km along the old road to Santa Cruz. Octavia and Paulina's main source of income is agriculture, which they normally perform alone but sometimes with help from their neighbors. They have two children in the family to look after. The loan they are requesting is for agricultural supplies to help with this year's crop and so increase their income. Their dream is to be successful and give their daughters everything they can so they can be as successful as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Patricia Yersina

texts.es:
La señora Patricia Yersina A. A. tiene 26 años D. edad y vive en el Barrio El Tejar D. la ciudad D. Tarija. Patricia es casada pero no tiene hijos y vive en casa D. suspadres.  
                                       
Patricia se dedica a la atención D. un punto D. llamadas, actividad que viene realizando desD. hace 2años.   
                                                                                                                                                                Patricia nos dice que se presento la oportunidad D. comprar dos cabinas D. teléfono es por eso que el crédito será destinado para la compra D. dichas cabinas D. esa forma tener mejores ingresos personales para ella y toda sufamilia.   
                                                                                                                                                                                    Patricia nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder darles toda la comodidad que pueda a sus padres para que sean felices. También nos dice que el próximo crédito que obtenga será destinado a mejorar las condiciones D. su casa.
texts.en:
Señora Patricia Yersina A. A. is 26 years old and lives in the neighbourhood of El Tejar in the town of Tarija. She is married, has no children, and lives with her parents. Patricia runs a phone centre, a job she’s been doing for two years. She has been given the opportunity to buy two phone booths, and she would use the loan for this purpose, giving her more income for her and her family. Patricia’s greatest wish is to be able to make her parents happy by providing them with as many comforts as she can. Her next loan will be used to make some improvements to their house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy telephone booths

loans.name: Miriams Leticia

texts.es:
Miriams de 46 años, vive en la perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y el estero que conecta al río, a unas cuantas cuadras). Ella vende Avon (empresa que ayuda a las mujeres para que puedan trabajar vendiendo productos por catalogo). 

Ella para poder mantener a sus dos hijos ya que esta separada de su esposo tuvo que ingresa como vendedora de Avon por catalogo, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener ingresos, para tener mas ingresos ella también cose ropa a sus clientes. También a readecuado su casa y tiene una vitrina para vender los productos.

En el futuro quiere tener su negocio mas grande y tener su propio taller de costura.
texts.en:
46-year old Miriams lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil along the Perimetral (ring road). The roads are made of earth, and there is a marsh adjoining the river a few blocks away. Miriams sells Avon products (the company helps women to sell their products via catalogs). In order to support her two children--she is separated from her husband--she had to join the company as a salesperson. She worked hard and gradually started to make money. To make extra income she also makes clothes for customers. She has also altered her house and added a display case for her products. In the future Miriams wants to own a bigger business and have her own clothing workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy material, perfume, lotions

loans.name: Magali

texts.es: Magali tiene 20 años, comparte su vida a lado de su madre, juntas viven en casa de sus padres. Hace mas de 5 años se dedica en la venta de verduras como  lechuga, espinaca, cebolla entre otros productos, en un mercado que se encuentra dentro de su localidad. Con el apoyo de su mama, adquieren la mercadería desde muy temprano, logrando quedarse hasta las 3 de la tarde aproximadamente, que es cuando logra vender todos sus productos. Este trabajo le ha permitido tener sus propios ingresos y aportar en la economía de su casa, Magali tiene muchos sueños para cumplir es por eso que  trabaja con mucha cautela y seguridad para que mas adelante pueda tener un puesto más amplio, en donde pueda abastecerse de mayor mercadería. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy  satisfecha de formar parte de su grupo comunal ya que conoce el compromiso de pago de todos los integrantes, es muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en verduras, de esta manera tendrá mayor variedad de productos que serán de preferencia  de sus clientes.
texts.en:
20-year old Magali lives with her parents and is very close to her mother. For more than five years she has sold vegetables such as lettuce, spinach, onions and other products in a market located in her neighbourhood. With her mother’s help, Magali gathers the vegetables very early in the morning and then stays in the market until approximately 3pm when they have all been sold. This job has provided Magali with her own income and allowed her to contribute to household expenses. She has many dreams to fulfill and for that reason works cautiously and sensibly so that in the future she can have a bigger stall and stock it with more products. This is her second loan with Kiva partner MFP. She is very pleased to be part of this group since she knows what commitment the members have made. Magali is very responsible with her repayments and is grateful to those people who contribute to her loan which will help greatly with the progress of her business. With the money she plans to buy more vegetables so that she will have a greater variety of products and be her customers’ favourite place to shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for her stall

loans.name: Kadidiatou

texts.fr: Kadidiatou T. Est une femme de 57 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois des Sœurs Jumelles de Sédhiou depuis le 15 juin 2009, elle y a reçu successivement 2 crédits qu'elle a remboursés régulièrement. Elle vend du miel, de l'huile de palme, du jus de citron et des tissus. Elle s'approvisionne dans les villages environnants et dans les marchés hebdomadaires de la zone. Elle a une correspondante à Dakar qui vend pour elle moyennant une commission. C'est cette dernière lui envoie des tissus qu'elle vend à Sédhiou.Son crédit lui permettra de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante en marchandises; miel, huile de palme, jus de citron et tissus et prétendre à des bénéfices qui lui permettront de participer financièrement à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Kadidiatou T. is a 57 year old married woman with six dependent children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of the Twin Sisters of Sédhiou since June 15, 2009, and she has received two successive loans that she repaid regularly. She sells honey, palm oil, lemon juice and cloth. She buys her stock in surrounding villages and the weekly markets of the zone. She has a partner in Dakar who sells for her on commission. It is this partner who sends her cloth that Mrs. T. sells in Sédhiou. Her loan will allow her to buy more honey, palm oil, lemon juice and cloth; this should provide enough income to allow her to contribute financially to the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her self-sufficiency

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María A. C.,  tiene 36  años de edad, hace 5 años se caso con Juan Carlos Delgadillo, viven en la comunidad de Polígono de la  provincia de mizque del departamento de Cochabamba, tienen dos hijos. Su esposo trabaja en construcción y ella le colabora en sus trabajos.  
 
Es muy querida y respetada en el pueblo de mizque, por lo dedicada a su familia y a su trabajo. Ella está solicitando el crédito para   comprar con su esposo una mezcladora para  facilitarle y colaborarle mucho más en los trabajos que realiza  y así  aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su condición de y que sus hijos puedan asistir al colegio en mejores condiciones. El crédito ayudara mucho en el duro trabajo que realiza su esposo juntamente con su familia.
texts.en:
María A. C. is 36 years old. Five years ago she married Juan Carlos Delgadillo and they live in the community of Polígono in the Mizque province, department of Cochabamba. They have two children. María's husband works in the construction sector and she helps him with his work. She is very loved and respected in the village of Mizque because she is devoted to her family and her work. She requests the loan to purchase a cement mixer with her husband. The mixer will enable her to help him even more in his work. This will increase their income and improve their situation, meaning that their children will be able to attend a better school. The loan will be of great help to her husband's and the family's hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cement mixer

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa de su hermana. Hace mas de 10 años se dedica en la venta de cosméticos, actividad que le permite visitar continuamente al domicilio de sus clientes y amistades ofreciendo la variedad de productos de belleza que posee. Es así que cada mañana sus ventas lo realizan a crédito, siendo estas elegidas por catálogo, o también le compran de los productos que tiene como stock. Paralelamente también ofrece lencería, ya que algunas de sus clientas le han solicitado este producto. Para ella es muy importante tener un control adecuado de sus ventas ya que esto le permitirá saber cuanto esta ganado y por ser disciplinada en sus cuentas, ha logrado acumular rentas considerables, por tanto desea tener más capital para invertir. Esta es la séptima vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, todo este tiempo de experiencia en su grupo comunal le ha servido para fortalecer su economía, además es muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más mercadería en cosméticos y tener así mayor variedad de productos para su clientela.
texts.en:
Carmen is 38 years old. She lives with her husband and two children at her sister's place. She has been selling cosmetics for 10 years, a business that allows her to continuously visit her customers and friends to offer them the assortment of beauty products she carries. Every morning she sells on credit, the products being picked through a catalogue or from her current stock. In parallel she also offers lingerie, a product some of her customers have requested. For her it's very important to adequately monitor sales so as to know how much she is earning. Her accounting discipline has enabled her to make a considerable income and now she would like to have more capital to invest. This is the seventh time she gets a loan through MFP. The time spent and experience gained in her loan group has helped her to strengthen her finances. She is very responsible when it comes to making payments and is grateful to those individuals contributing to the loan, which will be very useful in the development of her business. With the loan she is requesting she will buy more cosmetics merchandise in order to have a greater variety of products for her customer base.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cabbages, yucca, taro root, potatoes, coconuts, bananas and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: American rice, sugar, oil, chicken, toilet paper, charcoal and eggs.

loans.name: Lira

texts.es: Lira tiene 40 años, vive con  su hijo en casa de su madre. Hace mas de 2 años se dedica en la venta de  insumos e ingredientes para la industria panadera, de esa manera ha constituido una distribuidora autorizada de una marca prestigiosa, para repartir sus productos a los diferentes puntos panaderos de su localidad. Cada 15 días procura abastecerse de mercadería, es por ello que viaja a la ciudad de Lima, a conseguir estos productos. La buena atención ha hecho que gane muchos clientes, puesto que han visto la calidad y rendimiento de sus productos. Es por eso que Lira desea mejorar sus ventas vendiendo sus productos en otras ciudades. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y esta muy contenta de ser integrante de su grupo comunal que le ha traído beneficios para su negocio, será muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de mercadería en insumos como levadura, polvo de hornear y otros insumos mas que permitirán tener mas ventas.
texts.en:
Lira is 40 years old. She lives with her child in her mother’s house. For over two years she has been selling supplies and ingredients for the baking industry. She has become an authorized distributor for a prestigious brand. She delivers the products to the different baking spots in her area. She stocks up on merchandise every 15 days. She travels to the city of Lima to get these products. Her good service has won her many customers. They have seen the quality and performance of her products. That is why Lira wishes to improve her sales by selling her products in other cities. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She is very pleased to be a member of her communal bank; it has brought many benefits to her business. She will be very responsible with her payments, and she is grateful to the lenders. She will use the requested loan to buy merchandise and supplies like yeast, baking powder, and other supplies that will allow her to have more sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy yeast, baking powder, and other supplies to sell to bakeries

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace mas de 9 años comercializa frutas al por mayor, distribuyendo a los grandes comerciantes en los diversos puntos de venta de su localidad. Las ventas son muy buenas logrando quedarse solo con las cajas vacías, por tal motivo se siente muy contento y satisfecho con el trabajo que realiza. En tanto su esposo, la ayuda en el trabajo, transportando su mercadería en el camión que poseen. Este negocio es un sostén muy bueno para su familia por lo que ha decidió incrementar su capital de trabajo y vender en otros mercados aledaños a su ciudad. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, conoce  bastante la dinámica del trabajo en su grupo comunal y esta muy satisfecha de ser parte de ella, será muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del crédito que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con este crédito, comprará mas mercadería en frutas de temporada.
texts.en:
Norma, 47, lives with her husband and four children in her own home. For over nine years she has dealt in wholesale fruit, distributing her wares to the large sellers at the various points of sale where she lives. Sales are very good, leaving her alone with the empty boxes, which makes her feel very happy and satisfied with the work she does. Her husband helps her in the work, transporting her merchandise in the truck they own. This business is an excellent support for her family and she has decided to increase her working capital and sell to other markets surrounding her city. This is the seventh loan with MFP; she is well acquainted with the work dynamic in her communal bank and is highly satisfied to be part of it. She will be very responsible in making payments and would like to thank those persons who will originate the loan she is seeking, which will be quite helpful in the progress of her business. With this loan, she will buy more merchandise in the area of seasonal fruits.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more fruit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pants, blouses, and fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of zinc sheet metal, screws, sand, and purllins.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Zinc sheeting, crossbeams, rivets and other roofing materials

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.es: Stephanie tiene 19 años, vive solo con sus padres y sus abuelos en la propiedad que poseen. Siendo una joven estudiante, aprovecha las amistades que tiene para comercializar las prendas de vestir que vende. Es así que desde hace mas de 6 meses se dedica en la venta de este producto, de esa manera logra tener un control de los productos que vende y de ja a crédito. Además siempre esta al tanto de las nuevas tendencias de la moda para que pueda ofrecer a su clientela buenas opciones de consumo es por eso que viaja cada quincena a la ciudad de Lima de donde se abastece de mercadería. Pro tanto anhela aumentar su capital de trbajo para así tener mayor rentabilidad y poder solventar sus propios gastos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP,  esta muy contenta de ser parte de su grupo comunal porque todas son muy  puntuales en sus créditos, es muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del crédito que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en prendas de vestir para dama para abastecerse.
texts.en:
Stephanie is 19 years old and lives with her parents and grandparents in their home. Being a young student, she benefits from her friendships that allow her to sell more clothing. More than 6 months ago she began to sell these products, and in this way she has control over the products that she sells and requests loans for. She is always on top of new fashion trends so that she can offer her customers good options for purchase. For this reason she travels to Lima every other week to restock her merchandise. She desires to increase her wares to earn a greater profit and be able to pay her own bills. This is her second loan with MFP and she is very happy to be part of the community bank because they are all very punctual with their loans. She is very responsible with her payments and thanks the people who will provide the loan she is requesting--a loan that will be very useful for her business' progress. She will use the requested loan to invest in purchasing more women's clothing to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Women's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase zinc, stone, and payment for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of zinc and cemento

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase firewood and pay for labour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of construction materials such as  stone, cement, sand, and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 2 bulls and oxen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Elenie

texts.en:
Being single has not limited Elenie B.’s opportunity to feel what it is like to raise children and to take care of their needs every day. At home, she is accompanied by a nephew and niece. She makes them feel loved and is helping in making their lives comfortable. In a way, she feels as though she is the real mother of her loving nephew and niece. From them, she draws out strength and determination to work hard and improve their standard of living. Nevertheless, Elenie still looks forward to having her own family in the future. But, meanwhile, she wants to be financially stable. 

To be able to reach her dream of having a stable source of income to support her above-mentioned aspirations, she joined ASHI in 2003. Loans made to her since then until the present have enabled her to start raising hogs and buying and selling them as a business. All throughout her membership, Elenie has never been a problem for her co-members in terms of payment. 

She believes that fate has been good to her without giving her a hard time to manage her business. After four months of raising her hogs, she sells them either alive or slaughtered to people in her village and sometimes in the market. Along with that, she also buys different commodities for selling. 

Elenie enjoys spending the small profit she earns through the business to give her niece and nephew necessary things. However, thinking about a better kind of house to comfort and shelter her and the children she is taking care of, the urge to grow her business further becomes so intense. Because of that, she is requesting a much larger amount of loan for the financial capital growing her business requires.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets to raise and to purchase commodities to resell

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
To graduate her two children from college is Marivic Z.’s greatest desire as a mother. She doesn’t like her children to experience the bitter experiences she had in her past.
