Living a life for 28 years that offers very few opportunities to grow as a person and for enjoyment makes her so determined to make herself a successful businesswoman in the future and bring her family out from under the umbrella of poverty. 

With these visions, Marivic joined ASHI in 2008. She has received a loan since then and has been able to start up a “sari- sari” store for a business.  “Sari-sari” means that various foodstuffs, beverages and an assortment of grocery items are sold in a small, open room of their house. For Marivic and her family, the small profit her store is gaining is a great help to augment the sporadic and small income of her husband, who works as a hired laborer.  

Through the loan she is requesting presently, Marivic hopes to grow her business further to increase its profit to support the needs of her family and to improve the kind of life they are having.

loans.use: To purchase additional items for the inventory of her "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Byambaa

texts.en: Byambaa L. is 47 years old and lives with her two daughters in Tosontsengel, one of the biggest towns of the Zavhan province in western Mongolia. Both of her daughters are students. Her husband died by car accident in 2006, and since then, Byambaa has been trying her best to raise her two children as a single parent along with operating her boot-making business. She operates a small boot-making and repair business in her town. She makes durable boots called buriad and traditional boots, which she trades with herders in the surrounding countryside. When the peak period of demand for boots comes, she also trades her boots in exchange for a variety of products. Byambaa started her business in 2007 and has quickly found success. Her business has enabled her to keep up both of her homes and provide a quality life for her family. Byambaa is a very hard-working and business-minded person. She always looks for ways to increase her earnings and improve her business. She said, “Year by year, I have experimented with making a variety of style of boots, which are potentially sold among the herdsmen, and it seems quite profitable for me. I will continue to produce boots and I am trying to do many things in order to provide for my daughters." Byambaa is requesting a 1,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase materials such as felt boots, leather and rubber for her boot-making business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet R. is from the village of Santa Felomena, Iligan City. At the age of 35 years old, she is married and has one young infant. To make a living, Juliet owns & operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks especially native delicacies in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients for her food products. Juliet is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase more raw ingredients needed to make her food products. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Juliet from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for food products

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Salie

texts.en:
36 year old Salie S. aims to grow her “sari-sari” store into a grocery store which can provide wholesale grocery items, foodstuff, beverages and other basic commodities. “Sari-sari” means various foodstuffs, beverages and an assortment of grocery items are sold in a small open room of their house. This is the kind of income generating activity that Salie has been enjoying since the time she joined ASHI and had her loan. The small profit she makes in addition to her husband’s income as a hired jeep driver helps them meet the needs of her three children. This way, she is able to maintain her family’s good health.

Being a mother, Salie has so many dreams for her children. A top priority is to ensure that they have a degree in college to ensure a better career. While they are still young, she wanted to request more loans to increase her capital investment and make her business stable and profitable in the future.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items, foodstuff and beverages for the inventories of her "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Enh=Amgalan

texts.en:
Enh-Amgalan D. lives in Zavhan province in western Mongolia with his wife and two children. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His youngest child currently attends a local primary school while the elder son stays at home taking care of the family members. Enh-Amgalan operates a small sewing business in his town with the help of his younger sister. He repairs and produces a variety of clothing items and ger curtain covers for his customers at a small workspace. Enh-Amgalan started his sewing business in 2007 by himself, but is now partnered with his sister in the business.

His business is very important for him and his family as it is their only source of income. He has worked hard and found some success, but struggles to support both of his children and sick wife who has suffered from brucellosis. With his business earnings, he was able to build a new small house which is 30% in the process of construction while changing his own ger cover and curtain in full. For the future, Enh-Amgalan hopes to progress his business to provide local citizens with necessary ger materials and make permanent supplement at lowest prices. He says "I hope to one day own my own workspace and hire some people in order to expand my business." He is requesting a 1,400,000 MNT loan to purchase fabrics and materials for his sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for sewing business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn S. is 46 years old and a very simple woman. She has tried to enjoy her life to the fullest despite being poor. When she became a mother to her two children, the urge to discover her potential to be productive and help her husband earn money for their living pre-occupied her thoughts. This has intensified with her eldest child going to college, the second in high school. 

With determination to graduate her children from college and improving their standard of living, she joined ASHI in 2003. The first loan she received was used to finance and grow a vegetable business. This kind of livelihood activity is the most common source of income of the many families in the village where Evelyn and her family live. Every day they go to different municipalities to market their products. Evelyn works hard with her husband to bring home money to support to the needs of their children. Given the opportunity to have larger amount of capital, Evelyn and her husband hope to make their business stable and profitable. Through this, they will be able to make life enjoyable for their children until they are capable of living their own lives away from poverty.

loans.use: To purchase large volume of vegetables for sale

loans.name: Enhbaatar

texts.en:
Enhbaatar C. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Zavhan province in Western Mongolia. His oldest child currently attends a local secondary school. Enhbaatar started a boot making business in his town with the help of his wife in 1996. He works hard as his business is the only source of income for his family income. He has also gained much experience and skill in his trade. He specializes in making warm, winter boots for herders, thus the winter season is especially busy for him. He is a very hardworking and open-minded businessman and always looks for ways to grow and expand his business. 

His business is important as he would like to build a workspace and improve his family's quality of live. He hopes to expand his production line by producing "buriat," a popular style of Mongolian traditional shoes and boots. His hope is that by diversifying his products, it will increase his overall sales and balance his income throughout the year. He hopes that one day he will be able to provide quality boots to customers throughout his province and hire at least two employee in order to produce boots continuously. Enhbaatar is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase raw materials and different types of leather for his shoe making business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for boot-making business

loans.name: Merelyn

texts.en:
Merelyn O., 38 years old, is from the village of Maputi, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. Merelyn is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Merelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling of bags in the local community. Merelyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Merelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials for the business. Merelyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw items to expand product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Merelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw items to expand product line in retail store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials such as sand, blocks and cement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair her billiard tables and buy accessories for her games.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials such as zinc, sand, blocks and wood to fix the roof of his house.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita L. is from the village of Salvador St. Iligan City. At the age of 30, Conchita is married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Conchita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & native delicacies in the local community. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Conchita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients for her food products. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Conchita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products

location.town: Salvador St., Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Jenesusa

texts.en:
Jenesusa A. is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. She is 42 years old. Jenesusa is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Jenesusa owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from hauling plastic, metal, bottle scraps, and other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Jenesusa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2009, Jenesusa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenesusa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase plastics and other recyclables. Jenesusa is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jenesusa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda M. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. 35 years old, she is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Brenda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She also sell some home-made viand like longganisa. Brenda has been working at her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Brenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Brenda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products for her sari-sari store. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Brenda from HSPFI. She plans to use additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products for sari-sari store

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace B. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Mary Grace is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Grace owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dried fish, home-made peanut butter, viand like longanisa in the local community. Mary Grace has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mary Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Grace is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase products for her sari-sari store. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Grace. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products for sari-sari store

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma J. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old. Norma is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Norma operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including different varieties of fish and shrimp, in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Norma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Norma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Safia Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Safia akhtar lives in the city of Vehari with her husband and son. Her husband runs a scrap business while her son is a rickshaw driver.

 
Safia is a very supportive lady and works in a Government job. Her job is the major source of income for her family. Her duty timings are from 8am to 2pm. In her free time she does domestic sewing to make more money. 


She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her son who will repair his auto rickshaw. His rickshaw was badly damaged in an accident a few days ago. By the grace of God he was not injured in this accident. 


She hopes that, by repairing the rickshaw, her son will be able to work again full-time and make a good income for the family.

loans.use: to repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Joje

texts.en:
Joje A. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 39 years old. Joje is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Joje owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling school products such as pencils, pens, and notebooks, as well as food and other kinds of daily necessities, to the local community. Joje has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Joje joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joje is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Joje from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

In 2010, Rosalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Rosalie from HSPFI. texts.en:
Teresita V. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 55 years old. Teresita is married and has 6 adult children. She owns & operates a bakery business where she sells loaf bread, star bread and other different kinds of breads to the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Rafiqan Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Rafiqan bibi is very supportive of her family. She does embroidery work to help her husband fulfill the basic needs of their family. 


Her husband is a tailor and operates a tailor shop in the market. They live in a city called Vehari in Pakistan.They are both very hard working and manage their work efficiently. 


As inflation is increasing day by day, it is becoming hard for them to pay for utilities and manage their work. Therefore, Rafiqan has applied for a loan from Asasah to expand her embroidery business. She will buy clothes in bulk and sell finished embroidered products rather than embroidering clothes supplied by her customers. She is hopeful that she can double her income and improve their financial situation.

Note: "In this photo, Sakina, a group member, is showing her chair filling business".

loans.use: to purchase clothes in bulk to embroider

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma M. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old and is single. She owns & operates a motorela, or habal-habal, transportation business. A habal-habal is a motorcycle with an extended seat that can carry several passengers. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to maintain service. This will be the first loan taken out by Gemma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to maintain her transport service

loans.name: Naziran Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Naziran bibi lives in Vehari Pakistan. Her daughter married G. Abbas, a local cable operator, a few years ago. 
His business is suffering these days as he needs to buy cable to provide his services to more clients over a larger area. 
Naziran bibi works in a Government health department and also makes embroidered clothes. She not only supports her family but is also helping her son-in-law financially until his business gets established. For that reason she has applied for a loan from Asasah.

loans.use: to purchase cable

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta M. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 57 years old. Julieta is married and has 7 adult children. She owns & operates a seafood business where she buys and sells different types of ocean-caught fish. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Julieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Julieta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Naseem akhtar lives in the city of Vehari in Pakistan where she operates a grocery shop. She is the mother of three children who all work.

 
Naseem is out of stock these days and desperately needs investment in her business to meet customer demand. Therefore, she has applied for a loan from Asasah to invest in her grocery shop so that she can meet demand and increase her income.

 
She thinks that she can make more income from her shop which will help her to cover her family's expenses. She will also save money from the profit for her oldest son’s marriage.

Note: "Naseem's shop is located in the market".

loans.use: to purchase stock

loans.name: Ludina

texts.en:
Ludina F. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old, married and has 4 adult children. Ludina owns & operates a seafood store where she sells a variety of fish. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ludina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Ludina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Даминова Мунира проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 30 лет. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Муж работает в строительной компании. Сама Мунира имеет среднее образование. Занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном продает муку. В этой области более 6 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Munira D. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 30 years old, married and has 2 children. Her husband works at a construction company. Munira has a secondary education and is involved in retail sales at a market. She primarily sells flour. She has been in this business for over 6 years. Munira is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Khlang

texts.en:
Mr. Klang H. is an older man whose wife appears in the photo. Klang H. farms rice on a plot of land inherited from his parents. He has six children; three are married and the other three are single with two attending school. His wife works in the field with him. They are popular as they always show respect to their neighbors and help them. 


In addition to their farming work, Klang H. and his wife own a small, wooden-bed sales point. They order beds and resell them to make a profit. 


Klang H. is taking out this loan to build a new, small, wooden house for his married children to live in.

loans.use: To build a house.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Mrs. Sor E. is a married mother, 45 years old, who is blessed with six children. Three of her children are employed: two daughters work as seamstresses in the garment factory and one is a plantation worker.  Sor E. and her husband are in the business of fishing. The couple also cultivates rice on their own farmland during the growing season. Currently, fishing has been temporarily interrupted because of broken fishing equipment and it has affecting their income. For this reason,  Sor E. requested a loan in order to buy additional fishing equipment.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing equipment.

loans.name: Anorbi

texts.ru: Умарова Анорби проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 45 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Более 6 лет занимается торговлей. Она в основном продает фрукты. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Anorbi U. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 45 years old, married and has 3 children. She has a secondary education and has been involved in retail sales for over 6 years. She primarily sells fruits. Anorbi is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Bushra Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Bushra Bibi lives in a city called Vehari, in Pakistan. She is the mother of three sons and none of them could continue their education due to financial reasons. Her husband runs a scrap business and she does embroidery works to financially support the family. 

Bushra Bibi has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband who wants to expand his business by adding more scrap supplies for his shop. 
She wants to educate her children and she hopes that she can do it by increasing their household income.

loans.use: Purchase scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorn N. is a 37-year-old mother of three. She raises pigs and grows rice as part of her daily routine. Besides the profit earned from her farming, she relies on her husband's business of climbing palm trees, and fishing in Tunle Sap Lake. The family includes three children, and one of them is enrolled in primary school. 

The coming rainfall is good for growing, however, Thorn N. requires additional capital to use on her farm. So, Thorn N. is requesting a loan to use towards planting rice crops.

loans.use: To use towards planting rice crops.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
58 year- old Fatima P. hopes to increase the profit she earns through selling her fattened hogs. To do that, she must increase the volume of hogs that she raises for sale. Fatima, who has been a member of ASHI (KIVA field partner in the Philippines) since 2007, is requesting a loan to increase her business capital.

Fatima’s business is a big thing for her family. Her husband who is unemployed has been unable to participate in the income generation for the family especially for the education of their two children who are all now  in college.  She wants them to earn a college degree which she believes will lead to a better life in the future. Fatima is quite sad because one of her children has not been able to graduate from college though the other one is now working as a seaman. That achievement was made possible with the support of her husband’s brother. 

Despite having other people's help to financially support her family, Fatima still wants to increase her own savings fund by making her business stable and profitable. This will support the daily expenses of her children and for the cataract eye operation she has to undergo.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for a hog fattening business.

loans.name: Soeng

texts.en:
Mr. Soeng T. is a humble villager residing in the province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia. He has a life partner in his wife who appears in the photo. She raises pigs and rice crops and sells them to buyers when they come to maturity. The couple has three kids, two of whom are no longer in school and are working, and the other one is going to school.

To pursue a daily income, Soeng T. travels to buy chop-wood (firewood) from the forest people and returns with it to retail at his home. He faces an obstacle: he has always hired a neighbor’s buffalo at a high price in order to transport his chop-wood from the forest. He wants to cut down this hiring fee by requesting a loan to purchase a couple of water buffalo that he will use to pick up his chop-wood.

loans.use: To purchase a couple of water buffalo that he will use to pick up chop-wood

loans.name: Kulnara's Group

texts.en: Kulnara U. is the leader of this group. She is 45 years old and married. She has a daughter, who is 24 and works in a sewing workshop in Bishkek. Three years ago, Kulnara and her husband rented a store to sell auto parts. They started with an initial investment of 15000 soms. Kulnara has begun to sell motor oil in the store. Now she makes 25000 soms per month. With money received from this loan, Kulnara wants to purchase motor oil for trucks and auto parts to increase the turnover of her business. In the future she wants to save money to be able to pay for her grandchildren's study at university. Zoya B. is the treasurer of the group. She is 28 and divorced. A year ago, some relatives gave a cow as a present for her father’s anniversary. Zoya resold that cow after fattening it and made good money. After that, she began to breed cattle. She started with an initial investment of 8000 soms and now she makes 5000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to purchase household appliances and repair the house. Zoya applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase some farm animals for breeding. Kalysbek A., 30, is married. He has a son who is 7 and studies at school. Six years ago, Kalysbek’s brother suggested he rent a place and open a karaoke bar. Kalysbek started this business activity with an initial investment of 15000 soms and now he makes 30000 soms per month. This profit made it possible for him to open a pool and bathhouse near his place. With money received from the loan, Kalysbek wants to purchase a shower cubicle for the bathhouse. In the future, he wishes to open an entertainment center. B. K. Astra, 19, is married. Four years ago, with the initial investment of 25000 soms, Astra began to sell chicken grill and now she makes 20000 soms per month. With money received from this loan she wants to purchase chicken. Ainura K., 39, is divorced. She has raised two sons. The first son is 25; he works at a pasta factory. The second son is 20; he is a student. When the children have free time they try to help their mom. Ainura opened a kiosk four years ago. She sells convenience goods and makes 7000 soms per month. She applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase various goods in order to increase her turnover. In the future, Ainura plans to open a grocery store. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase motor oil and auto parts

loans.name: Chey

texts.en: Mrs. Chey S., 48, is a modest woman living in Kompong Tom Province. She is a local cultivator, raising pigs and growing crops on her own farmland. To help meet the family's daily expense needs, her husband works selling wooden beds that he makes himself. He owns a cart and he uses it to pick up beds to sell around his community. The couple have four children: two are now married and two are single. Both of the children are employed and provide some of their income to meet the financial needs of their family. To generate additional income, Chey S. is applying for a loan in order to buy a plowing machine for their use and also to rent to farmers during the farming season.

loans.use: To buy a plowing machine for their use and also to rent to farmers during the farming season.

loans.name: Meliza

texts.en:
Meliza P. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Meliza is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Meliza owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling a variety of ocean-caught fish in the local community. Meliza has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Meliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meliza is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Meliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa M. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Elsa is married and has six school-age children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling a variety of ocean-caught fish in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

loans.name: Sheeman Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Sheeman bibi lives in the area of Anwerabad which is in a city called Vehari in Pakistan. She is living in a poor financial condition and that’s why she has to work to support her husband. A very shy lady, Sheeman operates a domestic-sewing business for her neighborhood clients.

Sheeman bibi has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband who has been involved in the business of scrap for the last six years. With the loan he will buy more scrap material that will enhance his income due to the availability of more stock.

Sheeman bibi has been married for the last fifteen years but she does not have any children. That’s why she operates her sewing business to spend her time.

loans.use: To enable her husband to purchase more scrap for his scrap business

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina B. lives in a small area of the city of Vehari, Pakistan, called Anwerabad. She lives in a two-room brick house with her family. Her husband has a scrap business and she supports him by selling clothes. She has a number of clients in her area and in neighboring villages where she sells her clothes to earn an income.

Zarina B.’s husband’s business is not doing well these days due to the shortage of scrap material. Therefore, she has applied for a loan from Asasah to help her husband who will invest the money in his business to buy more scrap material. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will stand on its feet again with the help of this investment.

loans.use: To enable her husband to purchase more scrap for his scrap business

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina T. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 39 years old, is married, and has eight school-aged children. Divina owns and operates a business running a food stall, primarily selling roasted meat and hotdogs or meat barbecues in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Divina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita L. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 52 years old, is married, and has four adult children.

Anecita owns and operates a business buying and selling of fish  in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Anecita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Hanifaan Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Hanifaan bibi lives in a city called Vehari in Pakistan. She doesn’t have any children. She spends her time doing domestic chores and cooking food for her husband. Her husband’s family praises her good nature and caring behavior towards them.  

Her husband's name is S. and he runs a scrap business in the market. He has six years of experience in this business. He has a little stock in his shop which becomes a reason for losing customers day by day. 

Therefore, Hanifaan has applied for a loan from Asasah to invest the loan amount in her husband’s scrap business.  She is hopeful that her husband will be able to re-establish his business and get back his customers, too.

loans.use: Purchase scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Talino

texts.en:
Talino D. V. is from the village of  Balbagon Mambajao, Camiguin. He is 36 years old. Talino is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Talino owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services used to transport local community members. Talino has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Talino joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Talino is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Talino from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan D. Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is 50 years old. He is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya. He is married and has 4 children between the age of 12 and 20. Three of the children are still attending school.

Wilfred has been farming for 30 years and has employed 2 farm-hands. His main products are maize, beans, bananas, and sorghum which he sells on the local market. He is also a carpenter and a timber merchant (pictured here in his shop). His major challenges in farming have been lack of an organised market for his products and lack of capital to expand his farming activities.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo in the amount of KES.50,000 to expand his dairy unit and plant more nappier grass for his cows. He believes this loan will increase his milk production and earn him extra income that will help him educate his children and provide for their basic needs.

In future, he intends to improve his dairy herd by buying more cows of superior quality for higher production of milk. He recommends that Juhudi should increase the amounts of loans being issued.

loans.use: To expand his dairy unit and plant more nappier grass for his cows

loans.name: Cindy

texts.en:
Cindy A. is from the village of Poblacion, Iligan City. She is 18 years old. Cindy is single. To make a living, Cindy owns & operates a clothing business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling used clothing or "ukay-ukay" to local community members. Cindy has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cindy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cindy is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Cindy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Milaluz

texts.en:
Milaluz L. is from the village of Poblacion, Iligan City. She is 47 years old. Milaluz is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Milaluz owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Milaluz has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Milaluz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milaluz is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Milaluz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat operates a mixed farm in the town of Kisii in Western Kenya. He has been farming for ten years and produces tea, tree seedlings, vegetables and maize which he sells locally. He also owns and operates a spare-parts shop in the same area (he is pictured outside his shop).

Josephat is 35 years old and married with five children between the ages of 3 and 13. Four of the children are currently attending school.

Josephat has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo, having successfully completed his second loan. He has requested this loan of KES 50,000 to construct a dairy unit and purchase a water tank to store water for his dairy cows. He believes that, from this investment, he will be able to get more yield from his dairy cows and hence more income that will enable him pay school fees for his children.

Josephat’s biggest challenge, however, has been diseases and pests which affect his animals and crops. He would like to purchase more dairy cows in future, which will increase his milk production. He is also requesting Juhudi to continue offering and facilitating training for farmers on agribusiness management.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit and purchase a water tank for his cows

loans.name: Suraiya Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya bibi is a resident of a city called Vehari which is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. She is an uneducated lady because her parents couldn’t afford the education expenses. She doesn’t want the same destiny to befall to her children. Presently, she has no children but she prays to God that if He blesses her with a child she will give the child better education facilities and make the future bright.

Suraiya bibi is a housewife; she stays at home and does domestic chores. Her husband’s name is F. M. and he runs a scrap business in the market. Suraiya has applied for a loan from Asasah to financially assist her husband who will buy more scrap for his scrap business.

loans.use: To enable her husband to purchase more scrap for his scrap business

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en: Jeffrey S. is from the village of Port Area, Poblacion, Iligan City. He is 35 years old and is single. Jeffrey owns and operates a furniture-making business, primarily making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Jeffrey joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional furniture

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Dionysius

texts.en:
Dionysius is a farmer from the town of Kisii in western Kenya. He has been farming for the past ten years and employs two people from his community. His main products are tea, milk, eggs, chicken, maize and beans which he sells locally. Apart from farming, he also operates a retail shop and a hotel (restaurant) in the same area.

Dionysius is 32 years old. He is married and blessed with two children aged 2 and 5.

Dionysius’s biggest challenges in farming have been the lack of a defined market for his products, a poor road transport network and debtors who are not creditworthy, thus affecting the growth of his business.

Dionysius recently completed his previous loan of KES 45,000 from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of KES 70,000 to purchase a dairy cow. The profits from this loan will enable him to pay school fees for his children and pay rent for his business premises.

In future, Dionysius plans to venture into a transportation business and, if possible, purchase a Canter (a Mitsubishi light-duty  commercial vehicle) to assist him in transporting cereals to the market. He is asking Juhudi for more funding in the future and asking Jehudi to diversify its loan products to include loans for school fees and top-up loans.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a farmer in the town of Kisii in western Kenya. He is 48 years old and married with six children between the ages of 11 and 25. All his children attend school.

Peter has been farming for the last twenty-five years and produces tea, maize, bananas and coffee which he sells to the local market and to institutions like schools. He depends solely on the income from his farming activities to provide for the basic needs of his family.

Peter has requested this loan of KES 50,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to improve his dairy unit and plant more Napier grass (a type of grass used for grazing) for his dairy cows. This loan will improve his farming and hence earn him more income that will enable him pay school fees for his children and provide for their basic needs.

Peter’s primary challenge has been the lack of good markets, especially for milk and maize, because the prices are low.

Peter is requesting Juhudi to reduce their interest rates to make it affordable to farmers and to increase the size of loans offered.

loans.use: To improve his dairy unit and plant more Napier grass

loans.name: Liezl Vannesa

texts.en:
Liezl Vannesa L. is from the village of Poblacion, Iligan City. She is 24 years old. Liezl Vannesa is single. To make a living, Liezl Vannesa owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling clothes, shoes and stuffed toys in the local community. Liezl Vannesa has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Liezl Vannesa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liezl Vannesa is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Liezl Vannesa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Koske

texts.en:
Koske is 32 years old. He is married and has 2 children, ages 4 and 6. His elder child attends school. He is a dairy farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for the past 3 years and has employed one farm-hand. He sells his milk to Kenya Cooperative Creameries. He also practises cash-crop farming and produces tea which he sells on the local market.

His primary challenges have been lack of artificial insemination services, poor prices for milk, and lack of enough funds to build a good dairy unit.

Koske has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES.45,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. With this loan, the income of the family will increase and this will help him repay the loan and provide for the family. In future, he would like to improve his dairy farming to a sustainable level by acquiring 5 quality dairy cows.

He is grateful to Juhudi for the financial support and requests more funding in future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida lives in Anwerabad which is a small residential area in Vehari, Pakistan. She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband who wants to expand his scrap business. She has two children, a son and a daughter. 

Khalida bibi loves her family, she wants to give her children  the best possible education, and she thinks that she can do it by expanding her husband’s business.

Note: In this picture, Khalida is showing her goat which she loves to take care of.

loans.use: Purchase scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is divorced. She lives with her teen-aged daughter and grown-up son. She operates a small business located at an open market in Nova Kahovka town. Larisa sells table-cloths and anti-mosquito screens.

Larisa has been in this business for 14 years. The inventories she sells are in high demand, so she always has many customers. Larisa enjoys her business and would like to develop it further. This business is the only source of income for Larisa's family.

Larisa would like to borrow 12,000 UAH to increase the assortment of her inventory. She hopes to receive additional profit that would be spent on family needs.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of products

loans.name: Maksim

texts.en:
Maksim M. is 60 years old. His children are married and live separately from their parents, who live in Tsakhkunk village, Sevan area. For about 25 years Maksim worked as a driver in different organizations. 

For 17 years now, Maksim has been engaging in farming: on his farm he has cows and calves, sheep and lambs, and a plot of land. With income from his farming, he supports his family and develops his farm. Maksim’s wife helps him a lot with this hard work.
    
Now Maksim is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. (This spring, the weather in Sevan region was very rainy, so villagers are forced to plant the seeds in the summer months.)

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Lusviminda

texts.en:
Lusviminda D. is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. She is 54 years old. Lusviminda is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Lusviminda owns & operates providing recycling services. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling plastics & other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Lusviminda has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lusviminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lusviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell. Lusviminda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lusviminda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en:
Perpetua S. is from the village of   Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 34 years old. Perpetua is single and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Perpetua owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Perpetua has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Perpetua joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perpetua is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Perpetua from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Binh

texts.en:
Binh T. L. was born in 1969. She lives with her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter). Her husband is a carpenter. She has a medicine shop. She not only sells medicines, but  she also grows rice and raises pigs. She has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

She wants to expand her medicine shop. So she would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND. This is the first time she is participating in SEDA. She will try to repay her loan punctually.

loans.use: to expand her medicine shop

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn V. is from the village of  Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Arlyn is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Arlyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Arlyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Arlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
