Elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé, elle sollicite de WAGES un autre prêt pour l’achat de 15 sacs de charbons de bois et divers produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
This woman is a widow. To earn a livng, she started selling bags of charcoal. Using her business experience,she later began selling groceries. She has repaid one loan from WAGES, and is asking for another to buy 15 bags of charcoal and various grocery products.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy charcoal

loans.name: Essoyomeuve

texts.fr: Aya est une femme mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de sacs de charbons de bois et de bois de chauffage, elle s’approvisionne au nord du Togo car dans cette zone le sac de charbon de bois revient moins coûteux, sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes.  Son stock de marchandises a subit une baisse elle voudrait se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de charbons de bois et des bois de chauffage.
texts.en:
Aya is married with two children. To earn a living she sells charcoal and firewood. She buys them in northern Togo, where charcoal is cheaper. Her customers are from all backgrounds. Because her stock ran low, she would like to build it up again. That is why she is asking for a loan from WAGES to buy charcoal and firewood.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 22-year-old single man. He operates a motorbike transport business to earn a living and also farms to earn extra income.

Samuel is an active member of Tinganga Mrireri group in Faulu Kenya whose members’ aim is to save money, share business ideas and guarantee each other’s loans.

Samuel has requested 50,000 KES to buy another motorbike to meet his customers’ demands. He hopes to venture into a taxi business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike

loans.name: Effoa

texts.fr: effoa exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales, elle a commencé ce commerce l'année passée et ce commerce marche bien pour elle, elle réalise de très bonnes recettes, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. sa clientèle a augmenté par rapport à l'année passée, pour les satisfaire tous, elle souhaite agrandir son stock de marchandises raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 15 sacs de céréales.
texts.en:
Effoa has a revenue-generating business in the sale of grains. She begain this business last year and it is going very well for her; her earnings are good. She is married and the mother of two children. Compared to the past year her clientele has increased. She wants to expand her stock of merchandise in order to satisfy customer demand. This is the reason she is asking for a loan from WAGES to purchase 15 sacks of grains.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of grain

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 51 years old and single. She has been selling second-hand clothes since 2008 and also farms for extra income.

Agnes’s business has really grown since she joined Wanjaka group in Faulu Kenya. This is because she uses her savings with the group to improve her business. She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to add to her stock. She hopes to open other outlets in the future.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes

loans.name: N'danida

texts.fr: après son apprentissage, T. a ouvert son atelier de coiffure qu'elle a appelé " BENEDICTION", elle est très connue dans son quartier , afin d'augmenter ses recettes elle a associé à son activité le commerce de produits de beauté. la demande de produits de beauté est de plus en plus élevée, c'est pourquoi elle voudrait s'approvisionner et demande un crédit chez WAGES pour acheter des mèches, des tissages et diverrs autres produits de beauté. elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants
texts.en:
After her apprenticsehip, Ms. T. opened a beauty salon called "Benediction." She is well-known in her neighborhood. To increase her income, she also sells cosmetic products, the demand for which is growing, For that reason, she has asked WAGES for a loan to buy braids, extensions and other cosmetic items. She is married and has two children.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy braids, extensions and other beauty products

loans.name: Noruzkan's Group

texts.en: Noruzkan B. is the leader of this group. She is 55 and married. She has a son who is 30 and who works as a private driver. Noruzkan rents a place where she sells convenience goods. She has been doing this for ten years and started with the initial investment of 30,000 soms. Now she makes 10,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase a variety of goods in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future Noruzkan plans to expand her business. Ainagul K., 37, is married. She has two sons and a daughter: the sons are in school but the daughter is not yet. Ainagul’s husband went to Russia to work to make some money. Ainagul herself rents a place where she sells convenience goods. She started her business activity three years ago with the initial investment of 30,000 soms and now she makes 10,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase a variety of goods in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future Ainagul wants to build her own store. Shaanigul A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 23 and married and has a son who is just three years old. Shaanigul works in a post office and her husband works in a state registry department. Five years ago Shaanigul and her husband began to breed cattle. They started this activity with an initial investment of 25,000 soms. Sometimes, if they need money, they can sell some farm animals to cover their expenses. With the money received from the loan, Shaanigul wants to purchase a cow to increase the number of her cattle. In the future she wants to purchase a vehicle. Bukush K., 63, is a widow. She has a son and a daughter. Three years ago Bukush got a loan and bought equipment which is needed to prepare cakes. By taking orders and selling cakes, Bukush makes 10,000 soms per month. With the money received from the loan she wants to purchase flour. In the future, Bukush plans to open a confectionery shop. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods in order to increase the turnover of her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks

loans.name: Strong Hope Group

texts.en:
Cynthia K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Strong Hope. She is 42 years old, single and has three children who range from 13 to 21 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For 4 years, she has been selling used clothes in Red Light Market, Paynesville on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this group loan to buy more used clothes. 

Her goal is to improve her business and build her dream house .

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Josephine is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes.

loans.name: Sabira

texts.en:
Sabira I. is 56 years old. She was born and graduated in Naryn (Kyrgyz Republic), got married and gave birth to one daughter. Sabira’s family has always been engaged in animal husbandry, breeding cattle and calves. Sabira had to do all the work by herself after her husband died in 1995. When her daughter got married, she moved to her husband’s place and gave birth to three children, but Samira was helped by relatives who fed the cattle and looked after them. This allowed Sabira to start a small side business – she opened up a small cafe, where she sold drinks and food. In 2008, Sabira started to have problems with blood pressure and doctors recommended her to change her place of residence (Naryn is high-altitude city, located at 2000 m above sea level).

So Sabira I. sold her cattle and decided to move to the village of Orlovka (Kemin region). She was accompanied by her daughter, whose husband had died, and her three grandchildren. In Orlovka, she bought a house and started poultry farming. At the moment she keeps about 15 chickens. Sabira wants to obtain a loan of 20,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy chickens, chicks, and ducks to increase the number of her poultry. Her fowl will pasture on an available lot near her house.

In the future, Sabira I. plans to further expand her poultry farm so as to provide the citizens of the Kemin and Chuy regions with meat and eggs. Despite having lost family members, Sabira continues to be optimistic about the future, because she needs to help her daughter raise the children and allow them to have a good education and a decent life.

loans.use: To purchase hens, chicks, and ducks to raise

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn C. is a married woman who lives in Purok 3, Brgy. Linaon, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a fishing business. Her husband, Rosito, who is 42 years old, is a fisherman. Marilyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marilyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly income of 28,000 PHP, improving her family's standard of living. This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing 20,000 PHP which she intends to use to repair their fishing boat so that she can continue to save up for future expansion of the business. Marilyn C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Kamigamba Katukore, Ibanda Group

texts.en: Hard working N. Milton has been operating an agro produce sales business from Kamigamba, Ibanda for a period of 8 years. With nostalgia, this happily married father of 3 children recalls how his business basked in high profit returns at its onset. Times have changed,  however, as the business now produces diminishing returns, earning him 100,000 Ugandan shillings less than previous earnings. There is always a story connected with people in western Uganda who despite laboring under tough times, always seem to find a way of educating their children. Milton is no exceptional. What he is looking forward to with this loan is the prospect of enhancing his business by buying more maize, grains, beans, rice, millet cassava and other cash crops. This will improve his revenue and also make him more able to meet his day to day life necessities.

loans.use: purchasing more produce for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a new trisikad (bike with sidecar) and maintenance.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret E. currently sells tomatoes and green vegetables at market and is requesting a loan to stock fish to sell.  Margret is 45 years old and is widowed.   She has 5 children who do not attend.  With the extra profits resulting from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business by stocking bags of maize, beans and rice to sell.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock fish to sell

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice K. currently sells various items like sugar and salt in a shop.  She is requesting a loan to stock more boxes of washing powder and soap to sell.  Joice is 31 years old and is married.  Her husband is a teacher. The couple has 3 children, who attend school. 

With the extra profits resulting from her loan, Joice hopes to be able to extend the floor of her shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more boxes of washing powder and soap to sell

loans.name: Gyenvudde Development Group-Lugazi

texts.en: It is now a decade since 45 year old, enterprising, N. Gitta started her general merchandise retail shop in Nyenga-Lugazi. With a modest savings from her farming and charcoal sells business, she embarked on this business. For this married mother of 6, determination and hard work have been the stock in trade attributes that she has banked on to give her business an edge. She has used profits from her business to not only give an improved lease on life to her family’s welfare, but she has also used it as a ways and means of consolidating her business. In a week,her business generates her 250,000 shillings. She also still maintains her farming and charcoal making business. She envisions owning a wholesale business in the future. Gitta says the first step to making this dream come to fruition is through acquiring this loan. With this loan she plans to use to purchase in bulk more retail items like bars of soap, sugar, posho and salt for her shop. She says that she will make a strong head way towards achieving her goals.

loans.use: The purchase of retail items like soap, sugar, posho and salt

loans.name: Lurdes Celeste

texts.pt:
Lurdes Celeste N. nasceu na Capital do pais cidade de Maputo, é casada mãe de 3 filhos: de 22,19 e 14 anos, todos vão a escola. Fez a 6ª classe não continuou com os estudos devido a falta de condições por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com sua familia e sustenta duas sobrinhas que vivem com ela em sua casa.

Lurdes apos concluir a 6ª classe, junta se com o seu marido e passa a viver no Distrito de Namaacha na Provincia do Maputo. Com ajuda do esposo constroi uma pequena loja na sua residência como forma de aumentar a renda familiar, vende produtos de primeira necessidade, tem como melhor produto o (sabão bingo, farinha de milho, feijão e arroz em kilos),faz uma receita diaria de 800 mt e consegue poupar 1000.00mt por mês.


Este é o quarto empréstimo de Lurdes na Hluvuku e Kiva no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (farinha de milho, feijão, arroz, sabão e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seus produtos. Os empréstimos anteriores no valor de 10.000.00mt,10.500.00mt e 15.000.00mt foram para a mesma finalidade. 

Está confiante que vai pagar antes do prazo estipulado. No futuro Lurdes gostaria de melhorar as condições de sua loja e eventualmente abrir uma loja no mercado central, onde poderia vender mais ainda.
texts.en:
Lurdes Celeste was born in the country's capital, Maputo. She is married and the mother of 3 children who are 22, 19 and 14 years old. All children go to school. She only completed 6th grade and didn't finish school due to her parents' lack of financial resources. She lives in her own house with her family and supports two nieces who live with her. After 6th grade Lurdes moved in with her husband and started living in the Namaacha District, Province of Maputo. With her husband's help, she built a small shop in her house as a way to increase the family's income. She sells household staples and her best selling products are "bingo" soap, corn flour, beans and rice by the kilo. She has a daily income of 800 meticais and manages to save 1,000 meticais per month. This loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticais is her fourth with Hluvuku and Kiva. She intends to buy merchandise (corn flour, beans, rice, soap and others) to increase her inventory. The previous loans were for 10,000, 10,500 and 15,000 meticais and were used for the same goal. She is confident she will pay the loan ahead of schedule. In the future, she would like to improve her shop and eventually open a shop in the central market where she could improve her sales even more.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory (corn flour, beans, rice, soap and others)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary J.  (pictured at right in the yellow gown) currently washes and irons clothes in a laundry shop.  She is requesting a loan to stock more washing powder and soap.  Mary is 39 years old and is married.  Her husband is a farm laborer. The couple has 3 children, who all attend school.  With the extra profits resulting from her loan, Mary hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more washing powder and soap

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cooking supplies.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan P. is in the business of selling food in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more food to sell.  Susan is 40 years-old and a widow.   She has five children and three of her children attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007,  BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To buy food to resell.

loans.name: Gakuwebwa - Mono Womens Group-Lugazi

texts.en: Farming is a reliable but often neglected means of extricating improvised people out of poverty. It can be used in many ways to get oneself out of narrow circumstances. This reality in today’s Uganda, where everybody is looking for a white collar job, has not sunk in fully. It goes without saying that Farming, has from time in memorial, been the backbone of most business in Uganda. Many families subsisted on it to start other businesses, educate their children and to make ends meet. One individual who did not gloss over this reality is one high spirited 38 year married mother of 4, who goes by the name of A. Harriet. With enough savings from her farming business, she began a retail shop 10 years ago in Buikwe-Lugazi.  For a person who describes herself as a hard worker, it is no surprise that her business has made progress through the course of the last 10 years. In a month, she has been making profits that have consistently totaled up to 600,000 shillings. Like any other business person who aims at making more profits, she is taking a long view with plans of transforming into a wholesale business. She is optimistic that with this loan coming her way and with an additional source of income coming through her rental business, she will be able to make ends meet. With it, she is planning on purchasing more retail stock like sugar, basins, cups, rice, beans, soap, etc that she will be able to resell to earn more profits.

loans.use: Purchasing more retail items like sugar, basins, cups, rice, etc that she will resell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth P. is in the business of selling maize flour in a store and is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice and beans to sell.  Ruth is 36 years-old and married with a husband that is a driver. She has four children and one child does not yet go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family to save them the rent they must pay.

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007,  BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
El socio Eloy, tiene 44 años, es conviviente, tiene tres hijos y vive en la comunidad de Rumichaca de la Ciudad de Urubamba.  Eloy es carpintero y se dedica a fabricar muebles de madera como por ejemplo sillas, camas, roperos, puertas y ventanas, el tiene un pequeño taller de carpintería en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y que participa en el banco comunal, el requiere el préstamo para comprar madera y materiales como por ejemplo cola de carpintero, laca, clavos, etc.   
     
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The associate, Eloy, is 44 years old. He lives in a shared home. He has three children and lives in the Rumichaca community of the City of Urubamba. Eloy is a carpenter and he is dedicated to making wood furniture such as chairs, beds, wardrobes, doors and windows. He has a small carpentry workshop in his residence. He has already been dedicated to the business for many years and he participates in the communal bank. He requires the loan to buy wood and material, such as wood glue, shellac, nails, etc. The associate is thankful for the opportunity offered by means of the loan and promises to comply with the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood, wood glue, shellac, nails and other materials for his carpentry shop

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina se dedica a la venta de comida; es viuda y la única que solventa los gastos de alimentación, ropa y estudios de su hija. 
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Achumani de la urbanización concepción de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito será destinado para la compra insumos (papa, arroz, fideo, aceite). Para continuar con su negocio de venta de comida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial la califica como cliente buena en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Sabina is dedicated to the sale of food. She is a widow and the only one who covers the expenses of diet, clothes and studies for her daughter. Her residence is located in the Achumani zone of the housing complex of the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to purchase supplies (potatoes, rice, noodles, oil) to continue with her food sale business. This is the second time that she has requested a loan from Impro. Her record qualifies her as a good client in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes, rice, noodles and oil for her food sale business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more used clothes.

loans.name: Alejandra Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Patricia tiene 35 años está casada con el señor Julián juntos tienen 6 hijos de (12, 10, 8, 6,3) años y la ultima niña tiene 6 meses, son una familia de muy escasos recursos económicos, en la visita realizada para la evaluación del crédito se pudo ver realmente en la pobreza que vive esta familia.

Viven en la comunidad de Koluyo (en el cerro) su pequeña casa está construido de piedras y paja solo tiene dos habitaciones donde una la usan los padres y la otra los 6 hijos, la alimentación que tienen solamente es de cereales (trigo y maíz) y algunas verduras como ser papa haba y arveja (guisantes) no consumen ningún tipo de carne y una vez al año frutas, pero a pesar de la situación están unidos y son muy felices.

La principal actividad de esta familia es la agricultura, produciendo papa, trigo, cebada, haba, y arveja (guisantes).El préstamo será destinado para la compra de semillas y abonos para el sembradío de la segunda  temporada del año.Entre sus sueños y metas esta realizar una nueva construcción con mejores condiciones como ser (cocina, baño y otros).
texts.en:
Señora Patricia is 35 years old. She is married to Señor Julián. Together they have 6 children, ages 12, 10, 8, 6, and 3 years and the youngest girl is only 6 months. They are a family of very scarce economic resources. In the visit carried out for the evaluation of the loan, the poverty in which this family lives could be clearly seen. They live in the community of Koluyo (on the hill). Their small house is built of stones and straw. It only has two rooms; one used by the parents and the other used by the 6 children. Their diet consists only of cereals (wheat and corn) and some vegetables such as potatoes, beans and vetch (peas). They do not consume any type of meat and fruits only once a year. But despite their situation, they are together and they are very happy. The main activity of this family is agriculture, producing potatoes, wheat, barley, beans, and vetch (peas). The loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizer for the second sowing season of the year. Among their dreams and goals this to build a new home with better conditions, such as a kitchen, bath and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ebertia

texts.es:
La socia Ebertia, tiene 32 años, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo y vive en la comunidad de Rumichaca de la Ciudad de Urubamba.  Ebertia se dedica a la fabricación de artesanía. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y que participa en el banco comunal, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para su artesanía.   
     
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The associate, Ebertia, is 32 years old. She is a single mother. She has a son and lives in the Rumichaca community of the City of Urubamba. Ebertia is dedicated to the production of crafts. She has been dedicated to this business for several years already and she participates in the communal bank. She requires the loan to buy materials for her crafts. The associate is thankful for the opportunity offered by means of the loan and promises to comply with the payments according to the timetable.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials for making her crafts.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel es carpintero y elabora muebles de todo tipo como también arreglos en general, trabaja en una carpintería como empleado asalariado.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Villa El carmen de la ciudad de la Paz.
El crédito será destinado para la compra Herramientas (taladro, martillos, desarmadores, etc.) para realizar arreglos y trabajos independientes y mejorar sus ingresos.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, con el primer crédito pudo comprarse una herramienta manual.
texts.en:
Gabriel is a carpenter and he makes furniture of all types and also does general carpentry. He works in a carpenter shop as a wage-earning employee. His residence is located in the Villa el Carmen zone of the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to purchase tools (a drill, hammers, screwdrivers, etc.) to carry out carpentry work and independent work and to improve his income. This is the second time that he has requested a loan from Impro. With the first loan he bought a hand tool.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools such as a drill, hammers, and screwdrivers for use in his carpentry work.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El socio Ricardo, tiene 36 años, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos y vive en la comunidad de Rumichaca de la Ciudad de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Ricardo es carpintero y se dedica a fabricar muebles de madera como por ejemplo sillas, camas, roperos, puertas y ventanas, el tiene un pequeño taller de carpintería en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien, el requiere el préstamo para comprar madera y materiales cómo por ejemplo cola de carpintero, laca, clavos, etc.

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.   

La ciudad de Rumichaca se encuentra ubicada a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad del Cusco, como quien va hacia las ruinas Incas de Ollantaytambo.
texts.en:
The member Ricardo, age 36, is in a common law relationship, has two children, and lives in the community of Rumichaca in the city of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. Ricardo is a carpenter and is engaged in making wooden furniture such as chairs, beds, wardrobes, doors and windows. He has a small carpentry shop in his house.

For the several years he has been involved in his business and participated in the communal bank things have gone very well. He needs the loan in order to purchase wood and materials such as glue, shellac, nails, etc.

The member is grateful for the opportunity offered by means of the loan and also promises to make all his payments according to the schedule. The community of Rumichaca is located one hour and ten minutes from Cusco on the way to the Inca ruins of Ollantaytambo.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In order to purchase wood and materials such as glue, shellac, nails, etc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y perfumes, tiene dos hijos y esta separada de su esposo.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de bajo irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz. Vive en alquiler
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de cosméticos, perfumes, y otros).
Es cliente antigua desde junio de 2007, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, además que su fuente de trabajo le permite mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa sells cosmetics and perfumes. She is separated from her husband, has two children, and lives in a rented home located in the Irpavi neighborhood of La Paz. She will use the money from this loan to provide working capital (which she will use to buy cosmetics, perfumes, and other things). She has been a client since 2007 and her history qualifies her as a prime candidate, meaning that she has had a good repayment history. Her source of income also allows her to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary L. is currently in the business of selling various items in an open place such as groundnut paste, eggs, ice cream, etc. and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and onions to sell.  Mary is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.es:
Etelvina es secretaria y trabaja en una escuelita en irpavi II y también vende cosméticos y perfumes; tiene una hija que esta en nivel básico.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz. Vive en alquiler.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de cosméticos, perfumes, y otros).
Es cliente antigua desde junio de 2008, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, además que su fuente de trabajo le permite mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Etelvina is a secretary and works in a small school in Irpavi II and she also sells cosmetics and perfumes. She has a daughter in primary school. Their home is located in the Irpavi zone of the city of La Paz and it is rented.

The loan will be used to buy cosmetics, perfumes, etc. She has been a client of the bank sine June of 2008 and her history classifies her as a Level 1 Client, meaning she is responsible with her loan payments and has a source of income that allows her to improve her life's conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and perfumes in bulk

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Al visitar al banco comunal “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca” entrevistamos a la  señora Evangelina. 

Evangelina tiene 48 años, es conviviente, tiene tres hijos y vive en la comunidad de Rumichaca de la Ciudad de Urubamba.  Su principal actividad económica de Evangelina es la compra y venta de maíz y su actividad económica complementaria es la venta de comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc. Ya son varios años que se dedica a los negocios y que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar maíz y comestibles.  
     
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
We visited the "Nueva Visión (New Vision) of Rumichaca" community bank and interviewed Mrs. Evangelina.

Evangelina is 48 years old, lives with her common-law husband, has three children, and lives in the Rumichaca community in the city of Urubamba. Evangelina's main economic activity is buying and selling corn, and she also works selling food such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc. She has worked in these businesses and has been a part of the community bank for many years. It is going very well for her, and she needs the loan to buy corn and food.

The group member is thankful for the opportunity provided to her by these means and is committed to repaying the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and food

loans.name: United We Stand Group

texts.en:
Rebecca F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'United We Stand'. She is 31 years old, married and has two children,  9 and 12 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. For 10 years, she has been selling cologne, shampoo, hair grease and mosquito spray in Pipeline Market, Paynesville, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 16,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 44,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more cologne, shampoo, hair grease and mosquito spray. She describes herself as a determined woman. Her dream is to grow her business, build a house, and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more cologne, shampoo, hair grease and mosquito spray

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia B. tiene 43 años está casada con el señor Orlando juntos tienen 3 hijos de (12, 8 y 4) años 2 mayores están en la escuela. Doña Alicia y su esposo  han  sufrido mucho ya que tuvieron  que viajar a España a trabajar por necesidad, para lo cual dejaron  a sus hijos y a su hermana al menor con  tan solo con 18 meses, siempre al pendiente de sus hijos trabajaban y les llamaba por teléfono todos los días después de trabajar, hace un año que volvieron y lograron reunir lo suficiente para comprar una casa donde ahora están muy cómodos sus tres hijos y un vehículo  con  el cual su esposo trabaja de taxista.

Actualmente doña Alicia vive en la ciudad de CBBA  en la comunidad de SIRPITA – CUATRO ESQUINAS, su principal actividad es la producción espinacas y también vende patos (pelados) a diferentes restaurant de la ciudad.
El préstamo será destinado para la compra de semillas y abono para la siembra de espinacas así como también incrementar patos ya que tiene muchos pedidos.

Entre sus sueños y metas es tener un restaurant propio, ya que no quieren volver a salir del país lejos de sus hijos  y que los tres hijos estudien una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Alicia B. is 43 years old and married to her husband, Orlando. Together they have three children (ages 12, 8 and 4), and the eldest two are in school. Alicia and her husband have suffered a lot since out of necessity they had to travel to Spain for work, leaving behind their two sons and their young daughter, then just 18 months old. They always thought of their children as they worked and called them on the telephone every day after they were done with work. After a year they returned and were able to earn enough to buy a house, where they now live in comfort with their children, and also purchase a vehicle, which Alicia's husband uses as a taxi. Alicia currently lives in the city of Cochabamba, Bolivia, in the community of Sirpita - Cuatro Esquinas, and makes a living producing spinach and selling plucked ducks to different restaurants in the city. She plans to use to the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant the spinach as well as to add more ducks since she has many orders. One of her dreams and goals is to have her own restaurant because she doesn't want to have to leave her children to work overseas again, and she also wants to see her three children earn professional degrees.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spinach seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
Valeriana es comerciante vendedora de ají; su esposo es chofer. 
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de ají al por mayor para su venta al por menor.
Es cliente antigua desde julio de 2006, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito ya que se gano la confianza financiera.
texts.en:
Valeriana works as a merchant selling chili peppers, and her husband is a taxi driver. She lives in the Irpavi II area of the city of La Paz. She plans to use the loan to purchase chili peppers at wholesale to sell at retail. She has been a client since July 2006, and her history classifies her as a top-tier client who has fulfilled her previous payments, which grants her access to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chili peppers at wholesale

loans.name: Alipio

texts.es:
El socio Alipio, tiene 52 años, es conviviente, tiene cinco hijos y vive en la comunidad de Rumichaca de la Ciudad de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Su actividad económica de Alipio es la compra y venta de ganado y también se dedica a la agricultura. Ya son 8 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien, el requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes.

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.   

La ciudad de Rumichaca se encuentra ubicada a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad del Cusco, como quien va hacia las ruinas de Ollantaytambo.
texts.en:
Alipio is 52 years old and lives with his common-law wife and his five children in the community of Rumichaca in the city of Urubamba, department of Cusco. He makes a living buying and selling livestock and also works in agriculture. He has been doing this work for the past eight years and it has gone very well. He is requesting the loan to purchase small animals such as guinea pigs. Alipio is grateful for the opportunity from these means and promises to fulfill the payment obligations. Rumichaca is an hour and 10 minutes from the city of Cusco, and goes through the ruins of Ollantaytambo.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase small animals such as guinea pigs

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina se dedica a la venta de de ropa de niños y damas, su esposo es chofer y tiene un vehiculo que trabaja como radio taxi.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de bajo irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de poleras, pantalones, camisas, blusas y otros para su negocio de venta de ropa).
Es cliente antigua desde junio de 2008, su historial la califica como cliente buena en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Marina sells clothing for women and children. Her husband is a cab driver and he owns a vehicle that serves as his radio taxi. Their home is located in the Bajo Irpavi area of La Paz. This loan will be used for working capital (to buy t-shirts, pants, shirts, blouses, and other clothing items to sell). Marina has been a client of IMPRO since June 2008. Her history shows that she is a good client when it comes to making her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, pants, shirts, and blouses for women and children (to sell later)

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Al visitar al banco comunal “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca” entrevistamos a la  señora Dora. 

Dora tiene 55 años, es viuda y vive en la comunidad de Rumichaca de la Ciudad de Urubamba.  Su principal actividad económica de Dora es la venta de verduras y tubérculos. Ya son veinte años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Dora participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual al momento de pagar sus cuotas, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas, abono, etc.  
     
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
We interviewed Señora Dora during our visit to the community bank "Nueva Vision (new vision) de Rumichaca." Dora is 55 years old and is a widow. She lives in the community of Rumichaca in the city of Urubanba. Her principal economic activity is the sale of vegetables and root corps. She has already worked at this business for twenty years and it is going very well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts inot her work. Dora participates in her community bank, and it is going very well for her because she is a responsible person and is punctual in paying her bills. She needs the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, etc. This community bank member is thankful for the opportunity offered through this means and also promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Veronica Yanet

texts.es:
Al visitar al banco comunal “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca” entrevistamos a la  señora Veronica. 

Verónica tiene 34 años, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos y vive en la comunidad de Rumichaca de la Ciudad de Urubamba.  Su principal actividad económica de Verónica es la administración de  su tienda de abarrotes que se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Su esposa de la socia se llama Ricardo y se dedica a la carpintería y de esa forma ayuda al ingreso económico de la familia. Ya son veinte años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Verónica participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual al momento de pagar sus cuotas, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar y fideos para abastecer su tienda. 
     
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
We interviewed Señora Veronica during our visit to the community bank "Nueva Visión (New Vision) de Rumichaca.” Veronica is 34 years old. She lives with her common law husband and has two children. They live in the community of Rumichaca in the city of Urubanba. Her main business activity is running her grocery store, which is located in her home. Her husband's name is Ricardo, and he works as a carpenter and in this way helps with the economic income of the family. Veronica has worked at this business for twenty years, and it is going very well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. Veronica participates in her community bank, and that is also going very well for her because she is a responsible person and is punctual in making her payments. She needs the loan to buy rice, sugar, and noodles to stock her store. This community bank member is thankful for the opportunity offered through this means and also promises to make her payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, and noodles to stock her store

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es empleada domestica, trabaja de lunes a domingo por la mañanas, y por las tardes tiene un puesto donde vende juguetes. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de bajo irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de juguetes para su venta posterior).
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente buena en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Carmen is a domestic worker. She works from Monday to Sunday in the mornings. In the afternoons, she has a stand where she sells toys. Her home is located in the Bajo Irpavi zone of La Paz. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy toys wholesale, which she will later resell. This is the second time that she has requested a loan through IMPRO. Her record shows that she is a good client when it comes to making her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy toys wholesale, which she will resell

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana trabaja en una empresa donde distribuye medicamentos, es soltera e independiente.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Villa san Antonio Bajo de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para el tratamiento medico de su madre ya que el año pasado sufrió una parálisis y requiere pagar los gastos de Fisioterapia.
Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente buena en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Mariana works for a company that distributes medicines. She is single and independent. Her home is located in the lower Villa San Antonio area of La Paz. She is requesting this loan to pay for medical treatments for her mother, who suffered a paralysis last year and now needs to pay for physical therapy. This is the fifth time that Mariana has requested a loan through IMPRO and her record shows that she is a good client when it comes to making her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for physical therapy for her mother, who suffered a paralysis

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Al visitar al banco comunal “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca” entrevistamos al señor Marco.   

El socio Marco, tiene 47 años, es casado, tiene tres hijos y vive en la comunidad de Rumichaca de la Ciudad de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Su actividad económica de Marco es la fabricación de muebles de madera como por ejemplo sillas,  mesas, roperos y mucho más. Su esposa Fidelia se dedica a la compra y venta de granos secos. Ya son veinte años que Marco se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien, el requiere el préstamo para comprar una maquinaria.

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.   

La ciudad de Rumichaca se encuentra ubicada a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad del Cusco, como quien va hacia las ruinas Incas de Ollantaytambo.
texts.en:
When the staff of Asociación Arariwa visited the "Nueva Visión de Rumichaca" ("New Vision of Rumichaca") Communal Bank, they interviewed Mr. Marco. Marco is 47 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in the community of Rumichaca, in the city of Urubamba, Department of Cusco. He earns a living making wooden furniture such as chairs, tables, wardrobes, and much more. His wife, Fidelia, buys and sells dry grains. Marco has been working in his business for 20 years and does very well. He needs this loan to buy a piece of machinery. Marco is very grateful for the opportunity offered to him through this loan. He also promises to comply with his repayment schedule. The city of Rumichaca is located one hour and 20 minutes from the city of Cusco, on the way to the Inca ruins of Ollantaytambo.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a piece of machinery

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es:
Fidelia tiene 43 años, es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en la comunidad de Rumichaca de la ciudad de Urubamba.  Su principal actividad económica de Fidelia es la compra y venta verduras. Ella compra verduras por temporadas y por otras épocas ella misma siembra y cosecha sus productos para vender. Su esposo Marco es carpintero y de esta forma aporta al gasto familiar.

Fidelia participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual al momento de pagar sus cuotas, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar abono y semillas. 
      
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Fidelia is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in the community of Rumichaca, in the city of Urubamba. Her primary economic activity is buying and selling vegetables. She buys vegetables in certain seasons, and in other times she plants and harvests the products she will sell. Her husband, Marco, is a carpenter. This is how they support their family. Fidelia participates in a communal bank and it is going very well for her because she is a responsible person and is punctual with her repayments. She needs this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. This group member is grateful for the opportunity offered to her through this loan. She also promises to comply with her repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
Shirley trabaja en una empresa donde hacen mantenimiento de equipos médicos, cuenta con seguro de salud, pero el tratamiento que realizara será para la operación de vesícula de su madre. Por lo cual el dinero que solicita será destinado para dicha operación.

Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona norte de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro; el carácter social y el flujo de caja de sus ingresos y egresos le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.
texts.en:
Shirley works in a company that does maintenance on medical equipment. She has health insurance, but her mother needs an operation on her gallbladder. The loan Shirley is requesting will be used to pay for this operation. Shirley's home is located in the northern zone of the city of La Paz. This is the first time that she is requesting a loan through IMPRO. Her character, as well as her steady flow of income, qualify her for the opportunity to take out this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay the cost of gallbladder surgery for her mother

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy soup plates, sets of glasses and cups, large knives, ceramic plates, pitchers with tops, and glass plates

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene tiene un puesto de venta donde vende dulces, galletas, chocolates y refrescos , y por las tardes vende chicharrón seco.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de bajo Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (Compra de dulces, galletas, refrescos, y otras golosinas, para su puesto de venta).
Es cliente antigua en Impro, desde julio del 2006, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Irene has a vending stall where she sells sweets, cookies, chocolates, and soft drinks. In the afternoons, she sells dried pork rinds. Her home is located in the lower area of Irpavi in the city of La Paz.

This loan will be used as operating capital to buy candy, cookies, soft drinks, and other types of sweets to sell. Irene has been a long-time client of IMPRO since July 2006. Her credit history qualifies her as a Level 1 client, which means she has an excellent payment history and is eligible to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy, cookies, soft drinks, and other types of sweets

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, tiene 44 años, es conviviente, tiene cinco hijos y vive en la comunidad de Rumichaca de la ciudad de Urubamba.  Su principal actividad económica de Carmen es la elaboración y venta de jora o maíz fermentado y con esta malta se produce la chicha de jora. Para la elaboración de la chicha la primera etapa es producir la malta; esta acción es conocida como malteo. El malteo también tiene una serie de fases. Remojo: se realiza en pozos de piedra rectangulares de 10 centímetros de altura y dura aproximadamente 12 a 14 horas. En la misma poza de remojo se elimina el agua y se coloca ichu, y sobre el ichu se riega periódicamente. Esta operación dura entre 8 a 15 días. Secado: basta la exposición al sol y se obtiene el maíz germinado o Jora. Carmen vende Jora a sus clientes quienes elaboran la chicha de maíz.   
   
Carmen participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual al momento de pagar sus cuotas, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más maíz. 
     
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Carmen is 44 years old, in a common law marriage, and has five children. She lives in the community of Rumichaca in the city of Urubamba. Her main business activity is processing and selling dried fermented corn that is used as a malt for preparing “chicha de jora” (a traditional Incan beverage).

In order to make chicha, the first step is producing the malt (otherwise known as “malting”). The malt is produced in a series of phases. First, the corn is soaked in a rectangular stone well ten inches deep for 12-14 hours. The soaking water is periodically replaced to remove any grass or other debris. The entire process can last between 8 to 15 days. The corn is then provided enough exposure to the sun until it germinates. Carmen sells the processed corn to her customers who use it for making chicha.

Carmen participates in her Communal Bank and has done very well because she is a responsible person who is prompt with her payments. She needs a loan to buy more corn.

Carmen is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn for processing

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Al visitar al banco comunal “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca” entrevistamos al socio Paulino. Las reunionés del banco comunal se hacen cada treinta días en la comunidad de Rumichaca en su casa de Paulino. La ciudad de Rumichaca se encuentra ubicada a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad del Cusco, como quien va hacia las ruinas Incas de Ollantaytambo.
    
El socio Paulino, tiene 46 años, es divorciado, tiene cinco hijos y vive en la comunidad de Rumichaca de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Su actividad económica de Paulino es la fabricación de muebles de madera como por ejemplo sillas, puertas, ventanas y muchas cosas más, el requiere el préstamo para mejorar su carpintería. 
  
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
During a visit with the Communal Bank “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca” (New Vision of Rumichaca), staff members from Asociación Arariwa had the chance to interview Paulino, one of its members. The Communal Bank meetings are held every thirty days in the community of Rumichaca and the members gather at Paulino’s house. The city of Rumichaca is located an hour and ten minutes away from the city of Cusco, which is where one can find the Incan ruins of Ollantaytambo.

Paulino is 46 years old, divorced, and has five children. He lives in the community of Rumichaca in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco. Paulino manufactures furniture pieces made of wood such as chairs, doors, window frames, and many other items. He needs a loan to make improvements to his carpentry shop.

Paulino is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided. Therefore, he promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements to his carpentry shop

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
Saturnina es comerciante, se dedica a la recolección de cartón y también botellas de plástico, por toda la zona sur, para luego vender dichos articulos en las empresas de reciclaje de plástico y cartón..
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Caliri de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para compra de cartón y botellas de plástico y luego vender dichos artículos a las empresas de reciclaje.
Es cliente antigua en Impro, desde junio del 2007, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Saturnina is a trader who collects cardboard and plastic bottles from all over the southern area and sells them to recycling companies that process these materials. Her home is located in the district of Caliri in the city of La Paz.

This loan will be used to buy cardboard and plastic bottles that she can sell to recycling companies. Saturnina has been a long-time client of IMPRO since June 2007. Her credit history qualifies her as a Level 1 client, which means she has an excellent payment history and is eligible to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cardboard & plastic bottles to sell to recycling companies

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man with four children.  He operates a ('bodaboda') motorbike transport business to earn a living.  As a business-man, he joined Faulu Kenya under a group called Githunguri Kio so as to save his money.  Being a member of the group, he can easily access loans from Faulu Kenya because the members guarantee each other's loan.  He previously serviced a loan from Faulu Kenya which he used to start his business.  

He wants to start a business selling timber. Therefore, he has requested 50,000 KES to buy a power saw. George hopes to educate his children to university level.

loans.use: To purchase a power saw

loans.name: Juan Cancio

texts.es:
Al visitar al banco comunal “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca” entrevistamos al señor Juan Cancio. Las reunionés del banco comunal se hacen cada treinta días en la comunidad de Rumichaca en la casa del socio Paulino. La ciudad de Rumichaca se encuentra ubicada a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad del Cusco, como quien va hacia las ruinas Incas de Ollantaytambo.
    
El socio Juan Cancio, tiene 42 años, es divorciado, tiene tres hijos y vive en la comunidad de Rumichaca de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Su actividad económica de Juan Cancio es la fabricación de muebles de metal como por ejemplo sillas, puertas, ventanas y muchas cosas más. Ya son varios años que Juan Cancio se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien, el requiere el préstamo para comprar una maquinaria.

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
During a visit with the Communal Bank “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca” (New Vision of Rumichaca), staff members from Asociación Arariwa had the chance to interview Sr. Juan Cancio, one of its members. The Communal Bank meetings are held every thirty days in the community of Rumichaca at the house of Paulino, one of the other members. The city of Rumichaca is located an hour and ten minutes away from the city of Cusco, which is where one can find the Incan ruins of Ollantaytambo.

Juan Cancio is 42 years old, divorced, and has three children. He lives in the community of Rumichaca in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco. Juan Cancio manufactures furniture pieces made of metal such as chairs, doors, window frames, and many other items. He has worked several years in this business and has done very well. Juan Cancio needs a loan to buy machinery.

Juan Cancio is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided. Therefore, he promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase machinery

loans.name: Amando

texts.es:
El señor Amando V. ya ha tenido cuatro créditos con FVP los cuales a pagado puntual mente.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para apoyar a su esposa con el negocio que tiene de venta de zapatos y ropa por catalogo, ya que tiene varios pedidos y no tiene el dinero necesario para la inversión.
Planean pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio, ya los gastos familiares se encarga el señor amando V. con el sueldo de su trabajo.   
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Maria Del Rosario Hernández esposa del Don Amando, ya que se encontraba en su trabajo y quien atiende el negocio es la doña Maria Del Rosario.
texts.en:
Sr. Amando V. has had four previous loans with FVP which were repaid on time. He is requesting another loan to help his wife with her business of selling shoes and clothing through catalogs. She has already received several orders, but she does not have the necessary funds to make this investment. They plan to repay the loan using the earnings from this business. Sr. Amando is in charge of covering the family expenses with the salary he earns from his job.

The person who appears in the photo is Sra. Maria del Rosario Hernández, the wife of Don Amando, since he was already at work. Doña Maria del Rosario is in charge of attending to the business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in his wife's business

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.es:
Cipriano, de 33 años, es un padre de familia muy tranquilo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Norma de 28 años y sus 5 menores hijos, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Cuando los primeros rayos de sol llegan al poblado de Casca (Pueblo de la provincia de Tarma), Cipriano en compañía de su querida esposa, salen a trabajar en sus campos agrícolas, las cuales quedan a una hora de camino. Sus tierras son muy fértiles, por ello cultivo papa, ya que la producción de este tubérculo es de muy buena calidad. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad
Y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, sin embargo requiere de mucho esfuerzo para cuidar sus plantaciones y lo hace con mucho esmero, de esa manera evita que las plagas perjudiquen en la producción. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar la siembra. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP y no quiere dejar de pagar sus cuotas, así que ya esta ahorrando para cumplirlo. En su grupo comunal es un compañero muy responsable y respetuoso con las demás. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Cipriano is a 33 year old father who is extremely calm and a hard worker. He lives in his own home with his wife Norma, age 28, and their five young children who are the main reason behind all of his efforts. When the first rays of sunlight reach the village of Casca (which is in Tarma Province), Cipriano and his beloved wife leave to begin the work in their fields, which requires an hour-long trip by foot. Their land is quite fertile for growing potatoes of superb quality. They have been doing this for 20 years.

Cipriano says that harvesting is the part of his job that he enjoys most. However, it requires a great deal of effort to maintain his crops, which he does with great care. This also keeps pests from ruining production. Later on he hopes to buy additional land so that he can plant more crops.

This is his third loan with MFP. Cipriano does not want to be late with his payments, so he sets aside enough money to meet his obligations. In his Communal Bank, he has demonstrated that he is responsible and respectful of the other members. The loan of 1200 PEN that he requested will be used to buy compost and fertilizers for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & fertilizers

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara es comerciante, y vende productos de belleza, de la marca  Avon, como ser: cosméticos Perfumes, y otros productos de belleza.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de bajo Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (Compra de cosméticos, perfumes y todo producto de belleza)
Es cliente antigua en Impro, desde junio del 2008, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Sara is a merchant who sells beauty products from the Avon line such as cosmetics, perfumes, and other items. Her home is located in the lower area of Irpavi in the city of La Paz.

This loan will be used as operating capital to buy cosmetics, perfumes, and other types of beauty products. Sara has been a long-time client of Impro since June 2008. Her credit history qualifies her as a Level 1 client, which means she has an excellent payment record and is eligible to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics, perfumes, and other types of beauty products

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es: Adelina, de 28 años, es una madre de familia muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Eber de 34 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo que realiza, es el cultivo de Café, plátano y cacao, todas las mañanas junto a su esposo, sale a trabajar en sus campos ya sembrados, sabe que el cuidado que le brindan dependerá de la calidad de los productos que cosechará y venderá al mercado de Pichanaki. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar y darles el cuidado necesario, es así que lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que transportar sus productos, puesto que son muy pesados. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar su producción. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a sus compañeros de su grupo comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Los setecientos nuevos soles que solicita, los invertirá para contratar operarios para que limpien sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Adelina is a 28 year old mother who is modest and cheerful. She lives in her own house with her husband Eber, age 34, and their four beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Adelina’s work involves growing coffee, bananas, and cacao. Every morning she and her husband leave their home to go work in the fields they have planted. She knows that the care she provides her crops will determine the quality of her products, which are sold at the Pichanaki Market after being harvested. What she enjoys most about her work is planting her crops and providing them the necessary care. She has been farming for seven years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products since the shipments can be very heavy. Over time she hopes to buy additional land so that she can increase her production.

This is her second loan with MFP. Adelina sets aside money so that she can submit her payments on time, since she does not want to cause problems for the other members of her Communal Bank. She is very happy to be part of the group. The loan of 700 PEN that she requested will be used to hire workers to clear her coffee fields.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hire workers to clear her coffee fields

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
El socio Mariano, tiene 38 años, es soltero y vive en la comunidad de Rumichaca de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Su actividad económica de Paulino es la fabricación de muebles de madera y de metal como por ejemplo sillas, puertas, ventanas y muchas cosas más.  El año 2000 empezó su negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio,  el requiere el préstamo para mejorar su carpintería metálica. 
  
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Mariano is 38 years old, single, and lives in the community of Rumichaca in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco. He manufactures furniture pieces made of wood and metal such as chairs, doors, window frames, and many other items. Mariano started his business in 2000 and has done very well as a result of his efforts. The loan he is requesting will be used to help improve his metal works.

Mariano is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided. Therefore, he promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in his business to improve his metal works

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina, tiene 36 años, es viuda, tiene tres hijos y vive en la comunidad de Rumichaca de la ciudad de Urubamba.  Su principal actividad económica de Sabina es la venta de comida y también se dedica a la venta de verduras como ejemplo zanahorias, cebollas, maíz, papas, etc. Sabina participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual al momento de pagar sus cuotas, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos como papas, verduras, arroz y azúcar.

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Sabina is a 36 year old widow with three children living in the Rumichaca area of the city of Urubamba. Her main source of income is from the sale of food: carrots, onions, corn, potatoes, etc. Sabina is a member of the community bank. She is responsible and punctual in paying her share. She needs a loan in order to buy more products such as potatoes, vegetables, rice and sugar. This member is grateful for the opportunity presented with this loan and agrees to comply with the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Sabahi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase more products such as potatoes, vegetables, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Alcida

texts.es:
Alcida, tiene 30 años, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos y vive en la comunidad de Rumichaca de la ciudad de Urubamba.  Alcida vio la necesidad de sus vecinos, ellos se dirigían a lugares lejanos a comprar comestibles pero Sabina abrió una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio donde vende comestibles a sus vecinos. Para Sabina esta fue una oportunidad de trabajo y así de esta forma sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles un mejor futuro. Su esposo Andrés es empleado en un condominio y con su sueldo aporta al gasto familiar. Alcida participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual al momento de pagar sus cuotas, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos como arroz, fideos, azúcar, etc. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alcida, 30 years old, has a partner and two children and lives in the Rumichaca community in Urubamba City. Alcida noticed that her neighbors would have to go long distances to buy their groceries. Sabina opened a small grocery store in her home where she sells groceries to her neighbors. For Sabina, this was an opportunity for work, and this way she can provide the best for her children and give them a better future. Her husband, Andres, is an employee in a condominium. He contributes to the household expenses with his income. Alcida participates in the communal bank, and it is going very well for her because she is a responsible person and is punctual about paying her bills. She needs a loan to be able to purchase more products such as rice, noodles, sugar, etc. Alcida is grateful for the opportunity that the loan provides her, and in addition, she commits to making the payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more groceries such as rice, noodles, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene un puesto de venta  en la zona de bajo irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz, donde vende azúcar, arroz, fideos, etc., al por menor.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de bajo Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de azúcar, arroz, fideos, refrescos y otros al por mayor)
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. El análisis socioeconómico la califican para poder optar a un préstamo.
texts.en:
Julia has a sales stall in the Irpavi area of the city of La Paz. There she sells sugar, rice, noodles, and more in small quantities. Her home is also located in the Irpavi area in La Paz. The loan will be used for working capital to purchase sugar, rice, noodles, soft drinks, and other wholesale items. This is her first loan from IMPRO (Kiva Field Partner). Her good credit history qualified her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, noodles, soft drinks, and other wholesale items

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin, D. 31 años, es un padre D. familia muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Carlota y sus 5 menores hijos, quienes son el motivo D. todos sus esfuerzos. Todas las mañanas Edwin se esmera mucho en trabajar sus tierras y dejarlas muy fértiles, ya que D. eso depenD. D. L. calidad D. su café y plátanos, para que puedan se comercializados en su totalidad, en L. ciudad D. Pichanaki, y obtener buenas rentas D. ello. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es que tiene mucha libertad para trabajar en sus tierras, ya que es él, su propio jefe, D. esa manera ha trabajado desD. hace 10 años, considera además que el limpiar sus cafetales le resulta muy complicado y requiere D. mucho esfuerzo. Con el tiempo, espera comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y se siente en L. capacidad D. pagar todas sus cuotas, es uno D. los miembros más activos en su grupo comunal, por eso es muy querido y respetado. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en:
Edwin, 31 years of age, is a simple and hard-working father. He lives in a house he owns, along with his wife Carlota, and 5 children who are the reason for all the effort he puts forth. Each morning, Edwin takes great care tending to his land in order to make it very fertile. He depends on the quality of his coffee and banana crops, so he can sell everything he grows. What he enjoys most about his work is that he has a great deal of freedom to work his farmland, since he is his own boss. He has been working this way for 10 years, and considers the cleaning of his coffee plantation the most complicated part, which requires a great deal of work. Over time, he hopes to purchase additional acreage to increase his production. This is his third loan with MFP, and he feels capable of paying all his installments.
