He is one of the most active members of his cooperative, a reason why he is very well-liked and respected. With the thousand soles he is requesting, he will buy fertilizers so that his land is more fertile.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es comerciante, tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio donde vende al por menor todos sus productos, como ser: arroz, fideo, azúcar, dulces, refrescos, y otros.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de bajo Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (Compra abarrotes, dulces, galletas, refrescos, y otros)
Es cliente antigua en Impro, desde diciembre del 2008, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Martha is a merchant, and has a grocery store in her home where she sells a variety of products at retail, such as: rice, noodles, sugar, candies, and refreshments, along with other items. Her home is located in the Irpavi zone of the city of La Paz. The loan would be designated as working capital (to purchase groceries, candies, cookies, beverages, and other items). She has worked with Impro for a while, since December of 2008, and her history qualifies her as a top client. That is to say, she has fulfilled her payment obligations, which allows her access to additional credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products at wholesale for her grocery store.

loans.name: Gloria Fabiana

texts.es:
Gloria, tiene 55 años, es viuda, tiene dos hijos y pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Vision D. Rumichaca”. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la comunidad D. Rumichaca en la casa del señor Paulino.  
Su actividad económica principal D. Gloria es la venta D. verduras como por ejemplo zanahorias, papas, cebollas, etc. Ella empezó su negocio hace 20 años atrás y su primer crédito fue D. 100 dólares. Gloria participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual al momento D. pagar sus cuotas, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más semillas y abono. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gloria is 55 years old, a widow, and belongs to the “New Vision of Rumichaca” cooperative bank. Members meet every 30 days in the Rumichaca community, at the home of Mr. Paulino. Gloria’s primary economic activity is selling vegetables such as carrots, potatoes, onions, etc. She started in this area of business 20 years ago, and her first loan was for 100 dollars. Gloria participates in the cooperative bank, and things go well for her because she is a responsible and punctual person with regard to her payments. She needs a loan in order to buy more seeds and fertilizer. This member is very grateful for the opportunities given to her via this medium, and also commits to making her installment payments as scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: German

texts.es: German, de 27 años, es un padre de familia muy alegre y amoroso, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Nora de 26 años y sus 3 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Los esfuerzos en cuidado y fertilización que German realiza en sus cultivos, se ven reflejados en la calidad de sus productos, ya que los plátanos, café y cacao que cultiva son muy cotizados en el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki, que es donde vende sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar y lo hace con mucha alegría, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que el transporte es muy escaso por la zona donde tiene sus campos de cultivo. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, en sus primeros pagos fue muy puntual, por lo que espera serlo ahora también, es de los pocos varones de su grupo comunal, que es muy querido por el resto de sus compañeros. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
German, 27 years of age, is a very cheerful and loving father. He lives in his own house with his wife Nora, who is 26, and their 3 young children. He wants to provide them all with a better quality of life. The efforts that German puts forth to care and fertilize his crops are reflected in the quality of his products. The bananas, coffee, and cacao that he produces are in big demand in the market of the city of Pichanaki, which is where he sells his products. The part he enjoys most about his work is the harvest, which he does with great happiness. He has been farming for 6 years, and finds the most difficult aspect of his work to be the transport of his goods from the remote zone where his farmlands are located. Over time, he hopes to buy more acreage in order to increase his production levels. This is his third loan with MFP. He was very punctual with his first payments, which is why he hopes to do so again this time. He is one of the few male members of his cooperative, and is well-liked and respected by his colleagues. He will use the two thousand soles requested to purchase more fertilizers for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier tiene un taller de Mecánica en la ciudad de El Alto de La Paz..
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de inversión (Compra herramientas para su taller).
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Javier has an auto repair shop in the city of El Alto of La Paz. His home is located in the Llojeta zone of the city of La Paz. The loan would be designated as investment capital (to purchase tools for his workshop). This is the second time he is requesting a loan through Impro, and his history qualifies him as a top client. That is to say, he fulfilled his past loan payments, which allowed him access to this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tools for his auto repair workshop.

loans.name: Yony

texts.es:
Yony, tiene 29 años, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Vision de Rumichaca”. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la comunidad de Rumichaca en la casa del señor Paulino.  
Su actividad económica principal de Yony es la venta de verduras como por ejemplo zanahorias, papas, cebollas, etc. Ella empezó su negocio hace 10 años atrás. Yony participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual al momento de pagar sus cuotas, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más verduras. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yony is 29 years old, a single mother with two children, and belongs to the “New Vision of Rumichaca” cooperative bank. Members meet every thirty days, at Mr. Paulino’s house in the Rumichaca community. Her primary economic activity is the sale of vegetables, for example, carrots, potatoes, onions, etc. She started her business 10 years ago. Yony participates in the cooperative bank, and things go well for her because she is a responsible and punctual person with regard to making her payments. She needs this loan in order to buy more vegetables. This member is very grateful for the opportunities granted her through this medium, and likewise commits to making her loan payments as scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
El señor Armando P. esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual construyo la barda alrededor de la casa.
Esta nueva mente solicitando un préstamo para poner el portón al frente de su casa ya que no esta segura para que sus hijos puedan jugar. 
Planea pagarlo con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como carnicero de una tienda comercial. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Karen Lizeth Carrizales, esposa del señor armando, ya que el día de la visita el se encontraba en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Armando P. is very grateful for his previous loan, which he used to build a wall around his house. He is again requesting a loan in order to put a gate at the front of his house, to give his children a safe place to play. He plans to make his payments using the income he earns working as a butcher at a commercial store. The person who appears in the photograph is Karen Lizeth Carrizales, Armando’s wife, as he was at work on the day we visited.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a gate.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es entrenador de fútbol de las divisiones menores de el club Bolivar, y su esposa trabaja en la administración pública..
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para Salud (tratamiento médico de su hijo).
Es cliente antiguo en Impro, desde mayo del 2007, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Francisco is a soccer coach for the minor leagues of the club Bolivar. His wife works in public administration. His home is located in the Miraflores section of the city of La Paz. The loan would be destined for health care costs (medical treatments for his son). He is an old client of Impro’s, since May of 2007, and his history qualifies him as a top client. That is to say, he has complied with his past loan payments, allowing him access to this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for medical treatments for his son.

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es:
El socio Sixto, tiene 25 años, es soltero y pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca”. Las reuniones del banco comunal se hacen en la casa del socio paulino en la comunidad de Rumichaca. Sixto es obrero y su trabajo es eventual. El socio es una persona carismática y responsables y puntual y por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal, el requiere el préstamo para gasto personal como para su alimentación, pasajes, etc.
  
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Sixto is 25 years old, single, and belongs to the “New Vision of Rumichaca” cooperative bank. Meetings are held at member Paulino’s home, located in the Rumichaca community. Sixto is a construction worker, and his jobs can be temporary. He is very charismatic, responsible, and punctual, which is why he was invited to join the cooperative bank. He needs a loan for personal expenses, such as food, transportation, etc. This member is very grateful for the opportunities provided via this medium, and likewise commits to payment his installments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For personal expenses such as food, transportation, etc.

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
Giovanna, tiene 25 años, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo y pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Vision de Rumichaca”. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la comunidad de Rumichaca en la casa del señor Paulino. Su actividad económica principal de Giovanna es la venta de verduras como por ejemplo zanahorias, papas, cebollas, etc. Ella también administra la tienda de abarrotes de su mama Fidelia. Giovanna participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual al momento de pagar sus cuotas, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más verduras. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Giovanna is 25 years old, and the single mother of one child. She belongs to the “New Vision of Rumichaca” cooperative bank. Member reunions take place every thirty days at the home of Mr. Paulino. Giovanna’s primary economic activity is the sale of vegetables such as carrots, potatoes, onions, etc. She also tends to her mother Fidelia’s grocery store. Giovanna participates in the cooperative bank, and things go well for her because she is a very responsible and punctual person with regard to making her payments. She needs the loan in order to purchase more vegetables. This member is very grateful for the opportunities provided via this medium, and likewise commits to making her scheduled payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora se dedica a la compra y venta de queso que lo distribuye en los mercados y por las casas de la zona sur, de la ciudad de la Paz.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (Compra de queso) para continuar con su negocio.
Es cliente antigua en Impro, desde junio del 2008, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Teodora buys and sells cheese, distributing it to the local markets and in the neighbourhood in the southern regions of La Paz. Her home is located in the Irpavi district in La Paz. The loan will be used as working capital (the purchase of cheese) to sustain her business. She is a long time client of Impro (Kiva Field Partner), since June 2008. She has been classified as "client 1" meaning that she has maintained her payments, which now grants her access to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cheese to distribute to markets and neighbourhoods in La Paz

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El socio Mario, tiene 33 años, es soltero y  pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca”. 
Mario trabaja como obrero de forma eventual.  Mario es una persona responsable y puntual y por esas cualidades  en cualquier obra que necesiten gente lo llaman para trabajar. El requiere le préstamo para gasto personal específicamente para su alimentación, pasajes y otras cosas más.  
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Mario is 33 years old and single. He belongs to the communal bank “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca”. Mario works as a laborer in temporary employment. Mario is a responsible and puntual person and because of these qualities he is called whenever there is a job that needs people. He requires the loan for a personal expense, specifically for food, transportation, and other things. This member is grateful for the opportunity offered in this way and he is also comitted to making the payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For food, transportation, and other things.

loans.name: Gladiz

texts.es: Gladiz, de 36 años, es una madre de familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Julián de 40 años y sus 5 menores hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Aunque Gladiz nunca pudo concluir sus estudios primarios, siempre trato de sobresalir y demostrar que podía llevar una vida normal, actualmente se dedica al cultivo de plátano y café, actividad que aprendió desde muy pequeña y que ahora le brinda los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que afectan su producción. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar la cantidad de sus cultivos. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y quiere pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a más préstamos, con lo cuales pueda mejorar su negocio, sabe que en su grupo comunal la apoyarán y guiarán, ya que es una compañera muy estimada. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en:
Gladiz is 36 years old and a mother and wife of a simple, hardworking family. She lives in her own home with her husband, Julián, who is 40, and their 5 minor children, who are the reason for all her efforts. Although Gladiz was never able to finish primary schools, she always has tried to get ahead and demonstrate that she could live a normal life. At present, she grows plantains and coffee. She learned this activity when she was very young and now it provides her with the necessary income to support her family. She has been doing this activity for 25 years and for her the hardest thing is protecting her crops from the pests that affect production. With time, she wants to buy more land to increase her crops. This is her third loan with MFP and she wants to make her payments on time, since she wants to have access to more loans with which she can improve her business. She knows that in her community group she will be supported and guided, since she is a very esteemed member. With the fifteen hundred nuevos soles that she is asking for, she will buy more fertilizer to make her land more fertile.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer

loans.name: Yesica

texts.es:
Yesica, tiene 26 años, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos y pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca”. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la comunidad de Rumichaca en la casa del señor Paulino.  
Su actividad económica principal de Giovanna es la venta de comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, fideos, leche en tarro, etc. Yesica es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora pues de esta forma va sacar adelante a sus hijos y les va dar una buena educación. Yesica participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual al momento de pagar sus cuotas, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más comestibles como azúcar, gaseosas,  pan, etc.   

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma
texts.en:
26-year old Yesica is married and has two children. She belongs to the Nueva Visión de Rumichaca Community Bank. The bank holds meetings every month in the community of Rumichaca at Sr. Paulino’s house. Yesica’s main source of income comes from selling foodstuffs such as rice, noodles, cans of milk etc. She is a hardworking and resourceful mother who is going to ensure that her children do well in life and provide them with a good education. Yesica participates in the bank’s activities and all is going well for her as she is responsible and makes her repayments on time. The loan is to buy more foodstuffs such as sugar, soft drinks, bread etc. Yesica is grateful for the opportunity to obtain a loan and promises to repay the money according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sugar, soft drinks, bread etc

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es:
Avelina es comerciante, se dedica a recoger botellas de plástico, y su comercialización en las empresas que reciclan esas botellas.
 Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Caliri de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de bolsas y botellas de plástico)
Es cliente antigua en Impro, desde junio del 2008, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Avelina is a merchant. She gathers plastic bottles, and she sells them to businesses that recycle these bottles. Her home is located in the Caliri area of the city of La Paz. The loan is for working capital (buy plastic bags and bottles). She is a long time client of Impro; she has been a client since June, 2008. Her record classifies her as Client 1. That means she has good payment history, which allows her to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plastic bags and bottles for her business of selling plastic bottles to recycling businesses

loans.name: Marmol

texts.es:
Marmol de 64 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil, (zona periurbana, con montañas y caminos de tierra). Empezó a vender productos cuando su esposa lo abandono dejándolo con todos sus hijos. 

Por la frustrante idea de estar solo manteniendo a sus hijos tuvo que ingeniar otro medio para poderles dar una buena educación a sus hijos, comenzó a vender productos de uso personal en las calles, poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido tener una economía estable, trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días.       

Para seguir trabajando con la venta de productos necesita comprar con el préstamo pasta de dientes, papel higiénico etc. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mármol is 64 years old. He lives in El Fortín, Guayaquil (a periurban area with mountains and dirt roads). Due to the frustrating fact that he is supporting his two children alone, he had to think of another way to be able to give his children a good education. He started to sell personal use products on the streets. With effort, and little by little, he has been able to have financial stability. He works from 6:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. everyday. In order to keep working by selling products he needs to use the loan to buy toothpaste and toilet paper, etc. In the future he wants to finish building his house and increase his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Toilet paper and toothpaste

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Catalina le esta haciendo falta la barda al rededor de la casa ya que tiene poco tiempo que adquirió su casa. 
Solicita el préstamo ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora, ya que vive solo y quiere la seguridad para ella. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene como contadora de una pequeña compañía.
texts.en:
Catalina’s house needs a wall around it. She got the house a little while ago. She is requesting a loan because she does not have the money to buy the material or pay for someone to make the improvement. She lives alone, and she wants security for herself. She plans to pay the loan with the income she gets as a bookkeeper for a small company.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall around her house

loans.name: Karolina

texts.es: Karolina, de 30 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a sus esposo Víctor de 33 años y sus 4 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindarle un mejor futuro. Sus días los pasa trabajando en sus cultivos, ella es muy dedicada y pone todo su esfuerzo en que sus cultivos tengan la mayor calidad posible, esta actitud ha hecho que sus plantaciones de plátano, café y cacao, sean muy solicitados en el mercado de Pichanaki, que es donde lleva a vender sus productos. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que le gusta cosechar, pero el tener que transportar sus productos le resulta muy pesados los sacos que tiene que cargar. En adelante espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y nunca ha tenido problemas con su grupo comunal, en donde es muy apreciada por ser muy alegre y mantiene a las compañeras muy unidas. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Karolina, age 30, is a very hard-working and loving mother. She lives in her own house with her 33 year old husband, Víctor, and their four minor children. She wishes to give the children a better life. She spends her days working with her crops. She is very dedicated, and she puts all of her effort into making her crops be of the best possible quality. This attitude has made her banana, coffee, and cacao crops very much in demand in the Pichanaki market. That is where she takes her products to sell them. She has been doing this activity for ten years. She likes to harvest, but having to transport her products is difficult because the bags she has to carry are very heavy. Later, she hopes to buy more land to increase her production. This is her third loan with MFP. She has been very punctual with her payments, and she has never had problems with her communal bank. She is highly regarded in her communal bank because she is very happy, and she is very united with her colleagues. She will use the 2,000 PEN she is requesting to buy fertilizer for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Ateasefotrust Bank Group

texts.en:
Saiba is currently the group leader of “Ateasefo” Trust Bank Group made up of 8 members. Saiba is clearly a loyal person. He is 33 years old and sells bales of used shoes to customers in his community. He is also a teacher. Saiba has been operating his trade for 1 year and he is eager to be taking out this loan. He plans to invest the loan to purchase bales of assorted used shoes for adults and children to meet his customers’ demands. Used shoes are most patronized since brand new ones are expensive for the majority of low income people. 

Saiba is single and the father of three children aged 3-9. He hopes to generate enough profit to be able to improve his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase used shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Strong Faith Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Issifu is currently the group leader of Strong Faith Trust Bank Group made up of 5 members. He describes himself as a faithful person. He is 30 years old and sells bales of used shoes to customers in his community. He is also a teacher. Issifu has been operating his trade for 1 year and he is eager to be taking out this loan. He plans to invest the loan to purchase bales of assorted used shoes and slippers. Used shoes are most patronized since brand new ones are expensive for the majority of low income people. 

Issifu is single and the father of three children aged 3-9. He hopes to generate enough profit to be able to improve his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase used shoes and slippers in bulk

loans.name: Elfego

texts.es:
El señor Elfego S. esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo invertir en su negocio de comida, el cual atiende su esposa.
Esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para invertir en el negocio de ropa que tiene ya que le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtendrá del negocio de ropa usada y nueva.
texts.en:
Elfego S. is grateful for your cooperation with the previous loan. With the loan he was able to invest in his food business, which his wife takes care of. He is requesting a loan again to invest in the clothing business that he has. It needs a greater variety of merchandise. He plans to pay the loan with the earnings he gets from his new and used clothing business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Damiana

texts.es:
Al visitar al  banco comunal “Virgen de Copacabana” entrevistarnos a la socia Damiana. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina de atención de la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. 
Damiana,  tiene 29 años, tiene dos hijos (Mariluz de trece años y estudia en el colegio y Fabricio de cuatro años y está en el jardín). Su actividad económica principal de Damiana es la venta de fruta en el mercado “Virgen Asunta” en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. Ya son 6 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en el trabajo. Ella nos cuenta como empieza su trabajo, ella se levanta a las 6 de la mañana y termina a las 7 de la noche. Hay temporadas en que ella compra fruta de las proveedoras que traen frutas de la ciudad de Quillabamba pero en otras ocasiones ella misma viaja a la ciudad de Quillabamba a traer mercadería. Ella requiere el préstamo para adquirir un carro y la idea de ellas es viajar en carro propio a la ciudad de Quillabamba y traer frutas y ya no comprar de las proveedoras.

El sueño de la socia es  comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo.
texts.en:
While visiting the Virgin of Copacabana Communal Bank, we interviewed Damiana, a member. The communal bank's meetings occur every 30 days in its offices in the city of Ollantaytambo. Damiana is 29 years old, has 2 children (Mariluz who is 13 and attends school, and Fabricio who is 4 and in kindergarten). Damiana's principal economic activity is selling fruit in the Virgen Asunta Market in the city of Ollantaytambo. She has done this for 6 years and it has gone very well, thanks to the effort she put into the work. Damiana told us about her workday: she rises at 6:00 am and finishes at 7:00 in the evening. There are times when she buys fruit from provisioners who bring fruit to the city of Quillabamba, but on other occasions, she herself travels to Quillabamba to bring back merchandise. Damiana needs the loan to acquire a car; her idea is to travel in her own car to Quillabamba and bring back fruit, and no longer buy from the provisioners. Her dream is to buy a house in the city of Ollantaytambo.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING A CAR TO HAUL FRUIT FROM ANOTHER CITY TO BE SOLD

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
A la vivienda del la señora francisca G. le esta haciendo falta el vitropiso en el cuarto de lavado.
Solicita un préstamo ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en una fábrica.
texts.en:
The floor in Mrs. Francisca G.’s laundry room needs to be tiled. She is asking for this loan because she does not have the money to buy materials or pay for the labor. She plans to repay the loan with part of the income she receives from her job as a factory worker.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a tile floor

loans.name: Yanina Miluska

texts.es:
Al visitar al  banco comunal “Virgen de Copacabana” entrevistamos a la socia Yanina. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina de atención de la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. 

Yanina, tiene 35 años, es casada, tiene dos hijos (Adriana de once años que estudia en el colegio y Angela de cuatro años que está en el jardín). Yanina nació  en la ciudad de Cusco y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo donde tiene un pequeño bar llamado “AYNI”. Ella tiene un bar y lo atiende una persona contratada, la atención del bar es todos los días de 4:30 de la tarde hasta de 2 a 3 de madrugada. Yanina también tiene un bazar donde vende ropa para niños, para caballeros, para damas y también vende juguetes, peluches, perfumes, aretes, collares, etc. 
Yanina es una persona carismática, alegre y responsable. Ya son varios años que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien gracias a la puntualidad de sus pagos, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo ropa para abastecer su bazar. 

Actualmente, Yanina vive en la casa de su mamá pero su anhelo es comprarse una casa y un carro último modelo.
texts.en:
During our visit to the communal bank "Virgen de Copacabana" we interviewed the partner Yanina. The communal bank meetings are every thirty days in the city business office of Ollantaytambo. Yanina is 35-years-old, married, and has two children (Adriana, 11, who's in school, and Angela, 4, who's in nursery school). Yanina was born in the city of Cusco, and currently she lives in the city of Ollantaytambo, where she has a small bar called "AYNI". She has one employee. The bar's hours are everyday from 4:30 p.m. to 2 or 3 in the morning. Yanina also has a bazaar where she sells clothes for children, men, and women; she also sells toys, stuffed animals, perfumes, earrings, necklaces, etc. Yanina is a charismatic, happy, and responsible person. She's participated in the communal bank for several years, and it's going well for her because she pays her loans back punctually. She requires this loan to buy merchandise such as clothing for her bazaar. Currently Yanina lives in a house with her mother, but she hopes to buy her own home and a new car.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as clothing for her bazaar

loans.name: Mariza

texts.es:
Al visitar al  banco comunal “Virgen de Copacabana” entrevistamos a la socia Mariza. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina de atención de la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. 

Mariza, tiene 36 años, es casada, tiene dos hijos (Luis Fernando de 14 años que estudia en el colegio y Ayde de 4 años que estudia en el jardín). Mariza nació en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo y actualmente vive en la misma ciudad. Su actividad económica principal de Mariza es la venta de refrescos en el mercado “Virgen Asunta” de Ollantaytambo  donde tiene un stand.  Ella sale a vender todos los días de 8 de la mañana a una de la tarde. Ya son 13 a 14 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Mariza es una persona carismática, alegre y responsable y ya son varios años que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien gracias a la puntualidad de sus pagos, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo azúcar, quinua,  maíz, manzana, zanahoria, etc. 

Actualmente, Mariza tiene un pequeño capital y su anhelo es ampliar su negocio de refrescos y abrir una tienda de venta de chifles (El chifle es un bocadillo del Perú y Ecuador. En el Perú es típico de la región de Piura. Consiste en rodajas o lonjas fritas de plátano verde o maduro).
texts.en:
During our visit to the communal bank "Virgen de Copacabana" we interviewed the partner Mariza. The communal bank meetings are every thirty days in the business office of the city of Ollantaytambo. Mariza is 36-years-old, married, and has two children (Luis Fernando, 14, who goes to school, and Ayde, 4, who's in nursery school). Mariza was born in Ollantaytambo and currently lives there. Her principle means of income is the sale of soft drinks in the "Virgen Asunta" market in Ollantaytambo, where she has a stand. She sells every day from 8 a.m. to 1 p.m. She's had this business for 13 or 14 years and it's going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Mariza is a charismatic, happy, and responsible person, and she's participated in the communal bank for several years; she's had success because she pays her loans back punctually. She requires this loan to buy edible products such as sugar, quinua (a grain-like crop with edible seeds), corn, apples, carrots, etc. Currently Mariza has a little bit of capital and her dream is to expand her soft drink business and open a store that sells chifles (El Chifle is a sandwich from Peru and Ecuador. In Peru it's commonly found in the Piura region. It consists of slices of fried plantains).

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, quinua, corn, apples, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Ugarte

texts.es: Ugarte, de 25 años, es un joven padre de familia, muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Nirce de 26 años y su querida hija Joyita de 2 años, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los largos días de trabajo que Ugarte tiene en sus chacras, le han hecho ver que tiene que trabajar muy duro para lograr una buena calidad en sus cultivos. Todas las mañanas, junto a los primeros rayos de sol, camina hasta sus campos donde están cultivados café, plátano, cacao y palta, las  cuales están a una hora aproximadamente. Durante estos 8 años de trabajo agrícola, considera que disfruta mucho del cultivo y lo hace con mucho esmero, pero parte de este trabajo tiene que tener mucho cuidado para que la plaga no ataquen y dañen sus cultivos. En lo sucesivo espera comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus cultivos. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente si desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. En su grupo comunal, es un compañero muy participativo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para aplicar y cuidar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ugarte is 25-years-old. He's a modest, hardworking young father. He lives in his own house with his wife Nirce, 26, and his beloved daughter Joyita, who's 2-years-old. They are the principle motivation for all his hard work. The long days of work that Ugarte puts in at his small farm have made him realize that he has to work very hard to achieve a good quality crop. Every morning at dawn he walks approximately one hour to his fields where he grows coffee, bananas, cacao, and avocado. During the past 8 years of agricultural work he's realized that he greatly enjoys farming and does it with much care, but part of the job is being very careful to avoid plagues which attack and damage the crop. In the future he hopes to buy new land to expand his crops. This is his third loan with MFP and he knows that he has to make his payments on time if he wants to gain access to other loans in the future. He's very active in his community. With the 2,000 PEN ($725) he's asking for he will buy more fertilizer for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Luís Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Luís Alberto B. ya ha tenido un crédito con FVP el cual pago puntual mente.
El solicitando un préstamo porque le esta haciendo falta la barda alrededor de su casa ya que vive con sus dos hijos y quiere la seguridad en la casa. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene como albañil de construcción, el señor Luís Alberto realizara la mejora en horario adicional a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Luis ALberto B. has already had a loan with FVP which he paid off on time. He is requesting a loan because he is building a perimeter wall around his home. He has two children and wants his home to be secure. He plans to pay back the loan with the income from his job as a construction worker. Luis will be improving his home in his spare time.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a perimeter wall for his home

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
Al visitar al  banco comunal “Virgen de Copacabana” entrevistamos a la socia Aydee. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina de atención de la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. 

Aydee, tiene 24 años, es casada, tiene una hija llamada Aydee y tiene seis años. Su actividad económica de Aydee es la venta de comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y muchas cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Aydee es una persona carismática, alegre y responsable y ya son varios años que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien gracias a la puntualidad de sus pagos, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo azúcar, leche, aceite, gaseosas, etc. La socia nos cuenta con mucha pena que su esposo falleció en un accidente de tránsito y está tratando superar el incidente.
texts.en:
When we visited the communal bank "Virgen de Copacabana” we interviewed the member Aydee. The communal bank meets every 30 days at the Asociación Arariwa offices in the city of Ollantaytambo. Aydee is 24 years old, married and has a daughter named Aydee who is 6 years old. Her main economic activity is the sale of groceries, for example: rice, sugar, noodles, and many other items. She has had this business now for a number of years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. Aydee is a cheerful, responsible and charming person who has participated in the communal bank for a number of years, and it is going very well thanks to her efforts to make her payments on time. She needs a loan to buy more merchandise such as sugar, milk, cooking oil, soft drinks, etc. She tells us with great sorrow that her husband died in a traffic accident and that she is trying to get through this difficult time.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise such as sugar, milk, cooking oil, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Maria De Lourdes le esta haciendo falta los acabados del exterior de la casa. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que obtiene como enfermera de una clínica, ya que es la fuente de ingreso de su familia tiene bajo su responsabilidad a un hijo adolescente y desea que termine sus estudios.
texts.en:
The outside of the house of Sra. Maria De Lourdes is not yet finished. She is asking for a loan so that she can buy materials and pay the person who is going to do the work. Maria plans to pay off the loan with part of the wages she earns from her job as a nurse at a clinic. She has a teenage daughter and wants her to complete her education.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to finish the outside of her house

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Al visitar al  banco comunal “Virgen de Copacabana” entrevistamos a la socia Andrea. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina de atención de la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. 

Andrea, tiene 50 años, es casada y tiene ocho hijos. Su actividad económica de Andrea es la venta de jugos de frutas en el mercado Virgen Asunta de la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ya son diez años que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien gracias a la puntualidad de sus pagos, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo azúcar y frutas. La socia nos cuenta con mucha pena que su yerno, el marido de su hija Aydee murió en un accidente de tránsito hace varios días atrás y están tratando superar el incidente.
texts.en:
Andrea recently visited the Virgen de Copacabana Community Bank where she told us about her life. The bank holds meetings every month in an office in Ollantaytambo’s town hall. She is 50 years old, married, and has eight children. Her job is selling fruit juice in the Virgen Asunta market in Ollantaytambo. She’s been doing this for a number of years and all is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Andrea has been a member of the bank for ten years and is always punctual with her repayments. She now needs a loan to buy more ingredients such as sugar and fruit. She told us she is very sad because her son-in-law, the husband of her daughter Aydee, died in a traffic accident a few days earlier, and she is trying to get over the tragedy.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar and fruit

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Maria Del Carmen M. esta agradecida por su cooperación en el crédito anterior el cual puedo realizar la mejora.
Esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para la elaboración de la barda trasera de su casa, porque hay terreno y hay muchos animales teme que puedan picar a su hijo. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que recibe por cuidar a unos niños y de limpieza en una casa, ya que su esposo el señor Arturo Rafael Zavala se encargara de los gastos familiares en el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como chofer de camión de carga.
texts.en:
Maria Del Carmen M. is grateful for your cooperation with the previous loan. She was able to make an improvement with the loan. She is requesting a new loan to build a fence in the back of her house. There are a lot of animals on the land there, and she is afraid they will be able to bite her son. She plans of paying the loan with the income she receives for taking care of some children and cleaning a house. Her husband, Arturo Rafael Zavala, will pay the family expenses from the salary he receives from his work as a cargo truck driver.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a fence in the back of her house

loans.name: Bohye Pa Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Charcoal is obtained from burning a piece of fresh timber in the absence of oxygen. It is one of the most common sources of energy for cooking in every traditional home. It is also the most affordable. Selling charcoal is one of the lucrative businesses for many women like Kate. She purchases bags of charcoal and has been selling them to customers in her community for the past two years. She also trades in firewood. She plans to invest this loan by purchasing more bags of charcoal and filling the demand for her firewood. She anticipates increasing her profit level and also expanding her market.

Kate is married to an auto mechanic and she is the mother of eight children aged 10-30. She describes herself as very confident. She hopes to purchase bags of charcoal in bulk to supply to restaurant operators. Kate believes in education and hopes to support her children to attain better education to be independent.

Kate is also the group leader of “Bohye Pa” Trust Bank Group made up of seven members. The other members of her group trade in rice, maize, materials etc.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo Fe y Esperanza, escogieron ese nombre porque se identifican con el y desean cumplir sus metas que cada uno se ha propuesto. Ellos se ubican en la comunidad de Valle de Chalco en el Estado de México. Los integrantes del grupo son: Eric Manuel Guzmán P. (Herrería), Salvador Antonio Guzmán Hernández (Herrería), Marcelina Bernabé C. (Panadería), Ana María Ramírez C. (Piñatas), María Irene Juárez G. (Bisutería), María de Lourdes P. T. (Bisutería), Adriana Guzmán P. (Zapatería), Cenobia M. O. (Taller de Costura), María de Jesús Márquez M. (Cosméticos por Catalogo), Elvia M. O. (Taller de costura) y Araceli M. V. (Estética)  

Ana María es integrante del grupo, tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo uno depende de ella. Desde hace 12 años comenzó con la elaboración de piñatas de cartón, este oficio lo aprendió primero su esposo, con el tiempo decidieron dedicarse completamente a este negocio, al principio les costo trabajo hacerse de su clientela pero gracias a sus esfuerzos lograron darse a conocer con diferentes personas, todos los lunes Ana se encarga de levantar los pedidos para la semana y así poder tener sus entregas a tiempo, gracias a que su trabajo es de buena calidad sus clientes la recomiendan con sus conocidos y la van a buscar hasta su domicilio. El crédito lo va a utilizar para la compra de sus materiales como: papel china de diferentes colores, cartón, pegamento, lazo y ojitos pagables. Sus planes son poder techar el espacio destinado para sus piñatas para que no se maltraten.

Así como Ana los demás integrantes desean cumplir sus expectativas para tener un futuro mejor para sus familias y agradecen de corazón la ayuda que les brinda Kiva a través de Fundación.
texts.en:
The name of this group is Fe y Esperanza (Faith and Hope). They selected this name because they identify with it, and they want to reach the goals that each one of them has set. They are located in the Valle de Chalco community in the state of México. The members of the group are: Eric Manuel Guzmán P. (Blacksmith shop) Salvador Antonio Guzmán Hernández (Blacksmith shop) Marcelina Bernabé C. (Bakery) Ana María Ramírez C. (Piñatas) María Irene Juárez G. (Sells jewelry) María de Lourdes P. T. (Sells jewelry) Adriana Guzmán P. (Shoe store) Cenobia M. O. (Seamstress shop) María de Jesús Márquez M. (Sells cosmetics by catalog) Elvia M. O. (Seamstress shop) Araceli M. V. (Beauty Salon) Ana María is a member of the group. She is 45, married, and has three children. They children are dependent upon her alone. Twelve years ago she started making piñatas from cardboard. Her husband learned this craft first. In time, they decided to devote themselves completely to this business. At the beginning it was a lot of work for them to get their customers. But, thanks to their efforts, they got to know different people. Every Monday Ana is in charge of getting the orders for the week. That way they are able to make their deliveries on time. Thanks to her good quality work, her customers recommend her to the people they know. They seek her out, even at home. She will use the loan to buy materials like: different colors of crepe paper, cardboard, glue, ribbon, and stick on eyes. Her plan is to be able to put a roof on the space meant for her piñatas so they are not damaged. Ana, like the rest of the members, wants to meet her expectations in order to have a better future for her family. They give their heartfelt thanks for the help Kiva has offered them through the Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy crepe paper, cardboard, glue, yeast, flour, cosmetic catalogs, and blacksmith materials like drafting squares, protractors, and profiles

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Women In Active-Lugazi Group

texts.en:
M. Prossy is a 50-year-old woman with a sparkly sense of humor. This has helped her strike a chord with most of her clients at her firewood sales business in Mbiko Kasanja-Lugazi. M. Prossy has, over the last 4 years, defied the stereotype that aging people like herself should just rely on their children and grandchildren to survive. Contrary to expectation, she has managed to establish a niche for herself amidst strong competition from other firewood sellers in a region where firewood can easily be obtained from the neighboring mabire forest. At her age, she is surprisingly single but happy with her status saying she is in a position to provide for all her 4 children without the support of a man. That to her matters more than anything else. 

M. Prossy began this business with savings from her teaching job. Hard work is also a factor that she attributes to her success. As she makes progress on the 120,000 UGX she makes in a week, she is also taking a long view. She says she wants to eventually open new business horizons for herself in the near future by opening up a grocery store. She is getting remuneration as a teacher since she is still in active service. With this loan, she is looking at buying more firewood to sell to her increasing clientele to earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
La señora Micaela R. tiene más de un año dedicándose a la venta de ropa nueva y novedades.
Esta solicitando un préstamo ya que le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía y no cuenta con el capital necesario para la inversión y no quiere descapitalizar su negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia. 
Es por eso que solicita su cooperación en este crédito, y así su negocio tendrá más mercancía para la venta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Micaela R. has worked for more than a year selling new clothing and novelty items. She is requesting a loan because her merchandise has declined and she does not have enough capital to invest on her own. She does not want to take away from her business because it is her family's only source of income. For this reason she asks for your help with the loan so that her business can have more merchandise available for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Olga Leticia

texts.es:
La señora Olga Leticia R. tiene ya más de cinco años dedicándose a la venta de teléfonos celulares.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio ya que desea vender accesorios y equipos más modernos pero en este momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para la inversión y esta solicitando su cooperación para que su negocio tenga mas inventario. Ya que es la fuente de ingreso para su familia y tiene dos hijos que actual mente están estudiando desea lo mejor para ellos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olga Leticia R. has worked selling cellular phones for more than 5 years. She is asking for a loan to invest in her business since she is desiring to sell accessories and more modern equipment and currently does not have the money to invest. She is asking for your cooperation so that her business can have more inventory. She provides for her family financially and desires the best for her two children who are currently studying.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter, de 42 años, es un padre de familia muy sincero y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Elena de 38 años y sus 3 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Las extensas tierras que posee, lo han convertido en uno de los principales productores de la zona, donde cultiva plátano, Kion y café. Sus productos los lleva a vender hasta la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde ya tiene compradores esperándolo, ya que sus cultivos son de muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho empeño, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus plantaciones de las plagas que perjudiquen su producción. En el futuro, desea comprar nuevas tierras y ampliar su siembra. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, está dispuesto a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y para eso ya está empezando a ahorrar. En su grupo comunal es un compañero muy alegre y siempre esta muy al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en sus reuniones. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Walter is a 42 year old father who is very sincere and hard-working. He lives in his own house with his wife, Elena, who is 38 years old, and their 3 young children, for whom he desires to provide a better quality of life. He owns a lot of land and has become one of the main producers in his area (cultivating bananas, ginger, and coffee). He transports his products to the city of Pichanaki to sell them to pre-arranged buyers since his produce is of very high quality. His favorite part of his job is harvesting his crops and he works very hard at it. He has been doing this activity for 10 years and believes that the hardest part is protecting his fields from the plagues that can harm crops. In the future he desires to buy more land and expand his fields. This is his third loan with MFP and he is prepared to make punctual payments. He has already started saving his money for this purpose. His community bank group considers him a very happy man who is always up to date with the news of those who attend their meetings. With the 2,500 nuevos soles he is requesting, he will purchase more fertilizer for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Nakazadde Womens Group-Lugazi

texts.en:
With a sense of purpose, hard work and self esteem in regards to doing business, one will never succumb to failure or any other obstacle that may dampen one's determination. N. Aisha, 24 years old, has been a testimony to this and she has built on the above virtues while still selling snacks, her previous business. With good planning and a strong belief in her own worth, she has prevailed.

Three years ago, she began her own shoe selling business in Lugazi market out of savings from her snack business. A close friend gave her a pep talk encouraging her to try her hand at this business. She also had her husband's support. She has, since then, relied on this business to provide for her family, especially her 2 children. She has reached a satisfactory rate of progress in her business transactions and is now planning on expanding and opening new horizons for her business. The first thing she wants to do is to construct her own permanent structure for her business. With 200,000 UGX as her monthly profit, prospects look good. She also wants to open an account where she will save her money for future investment. With this loan, Aisha wants to buy more shoes that she says she will resell to her increasing clientele.

loans.use: to buy more shoes

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Amalia R. le está haciendo falta los acabados del exterior de la casa pero por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material ya que uno de sus hijos de encargara de llevar acabo la obra. 
Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo y así realizar la mejora antes que llegue la temporada de lluvias. 
Doña Amalia vive con ella uno de sus  hijo el joven Abraham Romero Reyna quien le ayuda a los gastos de la casa y quien se encargara de pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
The home of Sra. Amalia R. is lacking the exterior finishes, but she does not have the necessary funds at the moment to buy materials to complete the work. One of her sons will be in charge of finishing the job.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can make this improvement before the rainy season begins.

Doña Amalia lives with one of her sons, Abraham Romero Reyna, the young man who helps with the household expenses and will be responsible for repaying the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to complete the exterior of her house

loans.name: Ntoboase Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Adwoa describes herself as a faithful woman. She is 41 years old and the leader of the “Ntoboase” (translated as Patience) borrower group made up five members. Adwoa is a merchant who has been selling gari, produced from cassava dough, for the past 5 years. She also engages in farming as her second business to make extra income. She is excited to be taking out this loan, which she plans to invest in purchasing bags of gari to serve her customers. She hopes to expand her market.  Adwoa is married to a farmer and she is the mother of four children aged 5-23. 

The other members of her group are also petty traders who sell fish, food, etc. As the leader of the group, she ensures regular meeting attendance and repayment of loan installments.

loans.use: To purchase bags of gari

loans.name: Martha Savina

texts.es:
Martha de 39 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil, (zona periurbana, con montañas y caminos de tierra). Ella es soltera con tres hijos, tiene una tienda desde hace años que le ha ayudado a mantener a sus hijos. 

Poco a poco Martha ha podido mantener a sus tres hijos, en la tienda vende arroz, aceite, enlatados y otros productos. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Para surtir mas su tienda ella quiere utilizar el préstamo para comprar arroz, aceites, azúcar para su negocio.   

En el futuro quiere que sus hijos terminen los estudios con éxito. Y poder ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Martha is 39 years old and lives in Fortín in Guayaquil (a mountainous periurban area with dirt roads). She is single and has three children. Martha has been managing a store for several years to help support her children.

Little by little, Martha has been able to provide for her three children. She sells rice, oil, canned goods, and other products in her store. Her business is open every day from 8am until 9pm. In order to stock her store with more inventory, she will use her loan to buy rice, oil, and sugar for her business.

In the future, she wants to see her children finish their studies successfully. She also wants to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, oil, and sugar

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina, de 38 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alberto de 40 años y sus 6 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. La tienda de Alejandrina es la primera en abrirse en su pueblo, desde las 6 de la mañana sus puertas ya están listas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su tienda no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su pueblo, lleva 1 año en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, anhela hacer crecer su negocio y brindarle a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a sus compañeras de su grupo comunal, en donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone en su grupo. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, 38, is a cheerful and hardworking mother who lives in her own home together with her husband, Alberto, 40, and their 6 dear children. They are the main reason that she makes all these efforts. Alejandrina’s store is the first to open in her village. Starting at 6 am her doors are open for the early morning customers who know that they can find all types of merchandise in her store and don’t hesitate to shop there. They always know that they will find all the items that the need. What she most likes about her work is chatting with the customers and finding out about what is going on in the village. She has been in this business for 1 year; what she finds the most difficult is staying inside the store all day without being able to leave. With time she would like to have her business grow and be able to offer her customers better service. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she hopes to be able to repay it on time, because she doesn’t want to cause any problems for her companions in the communal bank. She is very respected there because of the care she takes with the group. With the two thousand new sols that she is requesting, she will buy more products to better stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more products to supply her store

loans.name: Adwen Pa Trust  Bank Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth describes herself as a hard working woman. She is 56 years old and the leader of the “Adwen pa” (translated as Good thought) borrower group. Elizabeth is a petty trader who has been selling fresh yams for the past 4 years. She also engages in farming as her second business to make extra income for her family. She is excited to be taking out this loan, which she will use to purchase 100 tubers of yam. She dreams of being able to expand her market and increase her stocks to 1000 tubers of yam. She is married to a farmer with four children. Elizabeth hopes to mobilize more savings to provide quality education for her children.

The other members of her group are mostly traders who sell rice, meat, food etc. As the leader, Elizabeth ensures regular meeting attendance and repayment of loan installments.

loans.use: To purchase tubers of yam in bulk

loans.name: Abrabo Pa Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Adjei is a very resourceful man. He is married to a trader with four children aged 4-8. He is now 39 years old. He loves selling cereals like maize, a business through which he makes a living for his family. Adjei has sold maize for the past two years. He plans to invest the loan to purchase more bags of maize to fill the demand. He anticipates an increased profit to take care of his children in school.

Adjei is currently the leader of a trust bank group called “Abrabo pa” (translated as Good Life) made up of 5 members. As the leader of the group, he ensures regular meeting attendance and repayment of loan installments.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica, de 23 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Julio de 34 años y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes desea brindarle un mejor futuro. Trabajando arduamente ha logrado sacar adelante su sembra, desde entonces se levanta todas las mañana para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus cultivo de papa y alverja, para ser comercializadas en su totalidad en la ciudad de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus campos, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra. Con el tiempo, espera poder adecuar la mayoría de sus tierras para el sembrado de alverja, ya que por estas fechas es lo que mejor se vende. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su grupo comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Angélica is 23 years old and a loving cheerful mother. She lives in her own home with her husband Julio, age 34, and their two small children for whom she wants to provide a better future. Angélica and her husband work hard to succeed at farming. They wake up early every morning to water and care for their crop of potatoes and peas. Their entire harvest is sold in the city of Tarma, which is where they get the best prices for their products. What she likes most about her work is the freedom to move about her fields. She has been farming for six years and considers the most difficult part to be working the land. Over time she hopes to appropriate more land for growing peas since this crop has been selling well lately.

This is her second loan with MFP. Angélica knows that this loan will help her advance and develop her business, so she is determined to complete her payments on time. She is a very responsible member of her Communal Bank, which explains why she is greatly admired. The loan of 2000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more compost to improve the quality of her land.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Vicenta Aquilina

texts.es:
Vicenta de 48 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, (zona periurbana, con montañas y caminos de tierra). Es madre soltera con dos hijos, tiene un pequeño restaurante que le ha ayudado a mantener a sus hijos. 

Antes de tener su restaurante ella le vendía tres almuerzos diarios a sus amigos, poco a poco incremento mas sus ventas ya que la comida era muy buena. Ahora ha podido estar estable económicamente y tiene una tienda surtida, vende arroz, legumbres, enlatados. Trabaja con su hija menor desde las 09h00am. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar sillas y mesas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere remodelar su restaurante para que sus clientes estén mas cómodo.
texts.en:
Vicenta is 48 years old and lives in Paraíso in Guayaquil (a mountainous periurban area with dirt roads). She is a single mother with two children. Vicenta has a small restaurant that helps her support her children.

Prior to having her restaurant, Vicenta sold three lunches per day to her friends. She gradually increased her sales since her food is known to be very good. Vicenta is now able to maintain financial stability and keep a stocked pantry with rice, legumes, and canned goods. She works with her youngest daughter starting at 9am.

Vicenta will use her loan to buy chairs and tables for her business. In the future, she wants to remodel her restaurant so that her customers will be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chairs & tables

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: Emilio, de 42 años, es un padre de familia muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Sonia de 41 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarle una mejor educación. Los campos de sembrado que con tanto esfuerzo ha conseguido Emilio, son el principal sustento que tiene su familia. Los productos que cosecha son muy solicitados en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que su fama de obtener una buena calidad de productos, le favorece mucho en la venta de éstos y a muy buen precio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar su siembra de las plagas que pueden afectar su cosecha. Lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que transportar los sacos de papa, alverja, habas y oca, ya que son muy pesados y le cansan mucho. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras, para poder ampliar su producción. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su grupo comunal es un compañero muy alegre y siempre pone orden en sus reuniones. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono, para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en:
Emilio is 42 years old and a cheerful hardworking father. He lives in his own home with his wife Sonia, age 41, and their five beloved children for whom he wants to provide a better education. The fields in which he works so hard to plant provide the main source of income for his family. His products are very popular at the wholesale market in Tarma, where he is known for offering high quality goods. Emilio is able to generate favorable sales and obtain a good price. What he enjoys most about his work is caring for his crops and protecting them from pests that can impact his harvest. He has been farming for 25 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting sacks of potatoes, peas, beans, and oca that are quite heavy and exhausting to carry. Sometime later he hopes to buy additional land so that he can increase his production.

This is his sixth loan with MFP. Emilio knows that these funds will be very beneficial in developing his business. He is one of the happiest members of his Communal Bank and always tries to restore order during the meetings. The loan of 1500 PEN that he requested will be used to buy compost to make his land more fertile.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: La Capilla Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA LA CAPILLA YA QUE ASI SE LLAMA LA COMUNIDAD EN LA QUE VIVEN ESTE GRUPO ESTA FORMADO POR 13 PERSONAS LAS CUALES BUSCAN UNA MEJORA EN SU CALIDAD DE VIDA Y SUS ACTIVIDADES SON: RAQUEL, JOSE LUIS, ROBERTA SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA DE ROPA AMBULANTE, PORFIRIA, ARACELI, SILVIA SE DEDICAN A VENDER ZAPATOS Y PERFUMES POR CATALOGO, ANTONIA Y TERESA A LA VENTA DE VERDURA,GUADALUPE TIENE UN TALLER MECANICO, MIGUEL Y ANGELA VENDEN PRODUCTOS DOMESTICOS, REYNA TIENE UN TALLERSITO DE COSTURA EN SU CASA Y PETRA VENDE DULCES AFUERA DE SU DOMICILIO.
LA SRA. PETRA ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO LA CAPILLA ELLA ES VIUDA TODOS SUS HIJOS YA ESTAN CASADOS DOÑA PETRA LLEVA 8 AÑOS VENDIENDO DULCES AFUERA DE SU CASA Y ESPERA PODER AGRANDAR SU PUESTO POCO A POCO YA QUE LE VA MUY BIEN POR QUE ENFRENTE DE SU NEGOCIO ESTA LA SECUNDARIA Y UN KINDER Y EN LA SALIDA DE LAS ESCUELAS ES CUANDO VENDE MAS.
CON ESTE CREDITO QUIERE COMPRAR PAPAS FRITAS, FRITURAS, DULCES DE LECHE LLAMADOS DUVALIN, PALETAS DE CHILE, DULCES DE TAMARINDO COMO "PELON PELORICO", ETC; Y DE TODO UN POCO DE DULCES PARA SURTIR SU NEGOCIO PARA QUE ELLA PUEDA SOLVENTAR SUS GASTOS Y SALIR ADELANTE YA QUE COMENTA NO LE GUSTA DEPENDER MUCHO DE SUS HIJOS POR QUE YA ESTAN CASADOS Y ELLOS YA TIENEN SUS OBLIGACIONES.
TODOS ESTOS DULCES SON MUY CONOCIDOS EN MEXICO Y DESDE LOS PADRES Y ABUELOS DE LOS NIÑOS YA LOS CONOCÍAN DOÑA PEDRA DICE: "NO HAY PERSONA AQUÍ QUE VENGA Y NO RECUERDE SU NIÑEZ, HAY OCASIONES QUE ME COMPRAN MAS DULCES LOS PAPÁS QUE LOS HIJOS". 
DOÑA PETRA COMENTA QUE SE SIENTE MUY AGUSTO CON EL GRUPO YA QUE ES UN GRUPO QUE NUNCA HA FALLADO CON SUS PAGOS Y ESPERAN SEGUIR ASI PARA QUE TANTO FUNDACION REALIDAD COMO KIVA LOS PUEDAN SEGUIR APOYANDO
texts.en:
This group is called “La Capilla” (The Chapel), which is also the name of the community where the members live. The group consists of 13 individuals who are looking for a better quality of life. Their business activities are as follows:

• Raquel, Jose Luis, and Roberta sell clothing as traveling merchants. • Porfiria, Araceli, and Silvia sell shoes and perfumes through catalogs. • Antonia and Teresa sell vegetables. • Guadalupe runs a mechanic’s workshop. • Miguel and Angela sell household products. • Reyna has a small sewing workshop in her home. • Petra sells candy outside of her home.

Sra. Petra is a member of “La Capilla” Group. She is a widow and all of her children are married. Doña Petra has been selling candy outside of her home for eight years and hopes to expand her vending stand a little bit at a time. Her business has done very well since it is near a high school and a kindergarten. She sells more when the school day ends.

With this loan she wants to buy French fries, fritters, milk candy called “Duvalin”, lollipops covered in chili powder, tamarind candy called “Pelón Pelo Rico”, and other products. She tries to provide a little bit of everything sweet, so she keeps her business well-stocked in order to cover her expenses and get ahead. Petra says she does not like having to depend on her children since they are already married and have their own obligations.

All of these candies are well-known throughout Mexico, especially among the parents and grandparents of the children. Doña Petra says, “There is not a single person who comes here without remembering one’s childhood. There have been times when the parents buy more candy from me than the children.” She says she feels comfortable working with her group, which has never failed in making their payments. They hope to continue working in the same manner so that they can maintain the support they receive from Fundación Realidad as well as Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various candies & fried foods

loans.name: El Sombrerito Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SOLIDARIO SE LLAMA EL SOMBRERITO POR QUE  EN TLAYACAPAN ASI SE LLAMA EL CERRO, ESTA UBICADO EN LA COMUNIDAD DE TLAYACAPAN, EN EL ESTADO DE MORELOS, MEXICO, EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 5 INTEGRANTES QUE SE CONOCEN YA DE TIEMPO, ESTE ES SU PRIMER PRESTAMO CON FUNDACION REALIDAD.
LA INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO LA SEÑORA REYNA S. G. TIENE 39 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTUDIO HASTA EL 3er. AÑO DE SECUNDARIA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS, 2 HOMBRES Y 1 MUJER, VICTOR EDUARDO TIENE 20 AÑOS, OMAR TIENE 17 AÑOS Y ALINE BERENICE TIENE 6 AÑOS, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA VENTA DE JOYAS DE ORO Y PLATA, ELLA VA A UTILIZAR SU CREDITO PARA COMPRA  BROQUELES, CADENAS, MEDALLAS, ARETES, ANILLOS Y PULCERAS, INICIO SU NEGOCIO HACE TRES AÑOS LE AYUDABA A SU AMIGA A VENDER PERO SE CASO Y SE FUE A VIVIR A OTRA COMUNIDAD ASI QUE DECIDO COMENZAR CON EL NEGOCIO  DE VENTAS DE JOYAS DE ORO Y PLATA CON SUS VECINOS Y VA OFRECIENDO LAS JOYAS CASA POR CASA. CADA QUINCE DIAS VIAJA A IGUALA  PARA SURTIRSE DE MERCANCIA. A ELLA LE GUSTA MUCHO SU NEGOCIO POR QUE LE DEJAN UTILIDADES LO DOBLE DE LO QUE INVIERTE, NO DESCUIDA A SUS HIJOS Y LE SIRVE DE DISTRACCION.  LAS GANACIAS LAS VUELVE A INVERTIR Y CUANDO SUS HIJOS OCUPAN ALGO PARA LA ESCUELA DE AHÍ LO TOMA 
LOS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON:
ANA MARIA M. R. CON SU PRESTAMO VA A COMPRAR MERCANCIA LECHE, REFRESCOS, AZUCAR, SOPAS, ACEITE, CHILES SECOS, JABON ETC. PARA SURTIR SU TIENDA.
GODELEVA P. P. VA A COMPRA COLCHAS, EDREDONES, BATAS PAR DORMIR, TOALLAS, SABANAS PARA SURTIR SU NEGOCIO.
ELENA O. H. VA A COMPRAR SABANAS, COLCHAS MATRIMONIALES E INDIVIDUALES PÓR PAQUETES YA QUE SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE BLANCOS.
CATALINA H. S. VA A COMPRAR ZAPATO PARA DAMA Y CABALLERO.   
LOS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO ESTAN MUY CONTENTO CON EL PRESTAMO QUE LE DIO FUNDACION REALIDAD Y KIVA POR QUE LES AYUDA A  CRESER A SUS NEGOCIOS Y A SUS FAMILIAS
texts.en:
This solidarity goup is called "El Sombrerito" because that's the name of a hill in Tlayacapan which is located in the state of Morelos, Mexico. The group is made up 5 members who have known each other for some time. This is their first loan with Fundacion Realidad. The group's organizer is Mrs. Reyna S. G. who is 39 years old and has completed 3 years of a high school education. She has 3 Children: Victor Eduardo, a 20 year old male, Omar is a 17 year old male, and Aline Berenice, a 6 year old female. Mrs. G. buys and sells gold and silver jewelry. The business originated 3 years ago after a friend she used to sell with moved away so she decided to sell gold and silver jewelry to her neighbors. She now sells her jewelry door to door and travels to Iguala every 15 days to stock up on merchandise. She will be using her loan to purchase studs, chains, medals, earrings, rings, and bracelets. She likes her business very much because she doubles her investment, it allows her to care for her children, and it serves as a distraction. She re-invests her earnings and only takes out when her children need something for school. Members of the group are: Ana Maria M. R. who will use the loan to stock up on merchandise like: milk, soda beverages, sugar, soups, cooking oil, dried spices, soap, etc., so she can stock her store. Godeleva P. P. will purchase bed sheets, quilts, sleeping garments, and towels to stock her business. Elena O. H. will purchase, sheets, and bed spreads in bulk since she sells them individually. Catalina H. S. will be purchasing men and women's shoes. Members of the group are very happy with the loan given by Fundacion Realidad and Kiva because it allows them to grow their businesses and families.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Gold Jewelry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Paraiso De Los Claveles Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SOLIDARIO SE LLAMA PARAISO DE LOS CLAVELES, ESTA UBICADO EN TEPALCINGO, ESTADO DE MORELOS, MEXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 4 INTEGRANTES QUE SE CONOCEN Y SON VECINOS.
 LA INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO VIOLETA A. A. TIENE 40 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTUDIO HASTA EL 3º. AÑO DE LA SECUNDARIA, TIENE 2 HIJOS 1 HOMBRE Y 1 MUJER, DAVID ALEXIS TIENE 15 AÑOS, Y DIANA KAREN TIENE 11 AÑOS LOS DOS ESTAN ESTUDIANDO. ELLA TIENE UNA CARNICERIA, Y VA A UTILIZAR SU PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR CERDOS VIVOS PARA LA VENTA DE CARNE Y SUS DERIVADOS POR KILO. LOS PRODUCTOS QUE SE OFRECEN SON CARNE, BISTESES, CHICHARRON, CARNE ENCHILADA, LONGANIZA, MANTECA, CHALES.
